loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet sells bags of rice and cooking oil. She would like to expand her business, and is hoping for a loan of NGN 160,000 to purchase more bags of rice and cooking oil to sell. She hopes to lift her business above poverty. Her husband is a technician and they have four children. Her husband also supports the home. Her four children attend school and she hopes they will graduate in the future. Her youngest child is three years old. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita N. is a 39-year-old woman, married and blessed with seven children. She and her husband work together to raised their big family. They are currently living at Taghangin, Morong Rizal, Philippines. She is also a woman of good faith to conquer all challenges to achieve family dreams. 

Nenita’s main goal is to build a sustainable business to meet the needs of her seven children; she was thus encouraged to join ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2004. The previous loans she received from ASHI were carefully invested in her variety store. Since then, the business has been performing well and earning her sufficient profit. She is grateful that she has been able to educate her children using proceeds from her business as she continues to expand. Nenita needs a loan to help boost her business for increased profit making.

She runs a variety store. She started her variety store through her initiative of dealing with customers. She wants to continue her business. She is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to use for additional capital to improve her business and her income. Specifically, the money will use to purchase five sacks of rice, charcoal, sugar, canned goods, cigarettes, fabric conditioner, and other inventory for her variety store. 

She dreams of growing her variety store into a mini-grocery store and expanding it to another village. Her seven children are her inspiration to pursue her variety store. She now feels very happy with the service of ASHI and KIVA. It gives them a big chance to pursue their family dreams. She hopes that they continue the service for a long time and help many families who want to get ahead.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her variety store.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas has worked as a van driver for the past 15 years. He is 26 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. He offers his transportation services in his town and its surroundings. He also works on a private basis upon request of his clients, such as for picnics, private travels, etc., to make extra money for his family. He has consistently paid on time and he has even repaid the full loan amount earlier than his scheduled end date. 

And today, Abbas is requesting a new loan of $1,500 to carry out maintenance work on his van to increase its safety features.

loans.use: To carry out maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen S., aged 42, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She stays at home as a housewife to look after her children and do the household chores. Her husband is a soldier for his province, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family's expenses and the children’s education. Chen S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a plot of farmland to start a business as a farmer to generate another source of income for the family. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is widowed with two children in school.   She mines building stones in her quarry to earn a living.  She has been in the business for six years and has two employees.  She also practices farming to earn enough money to support her family since she is the breadwinner.   She is in a group of young entrepreneurs in Faulu Kenya called Kwale where she saves her money, hence enabling her to borrow loans.  She has requested a loan of Kes. 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to finance the entire quarry activity.   She hopes to own more quarry sites and improve her living standards in the future.

loans.use: To finance quarrying activities

loans.name: Kusum

texts.en:
Kusum is a 46-year-old married woman living in Telijjawila, in the Matara area of Sri Lanka.  She has two sons who are 19 and 11 years old.

Kusum runs a fortune-telling business, which she has been doing for seven years with the help of her husband and son.  Her customers come to her to have their fortunes read and predicted, a common practice in Sri Lanka. 

She has requested a 50,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business.  She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka for the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To help expand her fortune-telling business

loans.name: Felix Calizto

texts.es:
Felix de 47 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos que estudian en la escuela, el antes de conocer a su esposa era albañil/ carpintero, pero al casarse necesitaba mas ingresos, decidió invertir sus ahorros en cuadernos y readecuo su casa para ubicar su papelería en la sala de su casa ya que no tiene dinero para alquilar un lugar.  

Poco a poco fue incrementando su papelería, hasta ahora que tiene muy surtido su negocio, ha implementado vender peluches y perfumes. Con el préstamo quiere comprar pintura y tejas para arreglar su casa. En el futuro quiere tener un local.
texts.en:
47-year old Felix lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. He has two children who attend school. Before he met his wife, he was a builder/carpenter, but when he got married, he needed more income so he decided to invest his savings in school supplies. He altered his house so that he could run a stationery store out of the living room since he didn’t have enough money to rent separate premises. Over time Felix increased his merchandise so that he currently has a very well-stocked store. As well as stationery, he now sells soft toys and perfume. With the loan he wants to buy paint and tiles to fix up his house. In the future he wants to have his own store in a separate location.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy paint and tiles

loans.name: Joaquim Ricardo

texts.pt:
Joaquim Ricardo G. nasceu no Distrito de Manhiça, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 27 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 06 e 02 anos de idade, todos ainda não vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras pois perdeu o pai ainda novo. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 irmãos que vivem com ele.
Saiu de Manhiça para o Distrito de Boane com os seus pais ainda muito novo. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 2 anos, também é construtor de casas de alvenaria. Possui um empregado que lhe auxilia nos seus trabalhos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 9.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa) mensal.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua mãe que também é clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 9.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pares de sapato para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no comércio e um dos sonhos é ter um estabelecimento comercial condigno.
texts.en:
Joaquim Ricardo G. was born in Manhiça District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is 27 years old, married, and has two children who are 6 and 2 years old. Neither of the children goes to school yet. Joaquim only finished eighth grade and did not continue school because of financial problems, as he lost his father while still young. He lives in his own house with his family and supports two brothers who live with him. Joaquim left Manhiça to move to Boane District with his parents when he was very young. For more than two years he has had his own shoe resale business. He also builds brick houses. He has one employee who helps him with his work, and he earns about 9,000 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses and still manages to save some money through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). He has never had loans from other banks. Joaquim learned about Hluvuku through his mother, who is also a customer of this institution. This is his first loan. He is asking for 9,000 meticias to buy pairs of shoes so he can increase his inventory. He promises to pay off this loan on time so he will be able to take out more loans. In the future, he intends to ask for more loans to use in his business, and one of his dreams is to have a nice shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pairs of shoes for resale

loans.name: Albino

texts.es: Albino, de 47 años, es un padre muy responsable y amoroso, viudo y desde entonces comparte su vida en compañía de sus 2 queridos hijos en su casa propia. La actividad a la que se dedica Albino, es el cultivo de plátano y café. Las extensas tierras que posee, lo han convertido en uno de los principales productores de la zona. Sus productos los lleva a vender a la ciudad de “La Merced”, donde ya tiene compradores esperándolo, puesto que siempre ofrece cultivos de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar el café y lo hace con mucho empeño, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. En el futuro, desea comprar un carro, con el cual pueda transportar sus productos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y para eso ya está empezando a ahorrar. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre esta muy al tanto de los acuerdos que tiene con sus compañeros. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus tierras, también invertirá en fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Albino, 47, is a very responsible and loving father. He is a widower, and since then has shared his life with his 2 beloved children in their own home. He cultivates bananas and coffee. With his vast lands he has become one of the main producers in the area. He brings his produce to the city of La Merced, where he already has customers waiting for him, since he always offers produce of very high quality. What he most likes about his job is harvesting the coffee, which he does with much effort. He has been doing this for 30 years and considers the most difficult part to be keeping his crops safe from the pests that can affect them. In the future, he wants to buy a car, with which he will be able to transport his products. This is his second loan with MFP, and he is prepared to pay his quotas punctually and he has already started to save up. In his community group he is a very happy member and is always very aware of the agreements he has with his peers. With the 1000 soles he is requesting, he will purchase more manure for his land, and also invest in fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of manure for the care of his farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is Mary M., age 44, who is currently in the business of selling maize flour and rice at her local market. She is requesting a loan in order to stock beans and pulses to sell. Mary and her husband have four children, all of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up her own shop.

About BRAC:

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights services, and legal services, all of which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is paticularly targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock beans and pulses to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Eark Suon Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people live in Rung village in Takeo province and they are made up a village bank loan. Mrs. Eark S. is a village bank president who was born in 1983. She is a farmer who owns one point five-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Phoeurn Phen, is a laborer. Now a day, she has some problem because her field is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Eark S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and rest of the loan she hires plow machine to plow her field. She is a mother of two children whom all are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Fatoumata Dite Tata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata dite Tata Traoré  est âgée de 34 ans, mariée  et mère  de 5 enfants.  Elle  vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le  quartier Bagadadji de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle abandonna l’école en classe de 6 ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour  mener le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des habits et chaussures au marché de Kati. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à ses côtés, Fatoumata a pu maîtriser les rouages du petit commerce. Par la suite, elle a évolué de ses propres ailes pour mener la même activité que sa mère. Elle vend des habits, des couvertures, des draps de lit, des chaussures depuis 15 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation dans le quartier. 
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est 1er  prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 5 couvertures  et 5 pièces de pagnes brodés. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes.
Madame Fatoumata dite Tata Traoré  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari et de participer aux événements sociaux (baptême, mariage etc.). 
Son ambition est  de faire le commerce entre le Mali et l’Arabie Saoudite.
texts.en:
Mrs.Fatoumata (nicknamed Tata) Traoré is 34 years old, married and the mother of five children.She lives with her husband and children in the Bagadadji neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative district of the Republic of Mali). She left school in the sixth year of elementary school (under the school system of Mali) in order to work beside her mother who sold clothes and shoes in the market at Kati. After several years of apprenticeship along side her mother, Fatoumata was able to master trading on a small scale. Later, she developed her own wings and was able to carry out the same activity as her mother. She has been selling clothes, blankets, sheets and shoes for fifteen years and has a strong reputation in the neighborhood. With the goal of increasing her working capital, in order to make more profit, Fatoumata has turned to Soro Yiriwaso. This is her first individual loan, and she plans to use it to buy 5 blankets and 5 pieces of embroidered "pagne" (printed cotton fabric). Fatoumata obtains her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako, then she sells for cash and on credit to customers who are, for the most part, women. With this loan, she plans to make a monthly profit of 60,000 CFA. This will enable her to help her husband and to participate in social events (baptisms, weddings, etc.). Her ambition is to trade between Mali and Saudi Arabia.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy printed fabric ("pagnes") and blankets

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget P., 44, is married with five children living at home in the Takeo province. She raises pigs, typically making $2 (USD) each day, and her husband sells firewood. Her husband’s income is $4 each day. Nget P. would like a loan of $650 to purchase more wood to sell.

loans.use: Sell wood.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en: Mwanatumu is a married woman who has four children, all attending school. She has been operating a food stall, selling food at the market to the market dwellers. With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice and beans. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mwanatumu hopes to open a restaurant in the future. Her major aim of working with Yehu is to get a loan to finance her business. She owns a house with electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, rice and beans.

loans.name: Stazia Group

texts.en:
Hadija O. is in her mid-forties and is married with five children. She has been operating a small shop selling drinks at Dar es Salaam for around twenty years now. She works from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hadija’s 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Her previous loans were used to expand her business as well as paying for her children’s school fees and all were successfully repaid. She hopes for this loan so that she can increase her stock of soft drinks.

Hadija will share her loan with her loan group, Stazia, which totals fifteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

In the photo, Hadija is the second from right in the middle, wearing a blue blouse.

loans.use: To increase her stock of soft drinks

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
la señora  Maria Isabel M. tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos.
se dedica al negocio de venta de abarroteria desde hace ya 3 años, comenzo con una bodega en el mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo en la cual no tubo éxito, luego traslado su negocio a su residencia en la comunidad del Chocolate Pespire, se ha establecido y sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos de la zona que llegan a comprar lo que necesitan para su hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio.
 
su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales y hombres y mujeres de bien.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Isabel M., 34, is married with three children.  She has operated a corner grocery for 3 years.  She started with a shop in the new market at San Lorenzo, but that wasn't successful so she moved the business to her house in the Chocalate Pespire neighborhood.  She is well established there.  Her customers are her friends and neighbors who come to buy the everyday products that they need at home.  Sra. Maria will use the loan to buy merchandise for stocking her business.
 
Sra. Maria's greatest hope is that her children grow up to be good men and women and that they find work as salaried employees.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Perisi

texts.en: Perisi N. is 34 years old and is married to a businessman. She has four children and her children go to school. Perisi is currently in the business of selling beer and soda and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and soda to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Doki

texts.en: Doki V. has a general store and is requesting a loan to stock more goods such as bags of sugar and cartons of salt to sell. Doki is 42 years old and married to a business man. She has six children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more goods such as sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel L. is from the village of Tupsan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old. Marifel is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marifel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying, dealing and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, lotions and detergents in the local community. Marifel has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marifel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marifel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marifel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

loans.name: María Trancito

texts.es:
La Señora. María G. es socia del banco comunal Poloma, vive en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es de clima frió y se encuentra al suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene como atractivos turísticos el sector conocido como el Verde cerro que fue sagrado para los Cañaris y de donde se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente mantiene sus tradiciones y cultura.

La Señora. María tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 15, 12, 11, 8, 4 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, sus tres hijos siguientes  estudian en la escuela y los dos últimos están en una guardería. Su esposo es maestro en la construcción y labora como albañil, tienen casa propia la misma que ha sido construida con el trabajo conyugal. 

Doña María se dedica a  realizar artesanías como son los sombreros de paja toquilla, actividad que la realiza hace 16 años, aprendiendo el oficio que sus padres le han enseñado. También se dedica a la cría y venta de animales como son cerdos, cuyes y pollos los que son también para el consumo de su hogar.

Se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para así ir incrementando más animales. Su meta es hacer algunos arreglos a su casa ya que lo necesita.
texts.en:
Mrs. María G. is a member of the Poloma communal bank located in Valle parish.  This is a cold climate parish in southwest Cuenca.  As a tourist attraction it has a sector known as El Verde which was a hill sacred to the Cañari people (ancient inhabitants of the territory of the modern provinces of Azuay and Cañar) from which one can observe a great deal of Cuenca.  Its people maintain its traditions and culture.

María is 35 years old, married and has six children who are 15, 12, 11, 8, 4 and 2 years of age.  Her oldest son works and helps with family expenses.  Her next three children are in school and the last two are in day care.  Her husband is a master builder and works as a bricklayer.  They own their house which they have built through their work as a couple.

María has been a craftswoman for 16 years making Panama hats.  She learned this skill from her parents.  She also raises pigs, guinea pigs and chickens to sell and for home consumption.

She is in her 4th loan with the communal bank.  She will use the new loan to buy a cow to add to her herd.  Her goal is to do some needed home repairs.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Mavlon

texts.ru: Чорикулов Мавлон проживает в районе Кубодиён. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается строительными работами по найму. Кроме того он более 6 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива, чтобы посеет и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Mavlon C. lives in Qubadiyon.  He is 36 years old, married, and has five children.  He has a high school education.  He is a day laborer in construction.  Additionally, he has been working in agriculture for six years.  He has a plot of land at his home where he grows vegetables.  He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel in order to plant and to receive a good harvest.

loans.use: buying mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a thirty-two-year-old hard-working married man with five children, living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a family goal of educating his children up to university. For five years he has been in farming and the retail trade which has facilitated him in providing the basics for the family. His mission is to become a wholesale trader although he still has challenges of insufficient capital to meet the demand of his customers.Haruna needs the loan to buy soft drinks, sugar and rice for sale.

loans.use: Buying soft drinks, sugar, and rice for sale

loans.name: Venus

texts.en: Venus L., one of our CCT* partners, is a doting grandmother with a golden heart. Venus reached third year in college. She is a widow with college children, some of whom are already married. At present, she is working very hard, making sure that her variety store is making profit to meet the daily needs of her family. Together with her children, she lives in Camarin, Caloocan City. Venus runs a sari-sari (variety store) in her community. She has been meeting the daily needs of her community for five years, selling retail items like canned goods, shampoo and detergents. Monthly, she earns an average net income of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). To further help her with her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. Venus intends to use this money to add to the set of goods she has on display in her store. She believes that having more products for sale will help her business grow. At present, Venus is having problems with the debts of her customers who fail to pay on time. Her young grandchildren also often get food and other items from her store without paying, thinking that Grandma will understand. Nevertheless, Venus plans to resolve this issue and come up with a bigger, better store – not just to serve her community, but to help her family as well. It is still in Venus's golden heart to be able to help her children establish their own families and bless her grandchildren with a good future. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her variety store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.ar:
يبلغ مقترض كيفا من العمر 27 عاما" وهو أعزب يعيش مع عائلته واخوته الثلاث في لبنان.
يساعد اهله في مصاريف العائلة و يملك منذ العام 2008 سوبرماركت حيث يعمل بكامل طاقته لتغطية كافة المصاريف.
يرغب هذا المقترض باقتراض من كيفا مبلغ وقدره 1200$ بحيث يريد شراء بضاعة لتقوية مصلحته فيكون بذلك قادرا"
على زيادة مدخوله الشهري وتحسين معيشته وبالتالي معيشة عائلته.
texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is 27, unmarried, and lives with his family and three brothers in Lebanon.  
He helps his relatives with the family expenses and since 2008 has owned a supermarket where he spends all his energy working to cover the expenses.  The borrower wishes to take a loan of $1200 from Kiva in order to buy more goods to be able to increase store earnings, which would increase his monthly income and raise the standard of living for him and his family.

loans.use: Purchasing goods to increase store earnings

loans.name: Georgette

texts.en:
Georgette is a married woman who lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a business selling fish. Her husband Arnie, who is 39 years old, works as a plumber to earn his living.  They have three children who are 2 to 13 years old. Georgette joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Georgette has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 30,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000. She intends to use the loan to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for children's education and family needs. Georgette is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: G.s. Los Cocos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Los Cocos están conformados por Maria Isidora y Cristiana De La Concepción. Cristina se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de costura, ella es una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta mucho de su actividad, la mayoría de sus clientes asisten a su vivienda pues ellos conocen la buena calidad de sus prendas de vestir. Uno de los desafíos que enfrenta es que tiene 2 hijos que son enfermos, pues siempre está buscando la manera de salir adelante. Maria se dedica a la venta de leche, hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy productivo para mantener a su familia. Ellas se han unido para realizar este financiamiento que es destinado para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en: The group named Los Cocos is made up of Maria Isidora and Cristiana De La Conception. Cristiana has a tailoring business. She is a very enterprising individual and she greatly enjoys her occupation. The majority of her clients come to her house, knowing the good quality clothing she makes. One of the challenges that she faces is that she has 2 children who are ill. So she is always looking for a way to come out ahead. Maria has been selling milk for the past 6 years. It has been very helpful in supporting her family. They came together to access a loan.  The loan will be used to purchase materials.

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 45 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 9 and 24.  He does tailoring so as to earn his daily bread.  He has been in the business for twenty years.  He has employed two people to help him in his tasks.  He also does farming to supplement his income.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has managed to buy a piece of land and grow his business.  He has requested 50,000 Kes to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Lavella

texts.en: Lavella P. is 35 years old, married, and has two children. They live in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. Lavella is engaged in farming. She primarily grows rice to sell. Lavella also manages a store that has been running for a year. She sells biscuits, canned goods, and other products.Lavella is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell. She hopes for her businesses to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian E. is from the city of Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old. Lilian is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Lilian operates a motorcycle-transport service. Lilian has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2011, Lilian joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilian is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Lilian from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Takku Liggey est composé de 24 femmes. C'est un nouveau groupe du Banc Villageois de Ndame Keur Guiry qui est inauguré le 8 avril 2011. Les femmes habitent ensemble, elles sont amies et voisines et l'activité principale menée est l'embouche mais parallèlement elles font du petit commerce.

La responsable Amy N. est mariée et a un enfant, elle a en charge sa belle sœur qui habite chez elle. Elle est debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo habillée en tenue striée marron blanc.

Elle fait de l'aviculture et de l'embouche mais parallèlement fait du petit commerce de riz; elle a trois ans d'expérience dans ces domaines.

Le prêt lui permettra d'acheter un mouton, des poussins et des aliments pour continuer son activité d'aviculture.

Avec les bénéfices par ses différentes activités elle participe à la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille tout en constituant une bon épargne au niveau du Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Takku Liggey is composed of 24 women. This new group was inaugurated on April 8, 2011 and is part of the Banc Villageois of Ndame Keur Guiry. The members live together; they are friends and neighbors, and while their main activity is the fattening of animals, they also engage in small trade.

Amy N. is the group leader. She is married with one child, and she supports her sister in law, who lives with her. Amy is seen at the far right in the photo dressed in a maroon and white striped outfit.

Amy practices sheep fattening and poultry farming, and also sells rice as a sideline. She has three years of experience in these activities. 

This loan will allow her to buy a sheep, as well as some chicks and animal feed for her poultry farming business. 

With the profits earned from her various activities, she helps to pay for the family’s expenses while adding to her savings with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy sheep and chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia D. is from the village of Lubid, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. She is 55 years old, widowed and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Virginia sells food and drinks to passengers in the town bus terminal. She has had her business for over three years and earns about 2,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2011, Virginia joined Kiva field partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting her first loan of 5,000 PHP, which she plans to use to purchase ingredients to make cookies and cakes to sell at her stand.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make cookies and cakes

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 47 years old.  He is married to Agnes and they have four children.  He has been practicing farming in Olkalou town for the last five years.   

Julius was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers.  This will be his first loan.  He plans to use this loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labour.

In the future, Julius hopes to grow into large-scale farming and also to open a timberyard.

loans.use: buy seeds & fertilizer and to pay for labour

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 43 years of age and married with five children. Rosalia owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Rosalia needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 260 talas or US $108 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Rosalia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Rosalia's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap, a 34-year-old fruit seller, and her husband, a sugar cane seller, earn a combined daily income of $18. They have two children, one a 14-year-old worker, and the other a 6-year-old student. Sopheap's monthly expenses consist of $83 for food, $15 for electricity, $50 for rent, $15 for school fees, $45 for transportation and $50 for other expenses.

She is now requesting a loan of $1200 to buy more fruit to sell, her ultimate goal being to save enough money to buy a small store and to send her child to university to study law.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Jocelyn has a retail shop that sells marinated chicken and home-made mango puree. She has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for the marinated chicken which she sells. Jocelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for the marinated chicken which she sells

loans.name: Luch

texts.en:
Mrs. Luch, 25 years-old, lives in Baray, Kampong Tom Province. She sells spoiled and roasted corns in her community. She is able to make a profit of average of $3 per day. 

Since 2000, Mrs. Luch’s husband has been working in the industry sector as a local garment factory worker in Phnom Penh. He can earn $4 per day. She will use part of this loan to buy land for filling the pond in order to build a new house and also to purchase more corn to sell.

In the future, she wishes to buy more items to sell, to enlarge her current house, and to support her kids to finish a high level of education.

loans.use: to buy land for filling the pond in order to build a new house and also to purchase more corn to sell.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
María Rosario tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su madre, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C ALLI KAUSAY, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Tolapungo, sector Veintimilla, perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio de ganado, legumbres y otros.

María se dedica al comercio de legumbres, Compra sus productos y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.
 
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la comprar de legumbres para llevar a vender en el mercado de Guaranda. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su sueño es adquirir una casa propia. 

Le gusta tejer y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
María Rosario is 19 years old and single.  She lives with her mother in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province.

The members of the Alli Kausay Communal Bank can be found in the Tolapungo community, Veintimilla sector, Guaranda canton.  The members of this communal bank devote themselves to farming, raising ainimals, selling vegetables, and other business activities.

María sells vegetables. She buys and sells her products at the Guaranda wholesale market.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables to sell at the market in Guaranda.  The loan will be a help to supplement her financial necessities and to improve her quality of life.

Her dream is to get her own house in the sector where she lives.

She likes knitting and playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: María Eufemia

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Family, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, es la tercera ciudad de más importante del país, en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad gracias a su belleza arquitectónica, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es amable y cordial como nuestra socia.

Doña María tiene 37 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 18, 12 y 11 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado e independientemente, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión carpintero ya labora en su propio taller, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
La Señora. María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, al cuidado de sus hijos y también se dedica a trabajar conjuntamente con su esposo en el taller.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 3 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de madera, pega, lacas, clavos y otros materiales para el taller de su esposo.
 
Su meta es tener  casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Family” communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate. It is the third most important city in the country. In December 1999 it was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site due to its beautiful architecture. The area has a large variety of food. The people are nice and neighborly like our member. 

María is 37 years old. She is married and she has 3 children with her husband. They are 18, 12, and 11 years old. Her first son is married and independent. Her second son is studying in the high school and her third son is in a small school in the city. Her husband is a carpenter and he works in his own workshop. She does not have her own house. She lives in her mother’s house and shares the living expenses. 

María does the household chores, takes care of her children and works with her husband in his workshop.

She has been a part of the communal bank for three years. The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of wood, glue, lacquer, nails and other materials for her husband’s workshop. 

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: purchase wood, glue, lacquers, nails, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single woman with six children; two attend school while four are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and charcoal.  

For the past ten years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also owns real estate houses, her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of competition from other charcoal operators in the area. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and renovate her real estate houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and renovate her real estate houses.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 35 años vive en Urcuquí que está a media hora de Ibarra, vive con su madre, se describe como una persona alegre, trabajadora y con ganas de superarse.

Trabaja solo desde cuando tenía 17 años en la crianza de animales (pollos). Es la primera vez que le solicita créditos a Fodemi, este crédito será utilizado para la compra de pollos para aumentar su negocio lo cuál aumentará sus ventas e ingresos lo cual le puede ayudar a su mamá para que se ponga su negocio de pollos asados.

Su sueño es casarse con su novia y poder tener un galpón grande de pollos.
texts.en:
Luis is 35 years old. He lives with his mother in Urcuquí, half an hour from Ibarra. He describes himself as a happy, hardworking person who is determined to make a better life for himself.

He's worked on his own raising chickens since he was 17 years old. This is the first time he's applied for a loan from FODEMI. He will use it to buy chickens to expand his business, which will increase his sales and profits. This will make it possible for his mother to start a business selling roasted chickens.

His dream is to marry is girlfriend and have a large, thriving chicken business.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal “Medallitas de Oro II”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo, cuenta con estudios de educación superior incompleto.
Trabaja desde hace seis ciclos con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio de venta de ganados ovinos y vacunos.
Con su nuevo préstamo solicitado por la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra de dos vacas, la señora las compra y vende al instante, trabaja sola en el negocio su esposo trabaja en la mina.
Su sueño es tener una casa, un carro, una tienda y una galería de artefactos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la unión, la comprensión y la comunicación entre las socias.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the “Medallitas de Oro II” (Little Gold Medals II) communal bank is the Puno district, Puno province and department.  She is 29 years old, and she has a life partner and a son.  She has some college-level coursework.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six cycles.  Her first loan was for 500 soles, money that increased her business capital.  She sells sheep and cows.

She will use the requested loan of 2,000 soles to buy two cows.  She buys them and sells them right away.  She works alone in the business, and her husband works in the mine.

Her dream is to have a house, a car, a store, and a handicrafts market.

What she likes about the communal bank is the unity, the understanding, and the communication between the members.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Diana Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general tiene 39 años, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo, que mantener. Ya tiene 2 créditos con Fundación que le han ayudado para aumentar su inventario en su negocio. Con este  nuevo préstamo comprara ciertos artículos del hogar, calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general, prendas de oro y plata y ropa interior. Nos cuenta que negocio le está dando muchas satisfacciones, está viendo el fruto de su trabajo y se siente feliz porque puede ayudar a su hijo.
texts.en: Mrs. Diana Elizabeth sells general merchandise, is 39 years old, a single mom, and raises one child. She has had two loans with Fundación which have helped her stock up her store with more merchandise. With this new loan she will buy household items, shoes, cosmetics, basic items of clothing, pieces of gold, silver, and interior clothes. She tells us that her business is very satisfactory since she is seeing her work's progress and is happy she can provide for her son.

loans.use: buy household items, shoes, cosmetics, basic items of clothing, pieces of gold, silver, and interior clothes.

loans.name: Sharifdchon

texts.ru: Шарифчон на воспитании имеет семерых детей. Для содержания своей семьи они вместе с женой открыли цех по выпечки лепешек. Горячие лепешки это востребованный каждодневный товар на рынке. Для продвижения дела ему надо запастись мукой и углем. Для этого ему нужны средства. Шарифчон очень надеется получить займ и продвинуть свое дело вперед. Ведь для содержания большой семьи нужны большие усилия.
texts.en: Sharifdchon is raising seven children.  In order to support their family, he and his wife opened a bakery to make flatbread.  Hot flatbread is a demanded daily product at the market.  In order to continue his business, Sharifdchon needs to stock up on flour and coal and needs funds to do this.  Sharifdchon hopes very much to obtain this loan and move his business forward because a lot of efforts are needed to support a large family.

loans.use: to purchase flour and coal

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 24 years old and is a married man with 2 young children. He is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He earns about 4500 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month from fishing. He is able to provide for his family through fishing. He works hard to improve his earnings and save for his children's future.

John has requested a loan to repair his fishing boat and purchase fishing nets. He hopes to have another source of income soon.

loans.use: to repair his fishing boat and purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Hector Ivan

texts.es:
El señor Héctor, tiene 35 años de edad, se caso muy joven tiene 18 años de casado, tiene 3 hijos de 5, 13 y 17 años de edad, vive en la zona periférica de San Pedro Sula.

Héctor es un hombre muy trabajador, hace dos años inicio un negocio de venta de comida, adiciona refrescos, churros, dulces, pan y otros. Vende en un lugar donde se estacionan buses de transporte y los empleados son Sus clientes, allí tiene establecido el local donde prepara y vende la comida. 

Además de este negocio también recibe otros ingresos, en este mismo lugar trabaja como guardia de seguridad en la noche, y de mediodía hasta la tarde apoya a su esposa con esta actividad. Ella le ayuda mucho con la administración del negocio.

A comenzado con un préstamo pequeño con ODEF, para comprar ingredientes para elaborar comida y mas adelante va solicitar otro de mayor cantidad para ampliar el negocio y surtir de otros productos.
texts.en:
Sr. Héctor, age 35, is a young man who has been married for 18 years. He has three children (ages 5, 13, and 17). Héctor lives on the outskirts of San Pedro Sula.

He is a hardworking gentleman who started a business selling food two years ago. In addition, Héctor sells soft drinks, donuts, candy, bread, and other items. He sells at a place where buses are parked and the employees are his customers. This establishment is where he prepares and sells food.

In addition to this business, Héctor earns additional income by working as a security guard at night. From noon until the end of the afternoon, his wife helps with the business. She has been a great assistant when it comes to managing the business. Héctor started out with a small loan from ODEF, which he used to buy ingredients for making food. Later on, he requested another loan for a larger amount so that he could expand his business and restock with other products.

loans.use: to buy meats, condiments, vegetables, soft drinks, bread, and other ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Askaraly

texts.ru: Аскарали 45 лет, женат, воспитывает троих детей.  В поисках средств дохода для своей семьи, в 2001 году Аскарали начал свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Аскарали, начатое с суммы в 13,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  сегодня приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Аскарали обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку баранов. Доходы от кредита Аскарали планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Askaraly is 45 years old, married and is raising three children.  In search of a source of income for his family, Askaraly started his own business of fattening up and reselling livestock in 2011.  Thanks to his hard work and persistence, his business that was started with 13,000 som (KGS) brings in about 8,000 som (KGS) per month now from sales of dairy and meat products.  In order to further increase his livestock headcount, Askaraly requested a loan in the sum of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase sheep.  He plans to invest the profits from the loan into increasing livestock quantities further.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Korotimi

texts.fr:
Mme KOROTIMI est  mariée  et mère d’un  enfant. Il a 04ans et  ne va  à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes  en charge (son enfant plus 02 frères dont un va à l’école).

Elle est restauratrice  depuis 01an. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de gounghin. Ses clients sont  les  hommes, les femmes et enfants.

Elle veut  s’acheter  05 casseroles et 07 chaises pour son restaurant.

 Mme épargne  ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne  agrandir son restaurant et payer la scolarité de ses frères dont il a la charge.
texts.en:
Mrs. Korotimi is married and the mother of one child.  He is four years old and does not go to school.  She is responsible for three people (her child and two brothers, one of whom is in school).

Mrs. Korotimi has had a restaurant for a year.  She buys her supplies at the Gounghin market.  Her customers are men, women, and children.  She would like to buy five cooking pots and seven chairs for her restaurant.

Mrs. Korotimi saves her profits, and hopes to enlarge her restaurant and pay school fees for her brothers who are in her care.

loans.use: to buy five cooking pots and seven chairs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Alexandre Vihanou

texts.fr: Alexandre Vihanou est âgé de 35 ans et est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Rosaline. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Alexandre Vihanou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Alexandre Vihanou mène comme activité depuis quatorze ans environs, la transformation. Alexandre Vihanou désire améliorer ses prestations et pour ce faire, Alexandre Vihanou voudrait acquérir des pièces de rechange (cylindre, vilebrequin, etc.) nécessaires au bon fonctionnement de son activité.  Son ambition est d’augmenter la taille de son unité de transformation.  Pour cette raison,  Alexandre Vihanou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Alexandre Vihanou a bien remboursé les trois premiers crédits reçus de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Alexandre Vihanou is 35 years old and married to a hairdresser named Rosaline. The couple has four dependent children, some of whom go to school. In addition to their own children, they also have another child in their care. Alexandre Vihanou did not go to school. 

The couple handles together the various household responsibilities. In order to support himself and provide for his family, Alexandre Vihanou has been working in car transformation for about 14 years. Wanting to increase his revenue, he is seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé to purchase spare parts (cylinders, crankshafts, etc.), which are necessary for the smooth operation of his activity. 

His goal is to expand his business. His first three credits were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts (cylinders, crankshafts, etc.)

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is 47 years old. He and his wife, Cecilia, have five children. He has been in the tailoring business for the last 15 years, sewing clothes for his clients, from which he earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Onesmus is applying for his third loan of 20,000 KES. He paid his previous loans well and on time. He hopes to use the funds to buy an embroidery sewing machine and sewing materials. He plans to use the anticipated profits to open up another tailoring shop.

Onesmus' dream is to own a large clothing store and supply clothes to other towns.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine and sewing materials.

loans.name: Amour

texts.en: Amour is 28 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for four years. Amour is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Evanesa

texts.en:
Evanesa is from Clarin, Bohol. She is 32 years old, married and has four children; they are 9, 8, 7 and 5 years old.

Her husband works hard as a motorcycle driver known as “habal-habal” in locals, while Evanesa sells food (snacks) in the community just to earn a living and help her husband. She has been doing this for a year.

Evanesa is asking for a loan to buy food ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, food seasoning and fruits.

In the future, she wishes to become successful in her business so she could send her children to school and that they would have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, food seasoning and fruits.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
My name is Amada R. and i have been selling clothing for women, men and children as well as toys, stuffed animals and ornaments in my store for the last five years. This activity allows me to provide food for my family and education for my two sons. My customers are great and my store is located in a comercial area of the capital city. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to increase sales, using the profits to renovate my house (which is also my store) and provide my sons with education from a private school.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Amada R. me dedico a la venta de ropa para dama, caballero y niños tambien vendo juguetes, peluches, adornos, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, actividad que me genera ingresos para el alimento y estudio de mis dos hijos, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi negocio esta ubicado en una zona comercial de la ciudad capital, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion (negocio) y darles un estudio en escuelas privadas a mis dos hijos.

loans.use: Buy stuffed animals, clothes, shoes, pants, blouses, skirts, toys, hairpins, hats, shoes and schoolbags

loans.name: Sixto

texts.en: My wife and I have been selling fruit in our community for several years. We also sell in schools and on the street. This is our source of income, and it generates revenues so that we can support our children. This summer season we need to stock our business in order to improve our income and finish building our house.

loans.use: Purchase of fresh seasonal fruits like watermelon, melons, mango, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire the resources needed to expand her food cafe business

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira is teacher by profession and has taught in school. She has a big family and many expenses in this connection. One of her sons studies in university and two others study at school. Because the salary of teacher is not enough, she decided to make a full-time business. Her husband returned from Russia recently, and they have put all their money into the expansion of the business.

At one time, Shoira sold only a limited number of food products but she has now increased the assortment of goods to include toys and industrial goods. She has a small shop near her house where they trade from morning till evening. A year ago, Shoira received her first loan from Microinvest and continues to benefit from it. Now she has a good business and has asked for another loan of $500 for 10 months to help her expand her business. (You see Shoira and her husband in the photo.)

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase young animals

loans.name: Sobeida

texts.es:
"I'm making progress with the construction work but I'd like to install the concrete roof, the windows and an extra door to protect my house for the rainy season". I ask for $ 1,200.00 dollars in order to install the roof, the windows and a door.

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

“Ya tengo adelantada mi construcción pero me gustaría poner ahora el techo de concreto, las ventanas y un puerta más que nada para proteger mi casa de la temporada de lluvias y de frío”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la poner el techo de concreto, las ventanas y una puerta en mi casa.

loans.use: installing a concrete roof, windows and a door.

loans.name: Hacixanim

texts.en:
S. Hacixanim is a low-income vulnerable person. She is 46 years old and lives in Sumgayit city in the north-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic. She is married and has two children. She is busy with selling mobile industry goods and equipment, retail trade.  She began her business 3 years ago and it has allowed her to support her family. With this business, she could earn some money. This money was enough for only some of her family's basic needs.
S. needs $300 for expanding her business. She will increase the assortment of industry goods and buy additional kinds of goods. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes eventually to expand her business. She hopes that this will further improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of industry goods and to buy additional kinds of goods

loans.name: Noura

texts.en: Noura is the 42-year-old mother of two children who lives in the Lebanese town of Aley. To help support her family, she makes a type of food called moune which is very popular in her area. Noura has come to us for a loan to buy the ingredients she needs to make this dish. This is the second time she has applied for a loan, and we believe she will use this new loan as effectively as the first one she received.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Mrs. Yeng C., 36, is married with three children and is a housewife who stays at home to look after the children and cook food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Vart Eedh, 40, owns a plot of land growing a variety of vegetables, making on average about $3 a day of profit. This couple wish to use this loan to purchase a water pump to water their crops, as in the dry season it is difficult without water. The rest of the money they will use to buy cashew nuts and resell them to sustain their family and provide a better life.

loans.use: This couple wish to use this loan to purchase a water pump to water their crops in the dry season.

loans.name: Nora Patricia

texts.es:
Nora Patricia N. is the mother of two teenagers (ages 13 and 15). Six years ago she was looking for an activity that would allow her to produce some income to help contribute with her husband to the daily expenses. While she was unemployed she had the opportunity to buy a batch of clothes, which she then re-sold, and realizing that this activity could provide her with some earnings, she decided to continue with it.

Now she needs economic support in the amount of $300, which she will repay in three months, in order to buy merchandise so that she can continue to support her husband. Nora and her family await for your cooperation.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Nora Patricia N. es madre de 2 adolescentes de 13 y 15 años, hace 6 años estaba en busca de una actividad que le permitiera generar ingresos para apoyar su marido con los gastos familiares ya que en ese momento se encontraba desempleado fue así como se le presentó la oportunidad de comparar una paca de ropa, la cual revendió al darse cuenta de que generaba buenos ingresos decidió continuar con esto.

Ahora ella requiere de un apoyo económico de US $300 los cuales pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y continuar apoyando a su esposo. Nora y su familia esperan tu cooperación.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Tweeweeyo Women's Group

texts.en:
Barbara K. is the chairperson of Tweweeyo Women’s Group, which is located in the Lweru trading center. This group has been together for eight years. Kagoyais operates a beauty parlor in Lweru called the Nalongo Beauty Salon. It has operated successfully for eight years, and specializes in braiding, weaving and perming hair using weaves, braids and hair creams such as Ultra sheen, Venus and Movit that she gets in Lugazi Town.

Barbara is 37 years old and married with seven children, six of whom are in school. Her youngest child is still breastfeeding. Her husband works at a nearby business, and together they earn enough money to run their home and pay school fees for their children. She is thankful for the loans she has received in the past, and has now applied for a new loan through Kiva because she has heard other people talk favorably about it and believes it is a great opportunity for the group.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a beauty parlor and help several other small businesses

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mrs Thol B. and her husband Mr Bou Sorn were married in 1964 and have five children; three sons and two daughters. Four of their children are married and live outside the family home, one of whom is in the business of selling cell phones. Their youngest son is assisting his sister in selling cell phones. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs Thol and her husband have been in the business of farming for over 40 years. They grow bananas and other kinds of fruits in the farm near their house. They sell them to the middle man who takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh.

Mrs Thol is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer for doing farming and to help her daughter expand her cell phone business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for doing farming and for expanding her daughter's business of selling cell phones.

loans.name: Oisanam

texts.en: Oisanam N. was born in 1957 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married, has six children and supports her family by raising livestock and selling various products that her animals produce. Her husband helps her in this business. Mrs. N. also produces yarn and various milk products, and sells them in town while her children care for the herd. Mrs. N., who is very skilled at what she does becaue she has been doing it for the past 40 years, has applied to Kiva for a six-month loan to expand her business by buying a pedigree bull.

loans.use: to buy a pedigree bull.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Mrs Celia is 28 years old and has three dependent children (two boys and one girl). They live in the town of Mulla Contihueco, Juli district, Juli Chucuito province, Puno region.

Celia has completed secondary school education and is a member of Las Kantuta de Willkauta Community Bank. She runs a grocery store and with her first loan of approximately $100, she increased the retail stock of her grocery store by buying ten crates of beer. Concurrently, Celia is involved in embroidery in order to supplement her income.

She is grateful for the help given to her by the bank to make her a responsible, punctual and sharing woman. Her wishes are to expand her business and become a wholesaler in her district, and for her children to have professional jobs.

With this loan, repayable over six months, she plans to purchase five boxes of biscuits, twenty crates of soft drinks, and five gallons of butane gas.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Celia, tiene 28 años de edad, su nivel de educación alcanzado es superior no universitario, es madre de 3 hijos ( dos varones y una mujer), ellos aún dependen de ella, viven en el Centro Poblado de Mulla Contihueco, distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito Juli y región de Puno. Actualmente pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Kantuta de Willkauta del Centro Poblado Mulla Contihueco, por iniciativa propia y para incrementar su mercadería en su Tienda de Abarrotes, con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró 10 cajas de cerveza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará 5 cajas de galleta, 20 gaseosas y 6 galones de gas. Paralelamente se dedica en el Bordado de Bayeta para tener mayor ganancia y mejores ingresos. Ella esta agradecida por lo que ayudó a ampliar su negocio, mejorar sus ingresos económicos, ser responsable, puntual, compartir experiencias con las compañeras en las reuniones que tienen. Así se siente feliz y contenta ser parte del Banco Comunal. Su visión es agrandar su negocio y ser mayorista en Juli, y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of various items in bulk

loans.name: Progressive 2018-2 Group

texts.en:
This small group's leader is Rose K.. She currently sells flour and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. Rose is 40 years old and is married to a business man. She has three children in school, ranging in age from twelve to twenty six years old. Each week Rose makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits. With her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more flour to sell.

Rose is joined in her small group by Agnes Y., Rose O., Flora P., and Bojo A.. Agnes Y. sells clothing and wants to increase her inventory. Rose O. sells wholesale bread and wants a loan to expand her business. Flora P. sells charcoal and wants to expand her business. Bojo A. sells local brew and is requesting a loan to construct a new bar.

loans.use: Buy more flour for sale and increase inventory in respective businesses.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo es productor de queso de leche de vaca (vende su producto a La Paz),  también hace labor de MINKA (ofrece sus servicios de agricultor a otras personas a cambio de dinero y parte de los productos) Vive la Comunidad de Palomar a dos horas y media de la Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito sera usado para comprar una vaca de mediana calidad, él quiere generar mayores ingresos económicos.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro, es apto para recibir el dinero
texts.en:
Lorenzo is a producer of cheese made from cow milk (he sells his product in La Paz). He also does labor for MINKA (he offers his agricultural services to other people in exchange for money and part of the products). He lives in the community of Palomar, two and a half hours from the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to buy a cow of medium quality; he wants to generate greater economic income. It is his first loan with IMPRO. He is well suited to receive the money.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Toeae

texts.en:
Toeae V., 42, is married with 7 children. She has many years of experience in the plantation/pancakes business. She sells to the village people and public 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~83 USD).

SPBD loans are Toeae's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The whole amount of this loan will be used to maintain her businesses.

loans.use: Purchase flour, oil, deep frying pan and gas cooker; also pesticides, gromozone chemicals, backpacker spray and wire fence

loans.name: Ying

texts.en:
Mrs. Ying M. owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living while her husband, Mr. Loem Phorn, is a rice wine maker and pig breeder. Since the second business is doing well, Loem wants to expand it, so Ying is requesting a loan to buy seven more piglets and food to feed them. This will be her second loan; the first one was repaid on time.

Ying is 44 years old and the mother of a child employed in a garment factory. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy seven more piglets and food to feed them.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina M. is married and cares for six family members. She has attended school through the primary level.

Georgina sells bread, which she bakes herself at Tetermu near Elmina. She has been in this business since 1991. Her husband is a mason. Georgina uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs.

Georgina will use the loan to buy more flour, margarine and other ingredients to sell in her bake shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, Georgina plans to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more flour, margarine and other ingredients to sell

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. RE. C. is the leader of a group of five members who all live in Trapang Pring village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is 41 years old and the mother of nine childrE.: two are employed in a garment factory, five are enrolled in the local school, and the remaining two are too young to work or study.

Mrs. RE. C. is a farmer who owns 1 hectar of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Huot Huor, transports firewood to sell in the local village. EvE. though they work hard, they do not earn enough income to provide a good quality of life for their family. In order to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. RE. C. decided to ask for a loan to add her saving to build a new house for her family to live in.

loans.use: To build a new house for her family

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 44 year old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh with her husband and their three children. She has been working in handicrafts for ten years. She sews wedding dresses and bridA. parties’ dresses. Hiyam does very good work and has good relationships with her clients. Hiyam decided on doing her business to improve her family financiA. situation. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.
Hiyam has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua to purchase more merchandise for her work and to register her car. This is the first time that Hiyam has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and to register her car.

loans.name: Djekafo (Parlons Sur Le Même Ton) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Djekafo (quatre mariées et une veuve) ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier lafiala de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). 
Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et pour la pratique de la même activité. Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente  d’habits  et de chaussures. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Djekafo a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son quatrième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des balles de pagnes wax, des tissus brodés et une quantité importante de chaussures à Bobo(Burkina Faso), Abidjan(république de la côte d’ivoire) et Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali). Les pagnes  sont vendus en détail, au comptant où à crédit au marché de Koutiala et dans les foires des villages environs. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 170 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
 Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenu telle que l’ouverture d’une boutique de prêt à porter.
texts.en:
The five members of the group Djekafo are composed of four married women and a widow who average 38 years of age and three children. They live in large traditional extended families in the Lafiala district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They know one another through community ties and the same work. They have almost the same business of selling clothing and shoes and are in high demand in this field.

In order to satisfy the ever-increasing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their fourth solidarity loan (group loan). All of the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The women plan to use this loan for buying: bales of Wax-brand pagnes (colorful West African cloth of high quality), embroidered fabrics, and a sizable quantity of shoes in Bobo (Burkina Faso), Abidjan (Republic of Cote d'Ivoire), and Bamako (capital of Mali). The pagnes are sold retail, cash or credit accepted, at the Koutiala marketplace and at the fairs of surrounding villages.

The women each hope to realize an average profit of 170,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The funds will be used to pay the loan interest, provide for the needs of the extended family, and to invest the rest in the businesses. Their ambition is to diversify their commerce by embracing other income-generating work, such as opening a shop for ready-to-wear clothing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes for resale

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.en:
“La Union” is a group of ten entrepreneurs seeking their third loan from Esperanza International.  The group’s past loans have been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to use the additional loan funds for further business expansion.  Sara is the president of this group in the city of Santiago.  

Sara, mother of a two year old daughter, has used her past two Esperanza loans to fund her “colmado”, or small grocery store.
