With her first loan, Sara ran her own small colmado until a member of her microfinance bank became ill and could no longer run her colmado.  Sara merged the two colmados and with her second loan was able to fund the joint effort.  The previously ill member of the bank is now healthy and will be taking over the joint colmado and Sara will use her third loan to start a new business selling used clothing.  Sara is able to buy used clothing in bulk packages and sell to her neighbors and neighboring communities.  When asked about the dreams for her business and life, Sara declares that she intends to help those who are ill as she has in the past and to continue to provide a good life for her child.  

Other members of Sara’s microfinance bank run similar entrepreneurial activities including a beauty salon, cake sales, and a small restaurant.  

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase Used Clothing to Sell

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es: Valerio cuenta con 40 años de edad, es casado desde hace 20 años y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 de ellos ya trabajan pero viven en su casa. Desde que se casó aprendió a tejer tapices, frazadas y mantas, y hace 3 años su cuñado le enseñó a tejer bonitas mantas de diversos colores y grosores. Desde entonces empezó a dedicar más tiempo a la elaboración de esta prenda, ya que es más comercial. Durante el mes de marzo vienen de otras ciudades sus compradores, quienes se dedican a vender este tipo de tejidos a los turistas que visitan sus ciudades durante la semana santa. La idea de Valerio es producir de 5 a 6 docenas y luego viajar a esos lugares para vender a los turistas directamente, pero como sus pedidos se incrementan en esos meses le es imposible realizar el viaje, y cuando quiere tejer durante otros meses cercanos a esta fechas, no puede porque no cuenta con el capital suficiente. Pero, Valerio no se hecha para atrás en esta meta y seguirá produciendo para aumentar sus ganancias y poder viajar los siguientes años, por el momento seguirá tejiendo y su esposa ofreciendo a sus demás clientes. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, acaba de ingresar a su banco comunal, y está muy contento por la bienvenida que le dieron los otros integrantes, asimismo hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para proveerse del material necesario, como lanas procesadas y polvos para teñir las lanas de los colores que desee.
texts.en:
Valerio is 40 years old, has been married for 20 years and has 4 children, of which 2 are working but still live in his house. When he married, he learned to make tapestries and blankets and 3 years ago his brother-in-law taught him to make beautiful blankets with diverse colors and with thickness. Since then he started to spend more time making clothing, which is more commercial. During the month of March, his buyers, who sell these types of textiles to tourists during Holy Week, have come from other cities. Valerio's idea is to make 5 or 6 dozen and then travel to sell to the tourists directly, but his orders have increased recently and it is impossible to make the trip. When he wants to make textiles during other months close to holiday dates, he can't because he doesn't have sufficient capital. However, Valerio has not given up this goal and continues to producing in order to increase his earnings and have the ability to make the trip in the coming years. For the time being, he and his wife will continue to make textiles and offer them to other clientes. This is his first loan with MFP (field partner), he just became a member of the community bank, and he is very happy for the welcome that the other members gave him. He ahs also made a commitment to pay his share on time. The money he is asking for is for providing necessary material, such as processed wool and dying powders of the desired colors for the wool.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materiales for making blankets

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn P., 50, is a widow with six children: three sons and three daughters. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home, two children are assisting their mother with farming and the other one is in school. The family lives along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Yorn has been a farmer for over thirty years; she grows papayas, tomatoes, corn and bananas. She hopes to support her children’s further education.

Yorn is requesting a loan of $500 to pay fees for growing papayas.

loans.use: To pay fees for growing papayas

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали пожилой мужчина 54 лет. Женат. Отец 6-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота.  Жена – домохозяйка. Курбонали закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает. Рынок находится далеко от его дома, поэтому он должен нанимать машину, чтобы довезти скот до рынка. Пока у Курбонали нет машины. Но он надеется, что когда у него будет большой товарооборот и большая прибыль, он купит себе машину. Он надеется что кредит ему поможет в достижении его цели.
texts.en:
Kurbonali is an older man of 54 years old. He is married and is a father of six children. He feeds and sells large and small cattle. His wife is a housewife. Kurbonali buys cattle on the market and feeds it for about two to three months. The market is located far from his house and this is why has has to rent a vehicle to transport the cattle to the market. At this time Kurbonali does not have a car. He hopes that when he will have a larger turnaround and more profits he will buy himself a car. He hopes that the loan will assist him in achieving this goal.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling cattle

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyo” en  Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, estado civil casada y tiene 03 hijos, Vive en el Barrio Alto Florida, ella posee estudios superior incompleto (agropecuaria). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite).  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles con los cuales pudo comprar más productos para su negocio.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para comprar variedades de abarrotes como (arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche), su mayor deseo es poner una tienda grande bien surtida.
 
Nos cuenta que le gusta muchos las capacitaciones y las reuniones, y está agradecida a Manuela Ramos por el apoye que les da para que sus negocios sigan adelante
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the "Yunga Uyo" Communal Bank in the Yunguyo district, Chucuito province in the Puno department. She is 39 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in the Florida neighborhood. She did not complete her studies (in agriculture). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 8 years. Her business is the purchase and sale of groceries (rice, sugar, pasta, oil). Her first loan for 3000 soles enabled her to buy products for her business. Now she would like an additional loan of 3000 soles to purchase a greater variety of grocery products (rice, sugar, pasta, oil, milk). Her dream is to have a large, well-stocked store. She tells us that she enjoys the training and meetings, and is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for the support it gives them to continue their work.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, pasta, oil and milk

loans.name: Mukim

texts.en:
Mukim is a farmer. He lives with his family, including his wife, 6 children that are school-aged, and his parents also. His wife helps him with caring for their land. In the past they have had problems in harvesting; having to sell their crop in advance and see reduced earnings.

By this time Mukim has gained a lot of experience in his business and now his crop is one of the most sought after at the market. He now faces a small problem because his field is infertile, which makes it difficult to grow his crops. To solve this problem, he has decided to request a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to support the field and make his crops more productive.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Arifa

texts.en:
Arifa F. is 45 years old and has raised four children.

She has been raising cattle for three years, and the business income allows her to provide for the basic needs of her family. Her husband and children all take part in the farm work and help Arifa pour water and cut grass for the animals. Arifa has been delighted with the recent growth in her cattle farm and is enthusiastic about investing further. She is seeking a loan to buy more young cattle in order to expand her business and earn more.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Karmella

texts.en:
Karmella P. is 28 years old and married to a policeman. She has three school-aged children. Karmella is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to build up her charcoal stocks. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build up her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Unique Group

texts.en:
C. is a 35-year-old woman. She is married and has six children who are in school. C. is very dedicated to her family and business. She is a food vendor and sells rice with gravy stew at the local community school. She started this work about four years ago to provide for her family. C. sells in the market during their market days. Her food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to develop her business. She wants to use the loan to buy more meat, vegetables, and bags of rice to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income and support the education of her children.

C. is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Unique’. She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
S. and Savy’s marriage gave them a family of two children all of whom are still young. S. is 45 and Savy is 47. He earns a living as a motor-taxi driver with a net of income of $3 per day. S. has been employed for almost two years by a private company offering massage services.

S. and her husband decided to take a loan of $500 to buy a new motorcycle to upgrade their living standard. She dreams of her children obtaining degrees.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcle for her husband's business

loans.name: Beatrice Jemeli

texts.en:
Beatrice Jemeli is 38 years old and is blessed with one child. She has a salon which is located within West Market in Eldoret Town.

Beatrice has been in the salon business for the past three years now. Her clients are both adults and children who are residents of Eldoret and its outskirts.

Beatrice was introduced to KADET by a group member and she intends to use the loan from KADET buy more stock for her salon. In the future, she aims to expand her business, open a clothing store, and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her salon

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose, a 40-year-old married mother of four children, sells herbs and local pots. She has been in this business for several years and hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 to purchase more herbs to sell. Rose says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more herbs to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Ma. Luzviminda A. is a member of ASHI since 2002. All throughout her membership and loans received, she had proven her dignity and word of honor by keeping a good track record in repayment, business and attendance during weekly center meeting. Despite of struggles she had been through in fighting against poverty, she had managed to be a responsible mother to her two sons and wife to her loving husband who is a fisherman. Business she had put up through her loans in ASHI is her most treasured achievement in life because this had been a great means of financial source for the family. Her profits in this business have enabled her to send her children to a vocational course in college. Thus, Ma. Luzviminda wanted her fishing business managed by her husband to grow even more to be able to be able to achieve her vision of life out of the umbrella of poverty. Now, she is requesting for a much larger amount of loan which will be used in buying a new motor fishing boat and some amount will be intended for its maintenance. Once her business has grown, she will be using her profits in supporting the needs of her family. She also hoped that their house be renovated for a healthy and comfortable living.

loans.use: Will be used to pay for purchasing a new motor fishing boat and for the boat's maintenance.

loans.name: Maria Alexandra

texts.es:
La señora María Alexandra Párraga S. es socia del Banco Comunal 24 de Septiembre ubicado en la ciudad de Portoviejo en  la provincia de Manabí;  María es  casada y madre de tres niños.

Maria es  comerciante desde hace diez años,   tiene una  despensa  y una farmacia  ubicados en la casa de sus padres; en la despensa podemos encontrar productos de primera necesidad, carnes rojas, pescado, pollo  y  legumbres.

El horario de atención  es de  6 de la mañana  hasta las 10 de la noche de lunes a domingo por lo que le ayuda su hermana,  el préstamo solicitado a la Fundación lo va  invertir en productos como arroz, azúcar, legumbres, carnes y en medicina para abastecer sus negocios y para cubrir algunos pagos pendientes con sus proveedores.

Su sueño es  montar un supermercado para ofrecer un mejor servicio y variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Alexandra Párraga S. is a member to the “24th of September” Community Bank, located in the city of Portoviejo in Manabí province. María is married and has three children.

María has been a businesswoman for ten years. She has a grocery store and pharmacy in her parents' home. Among the items sold in her shop are first aid supplies, red meat, fish, chicken, and vegetables. Her shop is open from 6:00 am until 10:00 pm, seven days a week, so her sister helps her run it.

She will invest this loan in products such as rice, sugar, vegetables, meat, and medicine to stock her business. She will also cover some outstanding debts to her suppliers.

María's dream is to start a supermarket to offer better service and a greater variety of products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products such as rice, sugar, vegetables, meat, and medicine to stock her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha se encuentra en su tercera secuencia, ella vino a la institución debido a una promoción, ella tiene como actividad principal la atención D. la tienda por las tardes, en las mañanas esta trabajando D. empleada del hogar en un domicilio particular, el esposo es portero en un edificio en la  zona D. Cota Cota, la señora tiene tres hijos que aún estudian, los que le colaboran en la tienda, es una señora muy activa y tiene buenas referencias por la zona, en sus anteriores créditos no tuvo atrasos.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha is now on her third loan. She came to Emprender upon seeing an advertisement. Martha manages a small grocery store in the afternoons. In the mornings, she works as a housekeeper at a private home. Her husband is a doorman at a building in the Cota Cota district. Martha has three school-aged children who help look after the store. She is a very active woman with good references. Her credit history does not show any delinquencies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her grocery store

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basam is a 39-year-old Palestinian woman. She lives in Al-Khader village near Bethlehem but works in Hebron city as a messenger in the Ministry of Social Affairs. She lives with her sister who also works as a clerk. They are both single and live alone after their parents passed away.

Basma has diabetes that affects her eyes. She needs surgery ASAP and needs the money for this surgery, so she has requested 2,000 USD from FATEN.

Basma appears in the photo at the FATEN office.

loans.use: To pay for her eye surgery

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es: El joven Julio A. tiene 25 años de edad. Vive en el Caserío La Joya del distrito de Santiago en casa de su madre junto a su esposa y su menor hijo de dos años. Actualmente se dedica a labores de campo en parcelas y fundos de la zona de manera informal, además desempeña actividades de músico eventualmente los fines de semana o para festividades de la municipalidad de los distritos aledaños contando con instrumento propio. Su esposa lo apoya por temporadas de trabajo como obrera de campo. Necesitan apoyo para poder mejorar el lugar en donde viven ya que el espacio cedido por su madre es de adobe y caña.Su sueño es logar mejorar sus condiciones de vida para él y su familia.Son personas jóvenes que desean progresar con mucho esfuerzo.Ambos agradecen la ayuda que le podamos brindar a través de diversos financiamientos.
texts.en:
Julio A. is 25 years old and lives in the La Joya neighborhood of Santiago. He lives with his wife and 2-year-old daughter in his mother's home. Currently, he works informally as a field hand for small and large farms in the area. He also uses his own instrument to perform music on the weekends and for municipal festivals in neighboring areas. His wife helps support them by working seasonally in the fields.

They need support to be able to improve their home, since the space provided by his mother is made of adobe and reeds. Their dream is to be able to improve their family's living conditions. They are young people who are making great efforts to get ahead, and they are both thankful for the help they can receive from loans.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies of fruits and red oil for resale

loans.name: Rosita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosita está integrado por Rosa Paublina R. M. de 43 años quien vende en su hogar enchiladas, frescos, gaseosas y helados, Bernarda Lourdes T. vende gaseosas, helados y hielo, Aracely del Socorro C.  comercializa ropa y zapatos y por ultimo la menor del grupo Fátima Aracely F. R. de 19 años vende cosméticos y hace rifas.

 Estas cuatro féminas trabajadoras y emprendedoras han buscado la forma de ganarse el pan de cada día de forma honrada con la creación de pequeños comercios que están en pleno crecimiento y que de necesitan inversión para ir  mejorando.
texts.en:
The Rosita group has four members. Rosa Paublina R. M., 43 years old, sells enchiladas, juices, soft drinks, and ice cream from her home. Bernarda Lourdes T. sells soft drinks, ice cream, and ice. Aracely del Socorro C. sells clothing and shoes. And the youngest of the group, Fátima Aracely F. R., 19, sells cosmetics and conducts raffles. These four hardworking and enterprising women have searched for a way to earn their daily bread in an honest way with the creation of these small, growing businesses. They need an investment of capital to continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, fruit, grains, etc.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida R. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Zenaida is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Zenaida joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Zenaida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Trinidad (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Trinidad está formado por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras que siempre buscan la  forma de salir adelante y lo más grato que lo ven reflejado en su trabajo diario, sintiéndose  orgullosas de alcanzar sus metas y mantener  una gran amistad entre todas las  compañeras y amigas del banco,   viven en el sector  Turí mirador turístico  de la ciudad de Cuenca situado  unos 10 minutos fuera de la urbe  considerado como uno de los lugares más turísticos de ésta  región.

La señora  María M. vive en la comunidad El Cisne de Turí,  tiene 23 años de edad y se encuentra casada y madre de una hermosa niña de tres años, su esposo es albañil de profesión por lo que sus ingresos económicos son muy limitados y aún no tienen casa propia. 

María  al igual que la mayoría de la población se dedica a la cría de animales de corral compartiendo con las actividades propias de ama de casa, sus  pollos los vende en su comunidad y algunos de estos son para su consumo. 

Fue su mamá quien  la incentivó a formar parte de este grupo emprendedor llevando dos ciclos en él, con el préstamo solicitado va a comprar unos pollos, alimento y a pagar la atención médica preventiva de su esposo.  Su gran sueño tener su casa propia.

Blanca Dután  también es socia de éste banco gracias a un conocido de la comunidad quien le invitó a formar parte de éste ameno  grupo,  ya lleva ocho ciclos en su banco comunal, con los créditos obtenidos ha cancelado algunas deudas adquiridas  para la carpintería de su esposo con quien comparte oficio a mas de sus labores de ama de casa y cuidado de sus hijos de 11 y 5 años.

Blanca a sus 27 años ya posee casa propia esfuerzo conyugal nos dice, aquí tienen su negocio de carpintería y con el nuevo préstamo solicitado va a montar su negocio de crianza de animales  para lo cual va a comprar  cuyes y pollos así como maíz y otros alimetos para su crianza, su gran sueño iniciar su negocio e irlo incrementado cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank Trinidad is composed of a group of tough, hard-working women who always seek new ways to prosper and take pleasure in their daily work. They are proud to reach their goals and the maintain good relationships between themselves. They live in the Turí district, a touristic look-out spot in the city of Cuenca, located 10 minutes outside of the urban center and considered one of the most touristic parts of the region. Mrs. María M. lives in the El Cisne de Turí community, is 23 years old, married, and mother of a beautiful three-year-old daughter. Her husband is a construction worker with a relatively humble income, so they do not own their own home. María, like the majority of her community, cares for farm animals while completing the duties of a housewife. She sells most of her chickens to her community and consumes the rest. It was her mother who encouraged her to join this entrepreneurial group, and she has completed two successful loan cycles with them. With the loan she is seeking, she is going to buy some more chickens and feed and she is going to pay for her husband's preventive healthcare. Her greatest dream is to own her own house. Blanca Dután is also part of this communal bank due to an acquaintance in the community who invited her to join this lovely group. She has been part of the group for 8 cycles, and with her past loans she paid off a few of her husband's loans, which he acquired for his carpentering business. She helps him with this business along with her duties as housewife and care for their 11- and 5-year-old children. Blanca, at 27 years old, already owns her own home thanks to the couple's joint efforts. The carpentering business is based out of their home, and with this new loan, they will start another business caring for animals. They are going to buy guinea pigs and chickens as well as corn and other nourishing feed. Her greatest dream is to launch this new business and help it to develop more each day.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of guinea pigs and chickens as well as corn and other nourishing feed; personal medical expenses

loans.name: Wilberta

texts.en:
Wilberta T. is from the village of Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Wilberta is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Wilberta owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Wilberta has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Wilberta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilberta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Wilberta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Wilberta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 43-year-old man married to peasant farmer with eight children. He is the family’s income earner and his dream is to have his children go to school up to university level. He owns a house in which his family resides.

Fred has a mobile disco as his business and has been in the business for eighteen years. He started as a tailor then rode a motorcycle for hire. With the help of loans and savings, he bought the disco machines though he dreams of getting modern machines to have an ultra-modern mobile disco.

The purpose of this loan is to buy a generator to enable him easily to operate in areas where there is no electricity.

loans.use: To buy a generator for his mobile disco business

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a wife of M. A. and a citizen of a city named Borewala, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan.

Her husband runs a sweetmeat shop in the market. His shop is the busiest one. People use to come to him for ordering the sweetmeat because of his good quality items. Azra has a skill of making artificial flowers. People use these to decorate their houses. Her art gives her approximately Pak Rs. 8,000 per month which helps her to pay for the utilities. 

They both never waste any minute because they know the value of time. Azra uses her income to pay for the utilities but she takes out some money from her income for rainy days. She is applying for a loan to buy items (sugar, cooking oil, dry fruits) for her husband’s sweetmeat shop.

She has two other ladies in her loan group. Jannat Firdous wants a loan to buy items (chairs, mirror and scissors) for her barber shop.
Yasmeen wants a loan to buy chickens for her chicken meat selling business.

loans.use: To buy material for sweetmeat business

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara del Carmen B. R., tiene la edad de 39, es acompañada de su compañero de vida el cual labora como jardinero, ellos con sus 4 hijos, habitan en un peligroso Barrio de Managua el cual lleva por nombre Laureles Sur.

Ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de ampliaciones y enmarcaciones de fotos, y  de sus máximas necesidades están las remodelaciones en  su hogar, debido a que sus hijos están demandándole mejores condiciones independiente, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la construcción de un cuarto para uso del hijo mayor, esto le permitirá optimas condiciones para que sus hijos habiten en comodidad. Y la tranquilidad personal de ofrecer un buen ambiente familiar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Xiomara del Carmen B. R. is 39 years old and is accompanied by her life partner, who works as a gardener. Together with their 4 children, they live in a dangerous neighborhood of Managua, called Laureles Sur. Xiomara's work is enlarging and framing photographs. One of her greatest needs is remodeling her home, since her children are asking her for better living conditions and more space for themselves. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to construct a room for the use of her oldest son. This will be an optimal solution that will allow her children to live more comfortably, and Xiomara will be content in the knowledge that she is providing a good environment for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constructing an additional room

loans.name: Tranquilino

texts.es:
El Sr. Tranquilino tiene 66 años, vive en el Barrio San Antonio con su pareja quien es la Sra. Isabel Olmedo, donde ambos tiene un despensa bien surtida hace mas de 20 años. 
Don Tranquilino había empezado este negocio debido a  que no existía ninguna despensa cercana al barrio en el tiempo que se mudó a la que ahora es su comunidad.
Gracias a los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya fue creciendo de a poco, y hoy día su despensa es como un mini-mercado por el buen stock de sus mercaderías con que cuenta actualmente. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de mercaderías tales como: harina, arroz, fideo, azúcar, bebidas en gral. debido  a que llega la Semana Santa, periodo en el cual las ventas son más altas de lo habitual.
texts.en:
Tranquilino is 66 years old and lives in the neighbourhood of San Antonio with his partner, Isabel Olmedo, where they have run a well stocked grocery store for more than 20 years. Tranquilino started this business when they first moved to the area that is now their community, since there was no other grocery store close to their neighbourhood at that time. Thanks to the loans that they obtained through Fundación Paraguaya, bit by bit their business began to grow, and today their grocery store is like a mini-market due to the good quality of their merchandise. The loan that Tranquilino is applying for now will be used to purchase merchandise such as flour, rice, pasta, sugar and beverages, since Holy Week is coming and this is the time when they usually sell the most products.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, rice, pasta, sugar and beverages

loans.name: Mirachisun Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mirachisun que significa Hagamos Crecer inicia su ciclo 22 con 20 socias.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es la venta de tubérculos, cosméticos, golosinas, artesanía, ropa, gas, joyas, abarrotes en general, repuestos, jugos, cereales y animales menores.
Como es el caso de la Señora Nora que es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Nora se dedica a la venta de jugo de naranja que prepara ella misma, sus ventas los realiza de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad, además vende chicha y golosinas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Nora invertirá su préstamo para el arreglo de su carreta y ampliar para vender mas productos. Los sueños de Nora son tener casa propia, educar a sus hijos, mejorar su negocio y tener un lugar estable para su negocio. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total de 10,200 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The “Mirachisun,” which means “Let’s Create Growth,” is starting its 22nd cycle with 20 members. The members are in a variety of commercial activities like: sale of tubers, cosmetics sales, sweets sales, clothing sales, gas, jewelry and grocery sales; replacement parts, juices, cereals and small farm animals. Such is Nora’s case. She is 40 years old, married and has three children. She sells home-made orange juice throughout the city’s wholesale food market; she also sells chicha (an alcoholic drink made from fermented maize) and snacks every day. She will use her loan to repair her cart and expand so that she can sell more products. Her dream is to have her own home, educate her children, improve her business and have a stable location for her business. The members all need varying loan amounts like: 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles for a total group loan of 10200 soles to the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her cart.

loans.name: Madina

texts.fr: A. Madina est née le 15 Janvier 1984 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Madina vit depuis près de vingt et un ans au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Madina est mariée à HOUNTON Mathias, un enseignant. Le couple a un enfant qui n'est pas encore scolarisé. Madina vit enssemble avec son mari et son enfant. Madina supporte avec son mari, les différentes charges de la famille. Madina a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a juste un an que Madina a commencé la vente de divers produits (savons, conserves de tomate et de sardines, pâtes alimentaires, lait, alumettes, bougies, etc.) dans sa boutique à Allada. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Madina achète ses produits. Madina a bénéficié une fois déjà de prêt à ALIDé, et a bien effectué le remboursement. Madina désire rehausser un peu plus le niveau de son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Madina sollicite un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Madina A. was born on January 15, 1984 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been living for almost 21 years in the Dogoudo district of Allada, in the Atlantic Prefecture. She is married to Mathias Hounton, a teacher. They have a child who does not yet go to school. Madina lives together with her husband. Madina and her husband jointly take care of the family budget. Madina finished only secondary school. Just about a year ago, she started selling various items (soaps, canned tomatoes and sardines, pasta, milk, matches, candles etc) in her store in Allada. She buys her stock in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Madina already had one previous loan from ALIDé loan and repaid it properly. She would like to expand the scope of her activity somewhat and to be able to better meet customer demand. This is why she is seeking a second loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing 3 bags of rice, cartons of pasta, oil, soaps etc

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero y vive en una casa que le cedieron sus padres. El tiene una carrera técnica en el rubro salud, en el cual trabaja durante las mañanas, pero durante la tarde, para generarse más ingresos se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su motocarro. Su mayor anhelo es poner un taller de venta de repuestos de moto, con un amigo en sociedad, por ello esta trabajando muy duro para concretarlo. Sus jornadas diarias son provechosas puesto que es muy diestro en el manejo de su vehículo por las calles arenosas de la zona en al que vive. Walter espera seguir poniéndole empeño a su labor y así convertirse próximamente en un prospero empresario. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, refaccionará su moto para dejarla óptima, además quiere comprar algunas cosas para hacer realidad su sueño de tener su taller propio.
texts.en:
Walter, 31, is single and lives in his own house that his parent’s gave him. He has a technical career in the health sector that he works at during the week. However, in order to earn additional income, he works evenings providing public transportation services in his vehicle. His greatest wish is to be able to open a vehicle replacement parts store in partnership with a friend; he is working very hard to reach this goal. His daily shifts are quite profitable because he is very skilled in driving his vehicle in the sandy streets of his neighborhood. Walter expects to continue to work very hard in order to become a prosperous businessman. This is his first loan with MFP and he pledges to be very punctual with all his repayments. He will use the requested funds to service his vehicle in order to have it in optimal working conditions. He also wants to buy a few things he needs to make his wish to have his own workshop come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, 49 years old, is married and has three children. She has been selling vegetables for six years to earn a living. She also engages is cattle farming, an endeavor in which she rears dairy cows and pigs in order to supplement her family’s income. She joined Tingonga Vision Group with the aim of saving money and being guaranteed a loan from Faulu Kenya. She has requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES so that she can buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kuisunoy

texts.en:
A. Kuisunoy is a widow and has a daughter. Her clothing sales business has been a valuable source of income for her and her family over the past 3 years that she’s been in business. In a typical month Kuisunoy makes about $200-$300 in profit from the business. Kuisunoy is a hard-working, polite and communicative entrepreneur. She has an attitude of service and loves being able to help men with their clothing needs. Kuisunoy has requested a loan of $1000 USD to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and provide a good income for her family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new summer clothing for women

loans.name: Bernard Mwai

texts.en:
Bernard is a farmer and has been farming in Naivasha town since 2008.  He is 38 years old, married to Jane Njeri, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and he has no history with any other micro-finance institutions. This will be his 2nd loan with KADET. He paid his first loan of 15,000 KES well and on time.  He plans to use the cash to buy and plant potato seedlings.This region is well known for producing a good harvest of potatoes.

Bernard hopes to buy a pick-up van in the future which he will use to transport his harvest from the farm to the market.

loans.use: To buy and plant potato seedlings

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Rita C..  She is married and has one child, aged 15 months.  In 2004, she established  her grocery shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to increase the inventory of her store. In the future, Rita plans to capitalize more.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores called  'pasal' are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical 'pasal' might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

 This loan is administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. 

 For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates or join our lending team.

loans.use: increase inventory of store

loans.name: Beyshenbek

texts.en:
Beyshenbek M. is 56 years old, married and has five children. Beyshenbek was born to a low-income farmworker’s family and, from early childhood, had engaged in farming. At his country place, Beyshenbek is known as a cheerful and very positive person. He works as a plumbing specialist in a local school and earns about 1,350 KGS monthly, which does not meet the expenses of his household at all. That’s why, gaining a wide experience in stockmanship, 15 years ago Beyshenbek started his business in cattle breeding. This activity became the main source of income for his family and allowed planning for their future activities.  

Beyshenbek plans to use this loan of 70,000 KGS to buy two cows and 13 sheep for fattening and reselling. With the revenues, Beyshenbek wants to buy a car for his son. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifania, de 65 años, es una mujer que lucha contra las dificultades, ella vive con su mamá y su nieta en su casa propia, ubicada en el pueblo de Palcamayo. Hace 40 años se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas como habas y arvejas; los cuales vende en el mercado central de su ciudad. Ahora necesita expandirse más, puesto que tiene mayores responsabilidades, pero como toda mujer, no se acobarda con los retos que le pone la vida; y más ahora que tiene que sobrellevar la muerte de su hija Carolina, tenía 33 años dejando a su nieta en cuidado de Epifania. Su mayor deseo es verla como una profesional; por ello está invirtiendo en la compra de un pequeño terreno para poder cultivar mayor cantidad de hortalizas y llevarlas a la capital de su país, ya que las verduras tienen mayor demanda. Epifania a pesar de su avanzada edad, quiere seguir dedicándose a la agricultura, “es una diversión”, asegura. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta segura que podrá salir adelante con la ayuda de su banco comunal que es muy unido y solidario. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas de maíz y tres costales de abono para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Epifania is 65 years old and she is a woman that fights against difficulties. She lives with her mother and her granddaughter in her own house, located in the town of Palcamayo. For the past 40 years she has worked planting vegetables like beans and peas, which she then sells in her city’s central market.

She now needs to expand, which carries greater responsibilities, but like any woman, she is not afraid of the challenges that life brings her. She now also has to deal with the death of her daughter Carolina, who was 33 years old and left her daughter in Epifania’s care. Her greatest wish is to see her granddaughter as a professional. This is why she is investing in the purchase of a small piece of land to be able to grow more vegetables and bring them to her country’s capital since they have a greater demand for vegetables. Despite her older age, Epifania wants to continue working in agriculture. “It’s fun”, she says.

This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is sure that she will be able to get ahead with the help of her communal bank, which is very united and supportive. With the loan requested, she will purchase corn seeds and three bags of fertilizer for her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn seeds and three bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia, de 42 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Luis de 47 años, quien trabaja administrando el negocio y sus 2 adorados hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En la ciudad de Tarma una de las pastelerías más conocidas y concurridas es “La Estancia“, negocio al que le pertenece a Celia, donde ofrece deliciosas tortas y pasteles, motivo por el cual tiene más clientes que los de su competencia. Ella aprendió la repostería de sus padres, quienes tenían un horno y hacían pan y queques, vendiéndoles en Tarma. Paralelamente a esta actividad también ha puesto una pizzería, por lo que le esta generando bueno ingresos económicos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es decorar las tortas, tiene mucha paciencia para hacerlo y eso se nota en los hermosos decorados que realiza, lleva 7 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es trasnocharse, para cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen. Con el paso de los meses, espera abrir una nueva pastelería en otro lugar concurrido de la ciudad. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará nuevas vitrinas, para abrir su nueva pastelería.
texts.en:
Celia, age 42, is a very happy and hard-working woman.  She lives in a rented house with her 47 year old husband, Luis, and their two cherished children.  Luis manages the business, and their children are the motivation for all of their efforts.   

Celia’s business, La Estancia, is one of the most well-known and busiest pastry shops in the city of Tarma.  She sells delicious cakes and pastries in order to have more customers than her competition.  She learned pastry making from her parents who had an oven.  They made bread and cakes, which they sold in Tarma.

Celia also has a pizza stand, which generates good income.  What she likes most about her work is decorating the cakes.  She has a lot of patience doing this, and it shows in the beautiful decorations that she makes.  She has had this business for seven years.  The most difficult part is working all night to complete the orders that she has.

In a few months she plans to open a new pastry shop in another busy place in the city.  This is her fifth loan with MFP.  She has always been punctual with her payments, and she plans to make her payments on time now as well.  She is a very responsible member of her communal bank; therefore she is well-liked.  She will use the 2,000 soles that she is requesting to buy new display cases and to open her new pastry shop.

loans.use: To bo buy new display cases and to open her new pastry shop

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S. is currently in the business of selling fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock some tomatoes and more fish to sell.  Victoria is 25 years old and is married to a peasant. 

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock more fish to sell and also tomatoes

loans.name: Koy

texts.en: Koy C. is 29 year old married mother, who currently lives in the best territory of Phnom Penh Capital, in Cambodia Country. She works as a tailor who sews the villagers' clothes. She also shares her sewing knowledge with her trainees for a fee. She has a life partner in her husband, who works as electrician in a private company. This couple has been married for many years, but they still have no children. Koy C. has had to pay money for taxis to go anywhere because she doesn't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, she is applying for a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for traveling.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle, which will allow her to commute to her work location.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary S. lives in the Nabulagala neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  Rosemary  has a retail shop. She has been in this business for less than one year and she works 7 days out of every week. Rose Mary has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil. She also generates additional income by selling charcoal. Rosemary's main business challenges include transportation, thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to build her own business premises. Rosemary lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mr. Loeng P. (in the photo) is 38 years old and his wife, Mrs. Phearoth Nub, is 39 years old, have been married since 1994 and have two children -one son and one daughter. The family lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Loeng has been a security guard in Phnom Penh for 6 months. His wife has been a garment worker for ten years. He is applying for a loan of $1,000 to put additional work into his house and buy a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.use: To put additional work into his house and buy a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda L. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Yolanda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Yolanda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Yolanda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew Okumu N. is 55 years old and married to Monicah Okumu, who is a farmer keeping poultry and dairy cattle. He runs a tailoring and dressmaking shop, and has been in this business for 20 years. Right now his monthly income from the business is 19,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

He is borrowing 30,000 KES and he plans to use it as follows: 20,000 KES to purchase men's and women's wear, and 10,000 KES to buy clothing materials to make more dresses. 

He will use the profit from the  business to invest in other businesses, i.e, buying shares in a company's premium bonds. This is his second loan after repaying his previous loan successfuly. His dreams and hopes are to own a company in the future.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for  men and women to sell ,and also buy clothe material for making dresses

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Han B., 27, is married and resides with his wife in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. He is a construction worker, earning an income of approximately $5 per day. His wife is employed at the factory, earning an income of about $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $10 on other necessary expenses. 

B. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for family use. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for family use

loans.name: Miriya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe MIRIYA sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant avec leurs époux et enfants  dans des familles nucléaires à Sido préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont rencontrées à travers  des relations de parenté, de commerce  et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et agrandir la taille de leur entreprise, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour la 11ème fois dont tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement. Elles utilisent les prêts pour faire le commerce de boissons NBB non alcoolisées, des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique, des articles divers et avec Sali D. le commerce  de tissus et de pagnes.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Sali D., compte acheter, 50 mètres de tissus Kaki, 10 pagnes de tissus WAX, 10 pagnes de tissus fancy et 10 couvertures en tissus Burkinabé.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes, et effectue sa vente en détail à la maison et au marché, en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elles comte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise et l’autre partie sera utilisée pour des frais de santé  familiales.
texts.en:
The members of the Miriya solidarity group are married women who average 40 years of age and six children each. They live with their husbands and children in nuclear families in Sido, prefecture of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They came together as neighbours, and through their business activities and ties of kinship. 

In order to meet customer demand and expand their businesses, they joined the loan program of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are now on their 11th loan. All previous loans have been fully repaid.  They apply their loans to the sale of non-alcoholic NBB beverages, plastic cooking utensils, and other miscellaneous items. As for Sali D., she sells fabrics and pagnes (colourful West-African cloth).  

Sali D. plans to use the new loan to buy fifty meters of khaki fabric, ten Wax pagnes, ten fancier pagnes, and ten Burkinabé blankets.  She gets her stocks from wholesalers in Bamako, and conducts her retail sales from her home and at the market, for cash or credit, to a customer base consisting of both men and women. 

With this loan, she expects to earn a monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, part of which will be reinvested in the business, the remainder to be used for the family’s healthcare expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Mrs. Sou S., born in 1976, is a villager who lives in Preaek Samraong village in Kandal province. She is a seamstress in a garment factory where she is able to earn a small salary to support her family. Though she works hard, she does not earn enough money to adequately support her family. For this reason, in order to increase her income and improve the family’s living conditions, she would like to ask for a loan in order to buy a fruit shake machine and fruit. She plans to start a new business offering fruit shakes for sale.
  
Mrs. Sou S. is a widow with two children who are students in the local school. They will also help their mother in her business.

loans.use: To buy a fruit shake machine and fruit in order to start a new business offering fruit shakes for sale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 41 años, es una madre soltera muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. En su pequeño Paucarmarca Julia a pasado la mayor parte de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió la actividad familiar y es por eso que ahora se dedica al cultivo de choclo, papa y arveja, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener ella sola a su familia. Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista, ya que los transportes son muy escasos por su zona. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus créditos y espera serlo también ahora, en su banco comunal pues es muy activa y muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono y fertilizantes para sus chacras.
texts.en: Julia, 41, is a hardworking and loving single mother.  She lives in her own home with her 4 beloved children, and what she wants most is to improve their quality of life.  Julia has lived in small Paucarmarca for most of her life.  When she was a small girl she learned farming from her family, and so now she cultivates corn, potatoes and peas.  This work has given her the income she needs to support her family on her own.  She sells everything that she harvests in the wholesale market of Tarma, which is where she can get the best prices for her products.  What she likes most about her work is sowing her fields, which she does with a lot of care.  She has been farming for 21 years, and what she considers most difficult is transporting her products to the wholesale market, since means of transportation are scarce in her area.  Over time, she wants to buy new land so that she can increase her production.  This is her 6th loan with MFP, and she has been very punctual with her payments and expects to continue to do so now.  In her communal bank, she is very active and is well-liked by her fellow group members.  With the 1,500 Peruvian soles she requests, she will buy organic and chemical fertilizers for her farmlands.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en: Jean Baptiste M. is 43 years old, married, and has four children. For five years, Jean Baptiste has sold food such as beans, bananas, and meat in his small restaurant. His business is open from 8 am to 8 pm every day except on the weekends.  He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase additional food and drinks such as rice, soft drinks, bananas, and cassava flour to sell in his restaurant.  Jean Baptiste hopes to earn more profits which will allow him to save in the future.

loans.use: To purchase food  for his restaurant

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 48 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. Her chidren's ages are 22, 21 and 10.

Myrna is a farmer and primarily grows corn. She sells her harvest to the market. Myrna also loves to cook and is now earning from her canteen. Myrna wishes for her business to prosper. She also hopes to be able to improve her family's living conditions.

Myrna's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and cooking ingredients such as oil and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and cooking ingredients such as oil and vegetables

loans.name: Kertha Bakti Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh T. and all members of the Kertha Bakti group continue taking out loans for their third period. For this loan,  two members could not attend the meeting because of some reasons. A person on behalf of Ni Nengah W. who is on Sumbawa and one person is in the photo on behalf of Ni Ketut W. who was sick. 

Ni Luh T. is getting a loan Rp.1,500,000. This loan is now used to buy three piglets. Currently the price of piglets is very expensive; one piglet costs Rp. 400,000. Ni Luh T. spent Rp. 1,200,000 for piglets and she is paying for the feed from the profit on  earlier sales. Every month she spends Rp. 500,000 for food, water, electricity and for her children.

loans.use: To buy three piglets.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Lhagvasuren is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. His three children all attend the local secondary school. He manages a meat trading business at a local market with the help of his wife. He started his business in 1998 and gained much experience. Sometimes he goes to near provinces to sell meat by using his car. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase meat and meat products for his business.

loans.use: to purchase meat and meat products to resell.

loans.name: John Munga

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past 21 years.  He is 46 years old, married to Grace Wangui and they have four children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 58 years old and is a married mother of 5 children who are all adults. She is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya, where she has been farming for 31 years. Her farm produces tea, bananas, maize and beans, which are all sold locally. She earns additional income from her cereals business in the same area.

Jane has made a loan request of 45,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help improve her family's livelihood. She faces the challenge of lack of enough farm implements and fertilizers. She plans to acquire more land in the future and expand her farming activities.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 27 years.   She  also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. 

Luzviminda  is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy a planer and other materials for her furniture-making business.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy a planer and materials to make furniture

loans.name: Relin

texts.en:
Relin is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Relin has a retail shop that sells canned goods, biscuits & breads. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & breads.

Relin is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Relin hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & breads

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, aged 40, is married with three school-aged children. She has a retail shop where she sells different products that she can offer to the community. Maria has had this business for 18 years and she earns approximately PHP 3,000 monthly.

Maria is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase a variety of products so that she can offer more products to the community to acquire more customers, thus increasing her income. She wants to buy canned goods, noodles and other daily basic necessities to sell to the community.

In the future, Maria hopes that her business will expand to sustain her family's daily needs and also to finance her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles and other daily basic necessities to sell

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Since 1979, Mrs. Sam, 48, has been living in the Prey Chor district. She currently works in the farming business as a rice cultivator. She is able to earn an income of approximately $1 per day to cover the family’s needs. They have six single children.  Two of their kids are working as security guards in Phnom Penh. They get a specific salary every month. From their low income, they always contribute some to Mrs. Sam to be used for the entire family. Mrs. Sam is requesting a loan to purchase many sacks of fertilizers, seeds, and other farming materials.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farming materials.

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 17,16 y 11 años  de edad, la Sra. Rosa es confeccionista de ropa, parches y venta de ropa que ella misma confecciona, ya lleva en el negocio más de 2 años y decidió este trabajo porque estudio para confección en la universidad la Cantuta. La Sra. Rosa es muy conocida en la ciudad por sus bonitos diseños que ella misma crea. El crédito lo va a invertir en ampliar su negocio y en la compra de tela para sus creaciones textiles. Su sueño principal es poder ampliar su negocio y ser reconocida en todo Nazca y aun día exportar su ropa al extranjero; ella está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que así va a poder crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is 45 years old and a single mother with three children (ages 17, 16, and 11). She earns her livelihood by making, mending, and selling clothes. Rosa has been in business for more than two years and decided to pursue this line of work because she studied dressmaking at La Cantuta University.

Sra. Rosa is well-known in the city for the beautiful designs that she creates. This loan will be invested in the expansion her business. She plans to buy fabrics used in her creations. Her main wish is to expand her business so that she becomes known throughout all of Nazca. Someday she would like to export her clothing abroad. Rosa is extremely grateful for the loan that has been provided because it will allow her to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Dionicio Guadalupe

texts.es:
Don Dionicio  de profesion cadete de taxi, con mas de veinti dos años de experiencia, el taxi es de su propiedad, sus hijos son mayores y su esposa es comerciante en venta de ropa y zapatos.
Don Dionicio ha mejorado mucho la infraestructura de su casa, con los creditos anteriores logro terminar el muro de su casa. y con ahorros y parte de los prestamos en Afodenic tambien su casa, la lleva bien avanzada. Lo que hara con este nuevo prestamo es poner cesenta metros de ceramica, quedando solo detalles pequeños para pasarce. Y poder estar mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
By profession, Dionicio is a taxi driver with over 22 years’ experience.  He owns the taxi.  His children are adults and his wife is a clothing and shoe merchant.

Dionicio has improved his house’s infrastructure quite a bit.  With previous loans he managed to finish the walls and with savings and part of the Afodenic loans also the house itself which he’s quite advanced with.  What he’ll do with the next loan is to install sixty meters of tile leaving only small details still pending to improve his family’s conditions.

loans.use: to buy tile for his living room.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Magda; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella vende chompas, polos, pantalones, muñecas y llaveros, la socia vende la artesanía en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar la venta de artesanía como chompas, muñecas y llaveros.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the “CUSCO” communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The associate is Señora Magda.  She is 41 years of age and single with one son.  The associate alternates her daily activities with the business of selling artesan crafts.  She sells sweaters, shirts, pants, bracelets and key rings.  She sells the crafts on foot from 8AM to 7PM.  By means of this business she helps her son move ahead.  The associate would like to grow her business of selling crafts.  She requests a loan to be able to sell artesan crafts such as sweaters, bracelets and key rings.  

 The associate is happy with the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to offer crafts for sale such as sweaters, bracelets and key rings.

loans.name: Duo Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.es: Duo Bendicion D. Dios: Este duo esta integrado por doña Marta Olivia D. 48 años D. edad y tiene dos hijos,ella se dedica a la venta D. telas para confeccionar prendas D. vestir, ella nos cuenta que esta contenta porque sus ventas han aumentado y por eso esta solicitnaod este credito para la compra D. telas para confeccionar prendas D. vestir.al igual que la siguiente socia esta solicitnaod este credito para la compra D. telas ya que ella se dedica a la confeccion D. prendas D. vestir.
texts.en: Duo Bendicion D. Dios (God’s Blessing Duo) was formed by Marta Olivia who is 48 years old and has two children. She sells fabric to make clothes. She says that she’s happy because her sales have increased and for that reason she is asking for this loan to buy fabric to make clothes like the other group member who is asking for a loan to buy fabric since she makes clothes.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothes

loans.name: Julia Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PRO DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Pisaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia Rosa; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ganados, ella lleva a lugares como Anta y Sicuani y Compabata y también la socia vende emolientes como son mates, ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados y también vende de emolientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar un ganado y para comprar insumos para preparar los emolientes como cebada y azúcar al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Pro Desarrollo" (For Development).  The bank is located in the Pisaq District, which belongs to Calca Province and Cusco Department.

The member is Sra. Julia Rosa.  She is 36 years old, married and has 3 children.  The member's daily activities include buying and selling livestock, which she brings to places such as Anta, Sicuani and Compabata, and selling "emolientes" (a local breakfast beverage) like mates.  She works from 5:00a.m. until 10:00p.m.  Through these businesses, the member is able to help her children get ahead.  She would like to expand her livestock business as well as her "emolientes" business.  The member is requesting the loan to purchase a head of livestock and "emolientes" making supplies like wholesale barley and sugar.

The member is happy about the loan and promises to comply with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase a head of livestock and supplies for making "emolientes" (a local breakfast beverage), like wholesale barley and sugar.

loans.name: Clever Jose

texts.es: Clever tiene 23 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de nintendos. Desde hace mas de 4 años que tiene este negocio a su cargo. el se hace cargo de la administración de su local, todos los días lo abre desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes, le proporciona una gran ventaja y además el lo inicio porque no tiene competencia pues solamente él tiene este tipo de negocio. Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de controles, discos, televisores, entre otros.
texts.en: Clever José is 23 years old and has a business offering Nintendo services. He has had this business for the last 4 years. He is in charge of managing his premises and every day opens from 8 in the morning until 9 at night. He offers his customers good service which gives him a big advantage and he also started the business because no one offers this kind service in the area; he is the only one. He is asking for a loan to buy television sets, controls, discs and the like.

loans.use: to buy controls, discs, televisions and other such products.

loans.name: Gungano Group

texts.en:
Kudakwashe is 25 years old and single, but looking after three dependents. He lives in Gweru and sells groceries and fast foods in the same area. He has been operating  this business for the past four years. Kudakwashe is applying for a loan of $400 which he will use to buy groceries and a chip fryer, as he is currently unable to meet demand with his current capital resources.

He is facing the working capital challenges as well as being unable to meet demand. He used to borrow from his community and once got a loan from Microking which he paid well. Kudakwashe hopes that getting this loan will enable him to get enough income to look after his dependents as well as upgrading his standard of life.
