loans.use: to stock groceries and buy a chip fryer.

loans.name: Norway Group

texts.en:
Dastan, who is in his early 30s, is married with triplets who are still young. He has been selling chips and chicken, chips and eggs, and chips and mishikaki for one year now. He works from 8 a.m to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy Irish potatoes, pay rent, and take care of his triplets. He has paid back his loans successfully. Dastan wants a loan to buy more sacks of Irish potatoes, chicken, and eggs. His dream is to one day be able to buy a plot of land.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Norway", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accoutable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of Irish potatoes, chicken, and eggs.

loans.name: Jugdernamjil

texts.en: Jugdernamjil is 33 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian nomadic tent) in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her husband runs a raw materials retailing business and her son goes to kindergarden. She started her small hairdressing salon in 2005. She has two very talented employees who are fast and good at their job. Her salon is the only one in a 1 km radius. Now that her business equipment is getting old, she needs to renew the equipment. She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy new equipment for her salon.

loans.use: To buy new equipment

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with four school-going children. Her husband is a mason who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Riziki has operated a food stall for the past nine years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With this loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 48-year-old married woman with one son and one daughter. She has a beauty salon, which is her sole source of income. Her daughter also works with her in the salon. 
Sawsan wants to make some repairs to her salon, such as painting, changing the windows and the door, etc. She also wants to purchase a beauty salon kit (such as hair creams and shampoo, hairdryers, different types of hairbrush, etc.) in order to improve her work. She does not have sufficient funds for this, so she wants to take a loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner FATEN. When Sawsan receives the loan, she will make the necessary repairs to her beauty salon and purchase a new beauty salon kit. This will enable her to improve her salon and work to satisfy her customers and increase her income. 
Sawsan is a conservative woman, so her daughter is photographed in the salon instead.

loans.use: to make some repairs and purchase a beauty salon kit.

loans.name: Moussiratou

texts.fr: Dame Aba est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente de divers, de riz, d'huiles et de l'eau glacée à domicile. Très connue dans son quartier, elle s'approvisionne au marché environnantes. La cliente sollicite le concours de Finadev pour l'obtention d'un prêt afin de pouvoir faire face aux charges  personnelles et familiales.
texts.en: Mrs. Aba is married and the mother of five. She specializes in selling miscellaneous items, rice, vegetable oil and iced water out of her house. Very well known in her neighborhood, she stocks up at nearby markets. This client is seeking the support of Finadev to obtain a loan which would allow her to cover personal and family expenses.

loans.use: to buy  25 big bottles of mayonnaise, 100 1-kg bags of rice, 100 1-liter bottles of oil, etc

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 40 years old and married to Stephen. They have five children.

She has been in this business for the last eight years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 6,000.  She is applying for her second loan of Kes 20,000.  She paid the previous loan well and in good time.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

Eunice hopes to use the funds to buy more vegetables and fruits for sale.  She would like open up a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is 40 years old, married to Veronica and they have four children.  He has been in the dairy farming business for the last seven years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 5,000.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET Ltd for KES 20,000 to buy dairy feed, pesticides and seedlings. He plans to save the profits to buy a large water pump.


His hopes and dreams are to purchase another farming plot and to help educate his children.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, dairy feed and pesticides.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 26 year old married woman from Al Zarqa in Jordan. She has 2 children and has requested a 900 JOD loan to buy woman and children clothes and perfumes to resell for her friends and neighbors in the same of area. In the future, she is planning to expand her project, open her own shop, and buy a house. Since Amal is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfumes to resell

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 41 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela,  por sus escasos recursos. Empezó a trabajar desde muy pequeño, se acompaño hace 6 años y tiene 2 hijas. La esposa se dedica al cuido del hogar. Sus hijos viven junto a ellos.

El señor se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 25 años, oficio que aprendió de su padre. Por vivir en la zona costera a pocos metros del mar. Decidió hacer este oficio, pues es su medio de subsistencia. Su trabajo lo realiza en horas de la noche.

El crédito se invertirá para comprar 2 redes, con las cuales mejorara los volúmenes de pesca,  al ser un implemento de suma importancia para su trabajo. Por el momento, trabaja como ayudante de un amigo en su apero de pesca.


Al consultarle sobre sus aspiraciones o sueños, el cliente comento que tiene como meta trabajar duro y poder comprar su propio apero“lancha y motor”. Para con el trabajar y obtener los ingresos suficientes, para los gastos a cubrir en su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 41, did not have the opportunity to attend school due to scarce resources. He started working at an early age. He has been married for 6 years and has 2 daughters. His wife is dedicated to the care of the home. Their children live with them.
Jose has been engaged in fishing for 25 years, a trade he learned from his father by living in a coastal area a few meters from the sea. He decided to do this job because it is their livelihood. He does his work in the evening hours.
The loan will be invested to buy two nets that will improve fishing volumes. They will be a tool of great importance for his work. For now, he works as an assistant to a friend with his friend's fishing nets. 
When asked about his aspirations and dreams, the client commented that he aims to work hard and be able to buy his own tools, specifically a "boat and engine" for the work to earn enough income to cover expenses in his family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 fishing nets.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a member of NWTF and the mother of Angelica (the student who is in the picture). She is borrowing 5,000 PHP to pay for Angelica's tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2014-2015. 

Angelica is 17 years old and is the first of four children in the family. She is currently in the first year of her two-year Associate in Secretarial Science course. Angelica plans to graduate and to be gainfully employed.



-NWTF provides the picture of either both the member and the student or the student alone. But in the information we stated who is the member and how is she/he related to the student.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Rashid. He is married and has two children who are two and fourteen years old. In 2000, Rashid established his cosmetics business. He first engaged in mining, but he was not successful, so he decided to enter into his current business. 

Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 6,000,000. Rashid requires a loan in order to buy more cosmetic goods of different kinds for resale. In the future, Rashid plans to give his children a very good education. He is very hardworking. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy false hair and jewelry.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah is 44 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by nine farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Sarah has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Sarah also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Sarah's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a widowed woman. She has three children. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential for business, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
37-year-old Hen is a resident in Tbaung Khmum province and a married mother of six dependent children, three of whom are in school and the other one is under the age of school. To make a living, she grows cassava and rice and she has been involved in farming business for 19 years. Earning about USD10 per day, Hen is able to save about USD5 each day for future needs. 
This time, it will be the ninth cycle for her with VisionFund and past loans have had great impacts on her as she can buy more agricultural tools and house supplies and send her children to school. She will use her loan to support her cassava and rice farm by purchasing organic fertilizer and organic pesticide and to pay for labor fees. Some part of loan left will be used to buy school supplies for her school-age children. She hopes that this loan not only will help her improve her farming business, but also create more jobs for her neighbors. She also hopes to support her children’s education and to buy additional plot of farmland.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields to support her children’s education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. is a Muganda by tribe. She was working in a salon as a hair dresser that closed down when it was not able to pay the high trading license fee to the Kampala city council.

She was unemployed at home until her sister Annet Nansubuga, a Life in Africa member, called her to come and join the Life in Africa community and become involved in the community initiatives. When she stepped in Life in Africa community group, she saw it was a true life in Africa. The first thing that interested her was finding people dressed in African attire and making handcrafts as the best tool to sustain themselves. She was so inspired by the activities at LiA that she started learning what others were doing. She is a person who is quick to learn, and there is no doubt that she is now among the experts in bracelet-making and paper beads production.

Margaret has a brother who is jobless but who has experience in selling second-hand clothes at Owino Market in town. Her plan is to set up a used clothing business with her brother, who will run the business. She is seeking a loan amount of 250,000 Uganda shillings that she will repay in 10 months. (1 USD = 1,722 UGX). She expects to earn 180,000 UGX per month to add to her own income after paying her brother.

Below is her budget:

-Second hand clothes for 100,000 UGX

-Second hand ladies shoes for 100,000 UGX

-Stall rent for 2 months 40000 UGX

-Transport 10,000 UGX

Total 250,000 Uganda shillings

loans.use: Buying and selling ladies second-hand shoes and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She wants to buy variety of household goods and cereal foods

loans.name: Hursheda

texts.ru:
R. Hursheda , молодая энергичная женщина, одна из первых клиентов Микроинвеста. Замужем и имеет трое детей. Муж помогает ей. Раньше работала на платочной фабрике, после сокращения она решила с мужем заниматься бизнесом. R. Hursheda продает детские и мужские одежды. Товары привозит сама из Истаравшана. Hursheda когда едет за товарами муж вместо нее торгует. Hursheda хочет расширить ассортимент своих товаров. Бизнес она начинала с 70 долларов. Сейчас она запрашивает 1000 долларов для расширения сезонных товаров. Хочет поехать за товарами в Китай.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Hursheda R., young and energetic woman, is one of the first clients of MLF MicroInvest. She is married, and has 3 children. Her husband helps her. In the past, Hursheda R. worked on a factory making scarves. After being laid off, she and her husband decided to start a business. Today, Hursheda R. sells clothing for men and children. She personally delivers her goods from Istaravshana. While Hursheda is away, her husband runs the business. Hursheda wants to expand the variety of the goods sold. She began her business with $70. Now, she asks for $1,000 loan to expand the selection of seasonal items. She plans to acquire the goods in China.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality clothes

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Mrs. Christy O. is a 37 year old woman who sells female wraps & shoes to people. She is married with two (2) children. She is proud of her business and promises to effectively use the loan amount $800 to expand her business. She has been in this business since 2002 and has been a LAPO leader for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more female wraps & shoes

loans.name: Puao

texts.en: Puao is married and has three children.  She owns a taro plantation.  Her sons and her husband help her maintain the plantation.  Her last loan of 1250 Tala, or $500, was also used to buy supplies for her business. She applied for this loan so that she can support her family while continuing to expand her plantation.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Mrs. Salima G., 29 years old, is a resident of Baghdol. Baghdol is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small business activities. Mrs. G. lives with her husband. Mrs. G. and her husband, Mr. Shyam Bahadur G., opened the grocery shop two years ago. They sell different types of grocery goods in their shop like rice, maize, paddy, and bitten rice. Due to lack of money they cannot expand their business. So she seeks a loan to buy necessary goods like noodles, biscuits and others various grocery goods, to invest in their business and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Miss Rosemary O. is 20 years old. She is single and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells women's clothes. She needs $875 to enable her to buy more clothes for sale. She studied her kind of business for a period of six months and started her shop in 2006. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothes for sale

loans.name: Sultonmurod

texts.ru:
Sultonmurod A. is a resident of the Gissar region. He is 32 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a college degree. Currently he is making his living by selling groceries and is requesting a loan of 1500 somoni. Mr. A. is planning to use the money to purchase additional goods so that he can increase the variety of items his store offers for sale. He is hoping to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Абдуллоев Султонмурод житель Гиссарского района. Женат, имеет 4детей.Возраст 32 года. Образование высшее. Ззанимается торговлей продуктов питания. запрашивает кредит на сумму 1500 сомони . Хочет привести дополнительный товар для того чтобы увеличить товарооборота. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase of goods turnover

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
Karomat is 35 years old and is married with four children. She is a market vendor who sells grains and legumes. Karomat travels to the neighboring country of Uzbekistan to purchase her goods. As a rule, Karomat sells her grains and legumes in the local market of her home city as well as in the market of the neighboring region of Isfara. The business is successful, allowing Karomat to contribute significantly to the family budget and to help her husband support their family and her husband's parents.

Karomat plans to increase the range of goods for sale. For this purpose, she requests US $650.00 for 3 months. Karomat has proven herself as a reliable client with several years of cooperation with IMON. She promises to manage the loan with accuracy and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Mrs Toyin A. is a struggling woman who lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. At 39 years of age with 4 children, she is the breadwinner of her family. She is trying her best to sell her frozen foods (turkey, chicken and fish) with just a deep freezer in the center of a local market in her community.

She acquired the skill of trading in 2 years, and has been in her business since 1993. Toyin is requesting a loan of $875 to buy a deep freezer and more frozen food so that she can increase the prosperity of her business.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food (chicken,turkey and fish)

loans.name: Dios Puede Group

texts.en:
Elise is a 37 year-old woman who lives with her 2 children (ages 2 and 10) in Padre Granero. Her husband, Alexi, works at a nearby store called “Casa Nelson” which sells clothing and household goods. This will be the 2nd loan for Elise, and she told us that she is very excited because her business has already improved so much over the past 6 months. She has been selling clothes for 15 years, but has never had the capital to expand or improve her business. Her dreams for the future are to own a home and a proper business.

For 10 of the women in Padre Granero this will be their 1st loan with Esperanza, and for the other 10 this will be their second. It has been such a joy and an honor for us to work with these women over the past 6 months, and we are excited to add more to the group. On behalf of Esperanza, thank you for continually supporting and encouraging these women. God Bless!

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: La Buena Nueva Group

texts.en:
Working to support her five children, Juana B. has started her own business of selling and refilling propane.  She lives on the outskirts of Samana in the Domincian Republic.  Juana has established a positive repayment record with Esperanza with her previous four loans that she has completed.  This particular loan will be used to purchase more propane canisters as well as the liquid fuel itself.  When she is not working, Juana spends most of her time attending to her four children (ages 1, 3, 5, and 10) who are still living in the house.  It is her goal to one day own the property that she is currently renting to run her business.

Juana Barett is just one member of the 5 person micro-bank, La Buena Nueva.  Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own.  The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.

On behalf of Juana, La Buena Nueva group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To purchase more propane and gas canisters for her business.

loans.name: Lauama

texts.en:
Lauama S., 39, is married with 2 children. She has 4 years of experience in the Vegetable Garden business. She sells to the village people 5 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).

SPBD loans are Lauama’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use all the loan money to start the business.

loans.use: Buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer for soil, also spade

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Fatoumata H., 58, is a widow with 6 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Santhiaba Mosquée for 5 years. Fatoumata wants a loan for the sale of palm oil, honey, and myrrh oil. It’s a business that she has been engaged in for several years without major difficulties. It allows her to accomplish some goals and to participate in the support of her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Fatoumata H., 58 ans est veuve avec 06 enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Santhiaba Mosquée depuis 5 ans. Fatoumata veut un prêt pour la vente de l’huile de palme, du miel et de l’huile de myrrhe. C’est une activité qu’elle mène depuis plusieurs années sans difficultés majeures et qui lui permet de faire des réalisations et de participer à l’entretient de sa famille. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
purchase and sale of honey, palm oil, and myrrh oil

Achat et revente de miel, huile de palme et huile de myrrhe

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa A. is a 30-year-old married woman with three children who are all in school. Yaa sells frozen foods in the local market, but she says profits from sales is very low because she pays high rent on the store she operates from. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods to enable her to raise enough income to build a permanent store for herself. She is a member of the group called Amen. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc

loans.name: Bahtigul

texts.en: U. Bahtigul is 22 years old and lives in the Spitamen region. She is engaged in the livestock and agricultural business. Mrs. U. Bahtigul grows and sells rice and wheat, and also purchases and sells livestock. Mrs. U. Bahtigul has requested a business development loan of 3800 STJ to be paid back over 4 months. She will use this to fulfill seasonal duties of her livestock and agricultural business. She thanks KIVA for their support and wishes them all the best.

loans.use: Fulfilling seasonal duties

loans.name: Tijara

texts.en:
Tijara A. has been a tailor and firewood-seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for four years. She works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $125 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more materials for her tailoring busines and increase her inventory of firewood to sell.

Tijara is 23 years old, single, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Avenir Group

texts.en: Fidele K. sells cartons of eggs. He has to go out to deliver eggs to his clients and to look for new clients everyday. It is hard work, but he likes it. He has been in this business since 1995. Fidele fell sick in 1997 and was hospitalized.  He lost most of his clients and his business closed, as there was no one to continue running it. In 1998, after his recovery, Fidele re-launched his business with $100 of capital. His business was too small and limited in size. Gradually and with the profit generated by his business, Fidele has increased his stock to 40 cartons of eggs. Last July he joined one of Hope’s groups named “Avenir,” meaning “Future” in English, and through the loan Fidele’s business has been strengthened. (Hope is Kiva's Field Partner.) With his next loan, Fidele plans to deliver eggs to clients four days per week instead of three. He wants to build a henhouse so that he can have variety of chicken products to sell to his customers. Fidele is 52 years old. He is married and the father of seven children, who are between the ages of 2 and 21.

loans.use: To build a henhouse so he can have variety of chicken products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Huoy Vann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people in Ra village in Kampong Chhnang province formed this village bank and Mrs. Huoy V. is the bank president. She is a dry fish seller in the local market. Aside from this business, she is also a vegetable seller. Because the second business is going well, she wants to expand it and decided to purchase more vegetables to resell. Mrs. Huoy V. is a 52 year old widow with two children who are attending the local school. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loan and the rest of have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable to resell.

loans.name: Divine Elévation Group

texts.en:
Théophile started his business in 1998. With just $150 in starting capital, he began selling sacks of manioc, which he purchased in Lower Congo. Over the years, he decided to diversify his business by adding beverages to meet the high demand of the clients in his area.

With hard work and good management, Théophile’s business has prospered. He makes a profit of about $30 per day. Théophile is well known in his area as a good business man because of his organization and his ability to attract customers. His goal is to be a beverage provider in his community.

Théophile has been a member of his community bank since last November. He is 43 years old, married, and has two children. He also takes care of two other children.

loans.use: To purchase three crates of soft drinks

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: A sus 29 años, Rosmery a incursionado en varios negocios, vive en la casa de sus padres, en un cuarto que comparte con su hermana. Siendo todavía joven, Rosmery a puesto en marcha diversos negocios, ahora ella esta trabajando en la venta de tejidos artesanales, tiene recién un año en esta actividad y le esta yendo muy bien, pero tiene muchas dificultades en conseguir los tejidos, ya que tiene que recolectarlos de varias tejedoras. En su pequeño puesto de venta, ella ordena los tejidos artesanales por grupos, es muy ordenada en su negocio y es que se divierte mucho vendiendo  y conversando con sus habituales clientes, desea que en el futuro su puesto prospere y sea muy conocido, para ello trabaja duro y sin descanso. Es el quinto préstamo al que accede Rosmery en MFP, no ha tenido problemas en pagar los anteriores créditos y espera esta ves tampoco tenerlos, en su banco comunal le tienen mucha confianza, ya que es una de las socias más serias y cumplidas. Con dinero solicitado incrementará su mercadería para surtir mejor su puesto, es por eso que invertirá todo el monto del crédito en comprar mas tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
At the age of 29, Rosemary has already been involved in several business ventures. She lives in her parents' house in a room which she shares with her sister. Even though she's young, Rosemary has had several businesses - the current one being the sale of knitted handicrafts. She has been doing this for about a year and things are going well, even though she has some problems obtaining the products to sell because they are made by a number of different people. Her stall in the market is well organized with the different products grouped together. She has a good time selling and talking with her regular clients. She hopes to prosper in this business and become well known. She is a tireless and hard worker. This is the fifth MFP loan to Rosemary. There have been no problems with the previous loans, and she is confident there will be none with this one. She is well regarded by the community bank as one of their most serious and responsible members. This loan will allow her to order more articles to sell, and in a wider variety. The full loan amount will be used to purchase more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Y. is 28 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has two children: both of them are still young and under her care. She is married to Mean, 30, who is a farmer. Y. has grown vegetables since 1998. She sells eight times a year to her customers in the market in bulk at a good price. She is a struggling mother and a responsible neighbor and she earns a better income.

Recently, Y. wants to increase her income by hiring her neighbor's plot of land for her planting. So Y. is looking for a loan to buy more vegetable seeds and to hire the land. She dreams of having a degree for her children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable seeds and to hire land

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
AMANDA P. D. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres D. Éxito” con domicilio en la Urbanización el triunfo Mz. 30 Lt. 13 San Fernando del distrito D. Callería, tiene 51 años, 03 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo D. conductor D. moto taxi.
La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que afianzó su trabajo en costura.  Ese préstamo le dio un impulso, ya que pudo comprar material para confección y debía D. producir para devolver el dinero, por lo tanto empezó a ver esa actividad, como una empresa.
Actualmente el préstamo D. S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. algodón, telas, hilos, blondas y todo tipo D. lencería, que es necesario para sus acabados, y también está apoyando a su cónyuge con el mantenimiento y reparación D. su moto taxi, ya que el también ayuda con el pago D. las cuotas, tiene una linda familia y está feliz.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda en préstamos a las mujeres, y que estas puedan ayudar a sus familias, es un gusto ser una socia D. su banquito comunal.
texts.en:
AMANDA P. D. R. belongs to the “Mujeres D. Éxito” (Successful Women) Communal Bank, she lives at Mz. 30 Lt. 13 San Fernando in the El Triunfo neighborhood, Callería district. She is 51 years old, has 3 children and her husband works as a motortaxi driver. Her first loan for S.300.00 Nuevos Soles financed her seamstress work. That loan gave her her start as she could buy material to make her items and she was able to return the money. So she began to see this activity as a business. Today she seeks a loan for S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles to buy cotton, fabric, needles, silk lace and all kinds of linens, whish are necessary for her clothing, and also this supports her husband in maintaining and repairing his motortaxi; he also help with the payments. She has a beautiful family and is happy. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for its help with loans to women, and with them they can help their families. It is a pleasure to be a member of her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cotton, fabric, needles, silk lace and all kinds of linen

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer S. is a single young man with big wishes of improvement; he started his beauty salon 4 years ago, offering his services as a hair stylist. Because of his love for this job and the good service he offers his clientele has multiplied and his business has grown.

In order to offer high quality services, Samer is requesting a US $1000 loan, which he’ll invest in the renovation of his salon and buy more marketing products and supplies. You can be part of Samer’s accomplishments and he is sincerely thankful for the help you are providing him.

loans.use: Salon renovation and purchase of products and supplies

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 28 year old man who lives in the Bekaa. Ayman has been working as an agriculturalist since 2006. He owns a beekeeping business and also a tractor for working his field and cattle. Ayman requested a loan of 1500 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase cattle. This is the first time that Ayman has requested a loan.

Ayman is special because he likes what he does. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he passed through some financial issues. Ayman decided on his business because he took after his father’s work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Fanny Brigida

texts.es: Fanny tiene 1 hijo de 4 años de edad. Fanny se dedica al corte de carne, tiene un puesto junto a su hijo donde han comprado una cortadora de carne, por otra parte, su esposo tiene su auto propio con el que trabaja personalmente. Cuentan con mucha experiencia en el negocio ya que anteriormente solo trabajaban como dependientes y en la actualidad ya son propietarios del negocio. El sector donde se desarrolla su actividad es en el mercado la pampa sector venta de carnes sector accesible donde los clientes están cerca de la caseta donde cortan la carne. La competencia es moderada ya que son muy conocidos en el rubro. El destino del crédito fue para  capital de operación, en el crédito anterior a tenido retrasos debido a que la cliente a estado viajando constantemente a la ciudad de La Paz donde vive su papa esto porque su padre esta en muy mal estado de salud.
texts.en:
Fanny has 1 son who is 4 years old. Fanny is a butcher and has a stall with her son. They have purchased a meat cutter. Her husband has his own car with which he works on his own. They have extensive business experience since they previously worked as employees but currently own their own businesses. The sector where her business is located is in the La Pampa market in the meat selling area which is accessible for customers so that they are near where the meat is cut. Competition is moderate as they are well known in the area. Fanny's previous loan was used as operating capital. Payments of her previous loan were delayed because she had to constantly travel to the city of La Paz where her father lives because he is in very bad health.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for her business.

loans.name: Nia Safi Group

texts.en:
Fatma has been a retail business-woman in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She sells perfumes, shoes, and soap. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately US$ 90. Every day she works at her business from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more perfumes, shoes and soap to add to her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Fatma is 29 years old, married, and has three children: ages 13, 12 and 1. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mtukwao, Mtumwa, and Maryam. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, perfume and soap to add to her current stock

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora K. is 47 years old. She is married and has given birth to 10 children, two sons and eight daughters. All are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dora sells vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbages, and so forth on a tabletop in the market square. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and Kumasi. Dora also treks to other markets to sell. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en:
Sahib (his son is pictured) was born in 1956. He is married and has two children. Sahib is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, settled in this Fuzuli region in the Finnish houses.

Sahib has been in his sheep-breeding business for five years. Now he needs a loan of 1,200 AZN to buy twelve sheep for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy twelve sheep

loans.name: Concerned Women Group

texts.en: Garmai is married with 7 children (aged 26, 23, 21, 19, 16, 14, and 10); their levels of education are college,11th, 8th, 7th, 4th, and 1st grade respectively. She’s currently engaged with the sale of fish (purchased wholesale and sold retail) with 18 years of experience in the business. Garmai dreams of her business moving forward as she’s desirous of seeing her family becoming successful as well.

loans.use: additional cartons of fish for sale retail

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace S. is from the village of Brgy. 5, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling electronic load or communication (cellular phone) services in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital for her e-load business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Mrs. Savy T. is a farmer in Doem Pour village in Takeo province. In her plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile and is affecting her crops. In order to deal with this problem, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve the field and to increase crop production. Her husband, Mr. Seang Rotha, is a construction worker. Mrs. Savy T. is 35 years old and the mother of five children. Two of her children are farmers while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field to increase crop production.

loans.name: Mujres Victoriosas 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Eufemia Vera is the group coordinator for her Bank of Hope and an associate of Esperanza International looking to start her first loan cycle. She lives in the north part of the capital Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic, a poor area where electricity and running water are unpredictable.

Eufemia sells cleaning products. She is planning on using this loan to buy more products for her customers to buy, such as bathroom cleaner, disinfectant, dish soap, laundry detergent, etc. With all of these products, she´s hoping that she´ll be able to earn enough to improve her house and make it a cleaner and safter place to raise her children.

She is very much looking forward to a prosperous future for herself and her family and thanks you all for your help.

loans.use: Bathroom cleaner, disinfectant, dish soap, laundry detergent

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 45 years old, married and living in the village of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela. They have two children and still studying.  Marilyn is glad that her husband is in full support with her small business. She hopes that they will be able to survive the hardships in life that they are experiencing.  

Marilyn manages  a village store located just in front of their house.  She is requesting for a loan of PHP13,000 for her village store.  She will budget the loan to purchase more groceries for her general store business and hoping that it will become profitable.  

She hopes that her business will continuously be supported by KIVA lenders so she can also provide a better living for their family.

loans.use: Additional capital for maintenance and further growth of her store

loans.name: 02.1.8 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hường  T. Thị is a 41-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Hường is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.1.8 Nam Ngạn.

Hường  is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Hường runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community.  Hường has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2.000.000 Vietnamese dong a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hường  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hường  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.626.900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hường plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  N. Thị Tố is a 64-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

2.  Ngô Thị Tự is a 54-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of operating a specialized retail store.

3.  N. Thị H. Nguyên is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

4.  B. Thị H. Tươi is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

5.  Ngô Thị Hương is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of running a food stall.

6.  Ngô thị Thanh is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of running a food stall.

7.  Đỗ Thị Phương is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

===================

Hường  T. Thị (39) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Hường  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.1.8 Nam Ngạn (02.02.1.8).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thực phẩm chiên trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hường  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hường  kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hường  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hường  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.626.900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Tố (46) là 64 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Ngô Thị Tư (44) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  N. Thị H. Nguyên (40) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


4.  B. Thị H. Tươi (41) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


5.  Ngô Thị Hương (42) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


6.  Ngô thị Thanh (43) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


7.  Đỗ Thị Phương (45) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Sewing dresses and curtains is the business of Anselma M.. Aside from sewing, she also sells cosmetic products within their village. Anselma is married to Rome and the have six children: Ryan Richard, 25 years old; Roderick, 23 years old; Efren, 20 years old; Rose, 16 years old. All of the eldest children are high school graduates; Romeo Jr., 14 years old, is now in 3rd year high school; and the youngest is Angelica, 5 years old. 

This couple would like to have a better living. They are doing their best to provide for all the needs of their children. Anselma says that, through her sacrifices in selling cosmetic products and her patience in sewing curtains and dresses, she is able to provide for the needs of her family. But due to the high cost of commodities, she can’t continue to meet all the needs of her children. Due to insufficient income, she would like to borrow additional capital, amounting to PHP 5,000, for business improvement. In order to purchase additional products, this loan will serve as a big help to her family.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is married with two children. Her husbend used to work in Israel but after the closure he helps her in her business.

Hanan established her workshop six years ago and currently has three workers in addition to herself and her husband. The sewing workshop is the only source of income for the family. She buys the cloth and sews it. She appears in the photo at her business.

Hanan has approached FATEN for 1,500 USD to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and thread

location.town: Taqou' Village, Bethlehem City, West Bank

loans.name: Brenda Veronica

texts.es: La señora Brenda Verónica es casada con el señor Héctor Rubén desde hace 14 años, y son padres de familia de 2 niñas ella labora para una casa  dándole mantenimiento y su esposo trabaja para una empresa, ellos como una familia joven, trabajadora  y muy responsable están tramitando este crédito para la colocación del vitropiso de su hogar para una vista diferente y se sientan mas cómodos.
texts.en:
Señora Brenda Verónica has been married to Señor Héctor Rubén for 14 years and they are the parents of two daughters. She works as a housekeeper and her husband works for a company. They are a young family that is hardworking and very responsible. They are taking out this loan to put tile in their home to improve its appearance and make them more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for tilework

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Emprendedoras es el grupo conformado por Elba C., Reyna M. y Olga R. tres mujeres trabajadoras, decididas y con muchos deseos de autosuperarse. La señora C. tiene un taller de carpintería oficio que aprendió de su padre y su especialidad es el diseño de muebles. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de madera, clavos, pinturas, pega, tornillos, bisagras, entre otros productos. 

Reyna M. vende prendas de oro y plata entre ellos anillos, cadenas, dijes y pulseras en distintos lugares y Olga R. tiene una tienda de ropa usada en su casa y vende también de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
The Enterprising Women Group is composed of Elba C., Reyna M., and Olga R., three determined, hard-working women with much desire to get ahead. Mrs. C. has a carpentry shop, a skill she learned from her father, and her specialty is designing furniture. She will invest her loan in buying wood, nails, paint, glue, screws, and hinges, among other things. Reyna sells gold and silver jewelry, including rings, chains, amulets, and bracelets in distinct places. Olga has a used clothing store in her house and also sells her goods on the street.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CARPENTRY SUPPLIES FOR FURNITURE MAKING

loans.name: Papa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Papa D. est un maçon de 42 ans qui habite à Yoff Tonghor un des quartiers de Yoff. Il est sociétaire de la caisse depuis mai 2004 et a déjà bénéficié de 3 prêts antérieurs.
Il est marie et père de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 1 an et demi et 10 ans. Monsieur  D. s’active principalement dans la construction de bâtiments depuis 1987. Il a choisi son métier par passion. Il est responsable de famille et son devoir est d’assurer la subsistance pour sa famille. Actuellement il vit dans la maison familiale alors qu’il dispose d’un terrain personnel. Son intention est de la construire pour améliorer le cadre de vie  et les conditions de bien être de sa famille. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs pour faire des briques dans le but d’envisager le démarrage des travaux.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  à exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié
texts.en:
Mr. Papa D., age 42, is a mason who lives in Yoff Tonghor, one of the neighborhoods in Yoff. He's been a member of UIMCEC since May 2004, and already benefitted from three previous loans. He's married and the father of three children, age one-and-a-half to ten. Since 1987, his main business has been construction. He chose this profession out of passion. He's responsible for his family and providing for them is a duty. He currently lives in his family's house, even though he owns a lot. He intends to build a house to improve the living environment and standard of his family. He's seeking a loan to make bricks in order to start the work. Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC, with the support of lenders, succeeds in supporting populations in revenue-generating activities, which promotes valuable socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To male bricks in order to build a house

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily J. is from the village of Talakag , Bukidnon. She is 39 years old. Emily is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns & operates a small sari sari store. She is engaged in buying and selling firewood and different varieties of bananas in the local community. Emily has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emily joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emily is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Emily from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Miguel Adan

texts.es: Miguel Adán tiene 50 años, su actividad económica es la venta de recargas telefónicas. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es un hombre muy responsable y además disfruta de su bello trabajo, por lo que cada día disfruta de su actividad económica y de relacionarse con cada uno de sus clientes, que son sus mismos vecinos por lo que siempre esta interactuando con ellos. Miguel tiene 3 hijos y con el esfuerzo de su actividad logro sacarlos adelante ahora ellos trabajan de manera independiente. Por lo que está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de recargas suficientes para satisfacer a sus clientela. El desea construir cuartos suficientes en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miguel Adán, 50, sells telephone cards. He has been doing this business for more than 3 years, and is a very responsible man enjoying the fruits of his work, both the economic benefit and the relationships with each one of his clients. Since they are his actual neighbors, he is always interacting with them. Miguel has 3 children, and through his hard work he has successfully gotten them ahead, and they are all working on their own now. He is requesting this loan to purchase enough cards to satisfy all his clients. He would also like to construct enough rooms in his house.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gulzamon

texts.ru: Бутаева Гулзамон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Муж, на заработках в Росии. Сама Гулзамон более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает скот. В этом ей помогают дети. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Gulzamon B. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 48 years old, married and has 8 children. Her husband is working in Russia. Gulzamon has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years. She raises and sells livestock. Her children help her with this business. Gulzamon is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock, in order to increase livestock quantity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Claudelina

texts.es:
La señora Claudelina P. tiene 36 años de edad, es de Carapeguá compañía Calixtro;  desde muy joven comenzó con los trabajos del campo, su cónyuge es empleado en una  fabrica donde se trabaja con cueros.
Viendo la necesidad de contar con más ingreso la señora decidió dedicarse a la venta de pollos, es una actividad en la que muy pocas personas se dedican, lo que hace que cuente con una gran cantidad de clientes en la zona.
La señora Claudelina P. solicita el crédito para compra de pollos ponedoras y parrilleros .
texts.en:
Claudelina P., 36, is from Carapeguá, Calixtro. She has worked in the fields since she was a young girl. Her husband works in a tannery. In order to generate more family income, she decided to raise chickens, an activity that few people are into in her area; this guarantees a large number of customers for her. Claudelina is asking for funds to buy laying hens and grills.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Ingrid Yucira

texts.es: Ingrid Yucira M. P. de 30 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután,  vive junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar para una empresa privada y tres hijos de 13, 11y 9 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ingrid posee una venta de cosméticos, ganchos, colas de macho, diademas, quita esmaltes y otros productos más. Su negocio esta ubicado en la calle principal de Usulután, lugar muy concurrido, ya que está rodeado de mucho comercio como bancos, restaurantes y otros más. Desde hace muchos años que ella se dedica a este trabajo, obteniendo ganancias muy aceptables, la cuales le han permitido a Ingrid salir adelante junto a su familia. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de cosméticos, en diferentes marcas y precios, así mismo más accesorio para el cabello, ya que son estos de los productos que más se venden en el negocio. Ingrid cuenta con el deseo de seguir adelante y mejorar aún más en sus ventas y de esta manera crecer como comerciante.
texts.en:
Ingrid Yucira M. P. is 30 years old and resides in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her family which consists of her husband, who works for a private business, and her three children (ages 13, 11, and 9) who are in school. Ingrid has a vending post where she sells cosmetics, hair clips, men’s hair extensions, headbands, nail polish removers, and other products. Her business is located on the main street in Usulután, a well-known place that is surrounded by many commercial institutions such as banks, restaurants, and other establishments. Ingrid has worked many years in her business, which has helped her obtain acceptable earnings that allow her and her family to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can invest in her business. Ingrid will buy a large quantity of cosmetics of different brands and prices. At the same time, she will acquire more hair accessories since these products sell well in her business. Ingrid has the desire to succeed and improve her sales. This will help her grow as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & hair accessories

loans.name: Norma Eunice

texts.es: La señora norma Eunice cuenta con negocio desde hace 2 años denominado  “Estanquillo Solís”  donde ofrece a sus cliente abarrotes en general como botanas, refrescos, nieves para esta temporada de calor y mas. Ahora ella quiere ir comprando más mercancía  por la época de calor en el que mucha gente quiere algo refrescante para no sentir tanto el calor. Es por eso que recurre a esta institución para el apoyo a su negocio y así obtener más ganancia para poder sustentar los gastos de su familia. Pues es madre de 3 hijos a los que prefiere ofrecer una mejora calidad junto co su esposo que trabaja en maquiladora.
texts.en:
For two years, Norma Eunice has had a business called “Estanquillo Solís” where she offers to her clients soft drinks, snacks, ice-cream for this hot season, and more. Her husband works in an assembly factory (maquiladora). She would like to increase her inventory of goods for the hot time of the year since a lot of people want to buy something refreshing to cool themselves. For this reason, Norma Eunice has approached this institution to seek support for her business so that she could increase her profits and be able to meet the household expenses of her family. Norma Eunice is the mother of three children, and, together with her husband, she would like to give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Store Supplies

loans.name: Serenidad Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Serenidad, se conformó en fecha 17 de enero del 2009, gracias a que la Directora de Finanzas la Sra. Ma. Mercedes Colmán  que se dedica a la venta de especies, ya formó parte de otro grupo anteriomente, que al desintegrarse dicho grupo, desidio contactar con la asesora y    formar su propio grupo, la misma contacto con sus vecinas y logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 5º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Todas ellas participan activamente en las reuniones semanales, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya
Iluminada F. la actual presidenta del Comite Serenidad, invertira su credito en su pequeña Mercederia que con mucho sacrificio ha venido cargando de mercaderias y complementando su negocio con articulos para la costura y compostura, bordados, accesorios e inclusive juguetes
texts.en:
The group of women called Serenidad [Serenity] was formed January 17th, 2009 thanks to Finance Director Mrs. Maria Mercedes Colmán, who sells spices. Previously, she was part of another group, and when this group dissolved, she decided to contact the adviser and form her own group. She also contacted her neighbors and was able to unite 17 working women. They are in their fifth cycle, united together within the program. They all participate actively in the weekly meetings, and help one another to reach their communal objectives within the group and with Fundación Paraguaya. Iluminada F., now the president of the Serenidad group, will invest the credit in her small market, which, with much sacrifice, she has been stocking with merchandise and supplementing with items for sewing and repair, embroidery, accessories and even toys.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell, ingredients for food preparation, materials for clothing production

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
No hay nada mas importante para mi que la familia, es el nucleo de nuestra sociedad sin contar que								
estan con uno en las buenas y las malas. Por eso quiero brindar a mi familia una casa en las mejores								
condiciones posibles. Es por eso que solicito su apoyo para colocar un piso de concreto en el portal de mi 

casa para evitar que se junte el agua cuando es temporada de lluvias.
texts.en:
There is nothing more important to me than family, the nucleus of our society, not to mention that they are with you through thick and thin. This is why I want to provide a house for my family, and in the best shape possible. This is why I am asking for your help to put a concrete floor in the entryway of my house, to avoid water pooling there during the rainy season.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installing a concrete floor in house

loans.name: Estelvina

texts.es:
La señora Estelvina tiene la edad de 49 años es casada y con sus esposo y sus 4 hijos habitan en el barrio San Ignacio, este es un barrio del municipio de Ticuantepe, sus habitantes son personas muy humildes que no cuentan con los recursos necesarios para emprenderse por sí solos, es por esta razón solicitan un apoyo de los bancos o financieras para crear nuevas fuentes de ingresos, en su mayoría son familias que se dedican a la agricultura. La familia de la señora Estelivina tiene más de 12 años de experiencia en esta actividad, especialmente en la siembra de la piña hawaiana.

Uno de los principales problemas que le amenazan sus cosechas son los gases que emana un volcán que se encuentra a las cercanías de sus siembras estos gases ácidos, dañan sus cosechas, es por esta razón que espera a futuro tener los recursos económicos, para realizar un estudio de conservación del suelo, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas que consientan un mejor  mantenimiento a sus cultivos. Esta inversión garantizará un buen manejo y le permitirá  a futuro mejores condiciones económicas para la incursión de nuevos mercados que le apoyen a  su progreso diario.
texts.en:
Estelvina is 49 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their four children. They live in the San Ignacio neighborhood of the municipality of Ticuantepe, where the residents are very humble people who do not have the necessary resources to set up a business by themselves. This is why they ask for support from banks or other financial institutions, so they can create new sources of income. The majority of these families work in agriculture. Ms. Estelvina's family has more than 12 years of experience in this activity, especially in the cultivation of Hawaiian pineapples. One of the biggest threats to Estelvina's crops are gases emitted by a volcano near her fields. These acidic gases damage her crops, and this is why she hopes that in the future she will have the economic resources to study soil conservation. For now, she is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies to help her better maintain her crops. This investment will guarantee good management of her crops. It will allow her to improve her economic situation in the future by enabling her to enter new markets, which will support her daily progress.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies to help her better maintain her crops.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto T., 54, is making sure that his family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Melba T., a tailor, they are blessed with three children. He makes sure that he earns well so that their family can have a better life. He has been managing his own fruit and vegetable stand for the past few years.

Alberto has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. He regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays his weekly dues consistently. Because of his good repayment performance with his previous loans, he was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  He is consistent in paying his dues because he used the money he borrowed to expand and improve his fruit and vegetable business.     

To ensure the success of his business, he would like to apply for a 14,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to his expanding business by buying more quantities of vegetables and fruits to be incorporated into his current product inventory.

He dreams that his business will continue to grow so that he can provide for his children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Djemory

texts.fr:
Monsieur Djemory D. est un homme marié de 34 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le  quartier Dialanicoro de Bougouni (troisième région du Mali)
Suite à la pauvreté de ses parents, il décida d’abandonner l’école et commença les activités génératrices de revenus tels faire l’apprenti chauffeur, la vente d’articles divers dans une boutique auprès de  son oncle et le meunier. C’est cette dernière activité qu’il finira par embrasser. Avec une expérience plus de 7 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Afin  d’améliorer son atelier, il décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter un  moulin. Il est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.
 Il compte s’approvisionner à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 49 500 FCFA  qu’il envisage utiliser pour agrandir son entreprise et payer les intérêts du prêt.
texts.en:
Mister Djemory D. is 34 years old, married and the father of 3 children. He lives with his wife and children in the Dialanicoro district of Bougouni (third region of Mali). Due to his parents’ poverty, he decided to abandon school and started income-generating activities such as being an apprentice driver, selling various goods in a shop with his uncle and being a miller. It is this last activity that he finally decided to take up. With more than 7 years of experience, he masters his business. In order to upgrade his workshop, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso to buy a mill. This is his first experience with Soro Yiriwaso. He plans to get his supplies in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). His customer base is composed of locals. With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 49,500 CFA francs that he plans to use to expand his business and pay the interest on his loan.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a mill

loans.name: Hukmatulo

texts.ru: Косимов Хукматуло проживает в районе Фархор. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. В этой области более 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Hukmatulo K. lives in Farkhor. He is 40 years old, married, and has three children. He has a high school education. He works in animal husbandry. Mostly he fattens and sells cattle. He has done this for more than five years. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle to increase his herd.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home improvements and some personal expenses.

loans.name: Maritha

texts.en:
Maritha has a mixed farm in the town of Kisii in Western Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 50 years and has employed two farmhands. Her farm produces maize, beans, coffee and tea, which she sells locally.

Maritha is 63 years old and a widowed mother of eight children who are all adults.

Maritha has requested this loan of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says this dairy cow will enable her family to get enough milk for consumption and that the income from the sale of milk will be used to improve the living standards of the family.

In the future, she hopes to increase her acreage of maize, beans and tea, hence maximizing from economies of scale. She says that she will continue to work together with Juhudi Kilimo in the future because she has seen the benefits.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith M., a married lady who supports five people in her family including her two children, aged eight and five years, is in the business of buying cereals in bulk and then selling them in small batches. She is able to make a monthly income of about Kshs 10,000, and her husband contributes to the total family income. She has been selling cereals for nine years.

Judith, a long-time client of KADET, is now applying for her seventh loan which she will use to buy more cereals in bulk for resale. She hopes to make a profit which she will use to buy food and other household items. Judith hopes to become a wholesale cereal trader in the future.

loans.use: Buying cereals in bulk

loans.name: Anatilia Josefa

texts.es: Anatila Josefa de 52 años,  tiene una pulpería ella vive en una zona en donde transitan muchos clientes ella caracteriza por brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, comenzó a trabajar para tener su propio negocio, ya que con sus ahorros pudo comprar muy pocos productos,  pero así con el paso del tiempo es que ha podido avanzar ella tiene 1 hijo a su cargo del que cuida mucho. Con el préstamo quiere comprar golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y granos básicos. En el futuro quiere que su hijo tenga una mejor vida y surtir su tienda con más productos.
texts.en:
Anatila Josefa is 52 years old, has a general store, and lives in a zone frequented by many customers. She is known for providing good customer service and has been running this business for more than four years. She began working so that she could start her own business. Her savings only allowed her to buy a few products at first, but after a while she was able to grow. She has one son whom she cares for. [Anatila] will use the money from this loan to buy sweets, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and basic grains. She hopes that in the future her son will have a better life and that she will be able to stock her store with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Teresa Isabel

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 59 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo dependiente, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales desde hace cinco años, ella cría animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio y los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona en donde vive, paralelamente vende carnes rojas en su domicilio, las cuales compra en el mercado del pueblo, a veces aprovecha para ofrecer en venta la carne de los animales que cría. Con los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, a solventar los gastos familiares.

Teresa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta, para ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ver a su familia progresar y gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa, 59, is married and has a dependent son.  She lives with her family in Mochumí district which is a farming area in Lambayeque province located forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has raised small farm animals for sale for the past five years in her backyard.  She sells them to merchants who come by the area frequently. She also sells red meats in her home that she buys in the town’s market.  She sometimes offers for sale meat from the animals she raises too.  Income from these activities helps her husband, who is a farmer, to cover family expenses.

Teresa wants to enlarge her business buying more animals and nutritionally balanced feed to expand her business.  To do so she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan.

She is quite a calm woman who is dedicated to her family.   Her greatest wish is to see her family progress and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: To enlarge her business buying more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Glenny

texts.en:
Glenny D. is from the village of Puerta, Lurugan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old and married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Glenny owns and operates a retail store, buying and selling ready to wear clothing and shoe products in the local community. She is also engaged in selling Natasha and Avon products. Glenny has been in business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Glenny joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glenny has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Glenny is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Glenny from HSPFI.
