She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is 51 years old and married to Jackson Owino. They have three children aged 26, 20,and 16. They live in Kakamega town.

Grace has a business of selling oranges and mangoes; she is known for supplying the sweet ones, which some people use to make orange juice. She has been in this business for the past 21 years and her monthly profit from this business is Kshs.9,700, which she been using to pay school fees for her children. She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD  after paying the previous loans successfully. She intends to use the money to buy more fruits to add to her stock.

Her desire is to open up a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: Buy more fruits to add to her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose B. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Malatapay, Zamboangita, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  carinderia (eatery), and gasoline sales. Her husband Ramil, who is 40 years old, works as a Boat Captain to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between 8 and 15 years old.

Rose joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rose has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 13,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for the food stall and gasoline sales, so that she can continue to save up for future improvement of business and for the education of her children. Rose B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of her food stall.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie D. is from the city of Doña Consuelo, Ozamiz City. She is 35 years old. Rosalie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Rosalie owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing welding shop  services to local community members. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Rosalie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Rosalie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.ar:
محمد في عمر 35 سنة متزوج وله اربع اولاد يعمل في الخردة وتصليح السيارات الخردة يحب عائلته ويسعى 
الى تحسين وضعه المادي يتميز عمله بقلة الاشخاص الذين يعملون في هذا المجال لا ما ينقصه لزيادة مدخوله هو المادة له تاريخ
جيد مع المجموعة وقد تلقى دعم كامل من العائلة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء الخردة ثم بيعها بالمفرق
يتميز بذكائه في العمل والدقة والصدق والجدية في المعاملة
texts.en: Mohamed is 35 years old. He has four children. Mohamed sells scrap and fixes motor vehicles. He loves his family and seeks to enhance his income. His profession is not very common, and all Mohamed is missing is financial assistance. Mohamed has a good history with Al Majmoua. He has the full support of his family. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, he seeks to purchase more scrap and resell it. He is honest, diligent, serious and clever.

loans.use: To purchase scrap for resale

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites P. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 41 years old. Marites is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling vegetables and spices like garlic, onions and black pepper in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Marites is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like spices and food seasonings. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like spices and food seasonings

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Tacumbú Group

texts.es:
Este grupo, llamado "Mujeres Emprendedoras de Tacumbú", es un comité  que está en el décimo-primer ciclo y cuenta con 17 integrantes.
La Sra. Lilian S. es peluquera y manicurista a domicilio, en la zona de Tacumbú y su sueño es montar su propio local en su casa.
texts.en: This group is called "Enterprising Women of Tacumbú". They are a group that is on their tenth loan cycle. There are seventeen members of the group. Mrs. Lilian does manicures and pedicures in her house, which is located in the zone called Tacumbú. Her dream is to have a special place for her business in her house.

loans.use: They will buy materials to be used to sew made to order clothes and sheets as well as T-shirts, skirts, towels, etc.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva E. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old. Eva is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk food, and toothpaste, in the local community. She also buys and sells gold dust and rice by the kilogram. Eva has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Eva is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and junk food. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Eva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
Lizbeth R. Vásquez, vive en la localidad de Ángel Alvino Corzo, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México. Es casa con el señor Luis Rojas Muñoz, en donde procreo un hijo de  nombre Luis Enrique de seis meses.

     El préstamo que ha estado solicitando lo invierte en la compra  de frutas y legumbres, en la que lleva cinco años y comenta que le va bien.

     Por su propia idea y la de su esposo fue que decidió poner esta pequeña actividad, para sostenerse y mejorar sus ingresos económicos para su hogar.

     Con las ganancias que va requiriendo lo invierte comprando más  mercancía y de eso tener mejor ingresos y su negocio aumente día con día.

     Su sueño es que siga  trabajando, para sacar salir adelante, como también poder ahorrar y comprar materiales, y comenzar a construir su casa que es lo que tanto quiere.
texts.en:
Lizbeth R. Vásquez lives in the community of Ángel Alvino Corzo, a municipality in Copainala, Chiapas state, México.  She is married to Mr. Luis Rojas Muñoz with whom she has a 6-month-old son called, Luis Enrique.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fruit and vegetables.  She’s been in business five years and comments that she does well. It was her own idea and that of her husband to set up this small activity to support herself and improve household income.

Profits she earns are reinvested buying more merchandise to get higher income from that and so that her business grows day by day.

Her dream is to stay in business both to get ahead and to be able to save and buy materials to start building her house which is what she wants very much.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables for subsequent sale in nearby communities.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene la 75 años, sus propósitos son superarse en la vida para salir adelante con su negocio ya que es lo que mas importante para seguir generando a su familia el sustento diario. Su actividad económica es la brindar el servicio de costura, por lo que tiene que levantarse temprano para limpiar, realizar las compras y empezar las diferentes prendas de vestir que tiene pendiente. Hace más de  50 años, inicia este negocio por la necesidad de buscar un trabajo es que decide establecer un pequeño negocio al principio no poseía la experiencia necesaria para con este negocio, pero con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo la habilidad para hablar con sus clientes. El financiamiento es para hilos, tijeras, telas, botones, encajes, bordados, zipper y aceite para engrasar su máquina.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 75 years old and has goals to succeed in life and get ahead in her business. What is most important to her is that she continues generating a daily income for her family. Her business activity involves providing sewing services. Maria must wake up early to clean up, make her purchases, and begin creating different garments that have been ordered. She started this business more than 50 years ago because she needed to find work. Maria decided to establish a small business because she did not possess the necessary experience. As time passed, she acquired the ability to communicate with her customers.

This loan will be used to purchase thread, scissors, fabrics, buttons, lace, fringe, zippers, and oil to lubricate her sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase thread, scissors, fabrics, buttons, lace, fringe, zippers, and oil to lubricate her sewing machine.

loans.name: Serge

texts.en: Serge G. runs a general store in Darbas village in the Syunik region. Village people don’t have bank accounts, and Serge pays cash to his suppliers. Village life is quite challenging, and many customers are not able to pay during the purchase. So Serge offers them the goods on credit. To increase the turnover, Serge needs to stock up on the most popular goods, and eventually expand the business. In the future the additional profit will help Serge to renovate his house and pay education fees for his three children.

loans.use: to stock up on the most popular goods

loans.name: Jaime Wuilian

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 48 años de edad, y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de  Monsefú, a 20 minutos de la ciudad Chiclayo. Reside en la parte rural de este distrito. Su comunidad es uno de los más grandes de la ciudad de Chiclayo a pesar de estar alejado de la misma.

Jaime brinda el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi (una unidad móvil, que consiste en una moto y una cabina para transporte de personas).  Este vehículo es de su propiedad y lo tiene desde hace más de 05 años.  Sus ingresos le sirven para mantener a su familia, a quien quiere darle mejor calidad de vida.

Jaime quiere darle mantenimiento a su vehículo, la herramienta de su negocio. Con los ingresos de su negocio, el puede cubrir los gastos de su hijo. Por ello, ha creído conveniente obtener un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Jaime is 48 years old and has a son. He lives in his own home, which is located in the district of Monsefú, 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He lives in the rural part of this district. His community is one of the biggest around the city of Chiclayo, in spite of being far from it. 

Jaime provides passenger transportation services in his mototaxi (a mobile unit that consists of a motorcycle and a cabin for transporting people). He owns the vehicle and has had it for more than 5 years. His income helps to maintain his family, who he wants to give a better quality of life.

Jaime wants to do some maintenance on his vehicle, his tool for business. With the income from his business, he can cover costs for his son. For this reason, he has asked for a loan of 1500 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to fix and maintain his mototaxi

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida belongs to Arifwala which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture and dairy industry. She has been living there with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 15 years.

Her husband's name is N. M. and he operates a grocery store in the community market. Through his store, he sells daily use items like spices, sugar, rice, etc. to his customers at cheap rates. His customer dealing is very good that’s why he is able to attract more customers who purchase groceries from him regularly.

Khalida doesn’t have any children. She spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s grocery store business. Through the loan, he will purchase groceries in bulk that will enable him to fulfill the needs of his customers on time and earn maximum profits. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Khalida is hopeful that an investment will bring positive financial changes to his business.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي عمره 30 سنة متزوج وهو اب لولدان يعمل في بيع الاقمشة والالبسة له في عمله 20 سنة يحب عمله وهو يطوره دائما من خلال البضائع التي يقوم بشراءها يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء اقمشة برادي له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة خيث ساهم القرض السابق في تحسين الوضع المادي له ولعائلته وفي دعم العمل وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله خاصة انه في صدد تجديد البضاعة بمناسبة الموسم الصيفي حيث يتطلب منه عدد اكبر من البضائع وفي نفس الوقت هو طموح يحب التجدد في العمل الابتكار في تصميم البرادي
texts.en: Ali is 30 years old and married with two children. He has been working for the past twenty years selling fabrics and clothing, a job which he is very much enamored with and which he is always trying to further develop by procuring new materials. He is very driven and loves being creative with drapery designs. With the summer season upon him, Ali is looking to renew his inventory. Given how his last loan from Al Majmoua helped improve his situation and that of his family, Ali now wanted to seek another loan to acquire more drape fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for drapery business.

loans.name: Regina Njeri

texts.en:
Regina Njeri is 32 years old and married to Alex, who contributes to the family income. She has 4 children, aged 12, 9, 6, and 1 years old. Regina has been operating her restaurant for about 11 years, earning a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

Regina is taking her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a staff member. She wants to use the loan to buy some dishes for keeping food hot and to improve her hotel kitchen. She hopes to build rental houses and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy some dishes for keeping food hot and to improve her hotel kitchen.

loans.name: Pel

texts.en:
Mrs. Pel is a 39-year-old womA. who earns a living by tailoring for her neighbors in both modern and traditional styles. She has a kiosk in front of her house for serving her customers. 

She has many years experience in the tailoring business and is making about $1.50 each day. In addition to this, she has been planting rice on her own farmland. 

Mrs. Pel is married to Mr. Seng, 38, a cattle seller, and they have seven children. Mrs. Pel will use her loA. to buy more cloth for her tailoring service.

loans.use: to buy more cloth for her tailoring service.

loans.name: Visaminda

texts.en:
Visaminda is 46 years old and lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is married with 3 children.

To earn a living, Visaminda has a business selling different kinds of fish. She earns about 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Visaminda has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell.

Visaminda has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Sany

texts.en:
Sany, 42 year old, is selling food from her home.  She is a single mother and has one child who is 6 years old. 

Every month, she has to spend around $50 on food and other expenses.  Her income is about $10 per day.  She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy meat and other things for making food and soup to sell.  She hopes to make more income so that she can expand her business and be able to send her child to study and to at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy meat and other things for making food and soup to sell

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is a 33-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur. She is divorced and has three children who are between the ages of 7 and 14. All of her children are in school. For the past five years, she has been running a business selling clothes, small fish and sunflower oil. The profits generated from this business have enabled her to take care of her children and make savings.

Gertrude will use this loan to purchase more clothes, fish, and sunflower oil that she sources from Burundi and Uganda. She hopes to use the future profits from her business to renovate her house. As a businesswoman, she aspires to some day source her goods from Dubai.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes, fish and sunflower oil that she will sell.

loans.name: Sonata En Invierno Group

texts.es:
Carla es integrante D. la Alcancía Comunal “Sonata en Invierno” la cual tiene el cargo D. secretaria y está conformada por 07 mujeres emprendedoras y responsables.
Carla tiene 32 años D. edad y su familia está conformada por ella su conyugue y 03 hijos que en la actualidad dependen D. ellos. Carla se dedica a la venta D. helados la cual lleva 8 años dedicándose en dicha actividad,  es así como Carla poco a poco ha podido surgir, también nos cuenta que alquilan autos  donD. tiene un ingreso mas para su hogar, ella empezó con 01 auto pero con el buen uso  que le dio a sus ingresos y   con la ayuda D. su conyugue lograron superarse, contando en la actualidad con 3 autos. A futuro a Carla le gustaría instalar su propio negocio donD. brinD. ensaladas D. fruta. Con el préstamo solicitado va usar para el mantenimiento D. los autos, comprando aceite, filtros, llantas. La Alcancía Comunal “Sonata en Invierno” agradece la confianza. En la fotografía  vemos a una integrante pasiva  la señora Zoraida que en el próximo ciclo se va a reincorporar, ella es la que esta D. chompa rosada.
texts.en:
Carla is a member of the Communal Bank “Sonata en Invierno” (Sonata in Winter) in which she serves in the position of secretary. The group is composed of seven enterprising and responsible women.

Carla is 32 years old and her family consists of her husband and three children who are dependent on her. She has been selling ice cream for eight years and has achieved gradual success. In addition, Carla says that she rents out automobiles to earn more household income. She started out with one car and it became a good investment that generated income which enabled her to help her husband push forward. Now she has three vehicles. In the future, Carla would like to have her own business where she sells fruit salad. With the loan she requested, Carla plans to pay for maintenance of her automobiles and buy oil, filters, and tires.

The “Sonata en Invierno” Communal Bank is grateful for the trust that has been shown to them. In the photograph, there is a woman wearing a pink sweater named Sra. Zoraida. She is an inactive member and will be rejoining the group in the next loan cycle.

loans.use: to purchase oil, filters, and tires for her fleet of rental vehicles.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es: Leoncia, de 35 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Percy de 40 años y sus 02 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una buena educación. El trabajo al que Leoncia se dedica, es al cultivo de cacao, café y arboles maderables. Todos los días, muy temprano Leoncia se dirige a su chacra  para poder trabajar sus tierras, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga de la venta de su cosecha, dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo han tenido sus frutos. Lleva 18 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cargar los pesados sacos de sus productos. Leoncia con el monto solicitado comprará calaminas para poder refaccionar el techo de su vivienda. En lo futuro, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el segundo préstamo y manifiesta que dicho aporte le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y está segura que contara una vez más con el apoyo de todos ustedes. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con el monto requerido comprará varias planchas de calamina.
texts.en:
Leoncia, 35, is a simple and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home together with her husband Percy, 40, and their two cherished children, to whom they want to give a good education. Leoncia grows cacao, coffee and hardwood trees. Every day Leoncia goes out to the farm very early to work on her lands, because she knows that the money that she gets from the harvest largely depends on the quality of her products. Her favorite part of her job is harvesting the land, because she feels like the months of hard work have paid off. She has been doing this for 18 years, and considers the hardest part to be carrying the heavy sacks of produce. 

With the amount requested, Leoncia will buy corrugated metal to repair the roof of her house. In the future she hopes to buy new land to increase her production. This is her second loan and she says that the support will help her a lot with the progress of her work and is certain that once again she will have all of your support. In her village bank she is very dear to the rest of her colleagues. With the loan she will buy several sheets of tin.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal to fix the roof on her home.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 42 años de edad, ella es casada y fruta de esta hermosa unión tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a  la venta de fruta y solo distribuye sus productos los días viernes pues no tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado de Racsa de la ciudad del Cusco, ella compra la fruta de la ciudad de Yanatile. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Inés también tiene un bus que brinda servicio de transporte interprovincial a la ciudad de Yanatile Cusco y viceversa.  

Inés requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del Carro.

Banco Comunal “Siempre Adelante” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Inés was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and is 42 years old. She is married and from this beautiful union has four children. She now lives in the same city where she was born and where she has her business. She sells fruit and only distributes her products on Fridays, since she doesn't have a sales stall in the Racsa market in the city of Cusco. She buys fruit in the city of Yanatile. She has had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. Inés also has a bus, with which she offers interprovincial transportation service between the cities of Yantile and Cusco.

Inés needs the loan to maintain her car.

The communal bank "Siempre Adelante" (Always Forward) meets every month in the district of Pisaq in the province of Calca (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known for being a very touristic and commerical area, for its traditional fiesta of Into Raymi, and because Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world, is found there.

loans.use: to maintain her car.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de los Angeles estudia la carrera de administración de empresas, sus padres le ayudan a pagar los gastos de escuela ya que por el momento Maria no tiene trabajo. Sus planes son poder encontrar un trabajo con grandes oportunidades que le permitan en primer lugar devolver todo el esfuerzo que han hecho sus padres para darle educación. Desea seguir especializándose en su carrera para tener siempre mejores oportunidades. Se considera una persona responsable y capaz de enfrentar cualquier reto con respeto a su profesión.
texts.en: Maria de los Angeles is studying business administration. Her parents help her to pay her education costs because she is unemployed at the moment. She plans to find a job with great opportunities that will allow her to repay her parents for all their hard work to offer her an education. She wants to continue specializing in her career in order to always have better opportunities. She is a responsible person who is able to confront any challenge in her career.

loans.use: to pay graduate course modules

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita de la ciudad Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Noemí, ella tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos, cuatro ya son  mayores de edad e independientes, el menor tiene 15 años estudia en colegio y es quien  vive con ella, también con ella vive una nieta que esta pequeñita y que es como su hija ya que la tiene desde que nació. Su esposo comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo se dedican venta de mariscos, nos cuenta que él se va desde la madrugada a esperar a que lleguen los pescadores con el fruto de la pesca para luego comprar estos productos y  transportarlos en su carro hasta otras ciudades y campos, ellos entregan al por mayor y también al menudeo, trabajan cuatro días a la semana de cinco a seis horas al día o hasta que hayan vendido todo el producto que compraron para la venta diaria.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, camarón, conchas, pulpo y otras variedades de mariscos para llevar a sus clientes lo mejor. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos en relación a otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Su sueño es tener otro carro ya que el que tienen está bien deteriorado.
texts.en:
The members of the “Crucita” communal bank meet in the city of Portoviejo’s Crucita Parish.  This place is known for the beautiful beaches that surround this pretty place that are very popular with national and foreign tourists alike.  It is known as “Crucita the Beautiful.”

We met Noemí, 48, here.  She’s married and has five children.  Four of them are already adults and independent.  The youngest is 15 years old and in school and still living with her.  A little granddaughter who has lived with her since birth and is like another daughter to her also lives with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband sell seafood.  She tells us that he leaves at dawn to wait for the fishermen to arrive with their catches to buy the products and then transport them in his car to other cities and out to the countryside.  They sell both at wholesale and at retail.  They work four days a week from five to six hours daily or until they sell all the product they bought for that day’s sale.

This loan is to buy fish, shrimp, conchs, octopus and other varieties of seafood to take the best to their customers.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because interest rates are very low compared to other credit institutions.

Her dream is to own another car because the one they have is pretty worn down.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, conchs, octopus and other seafood varieties.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tsetsegee

texts.en:
Tsetsegee is 53 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband is disabled and her two kids from graduated college and are employed. 

Tsetsegee operates grocery trading business. She started her business in 2002 by building a small building in her yard, which is right across the road. Now, she built an even bigger house for her shop and she is very well-experienced in her business. Now that business is going well, Tsetsegee wants to expand her business by selling a broad range of products. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says "past few years I have done everything I can to support my family. Now that my kids are employed, I am more concerned about my business." She is requesting 3,200,000 MNT to purchase more products and to increase the product range of her shop.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her shop

loans.name: Bertin Jonas

texts.fr:
Client de Hope age de 40 ans et père de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 10 ans.A l'arrêt de ses etudes secondaire il se lance dans la vente des sacs, cartables, sandales homme, dame et enfants.
Il a déjà bénéficie de plusieurs prêts de Hope , il a rembourse avec succès et a fait des épargnes énormes.

Avec ce nouveau prêt ,il va renforcer le stock de ses marchandises , des lots de sandales hommes, dames et enfants, des sacs et des cartables.
Ces différents crédits lui ont fait beaucoup de bien en ce qui concerne son activité et a apporte un changement positif dans sa vie, son capital a largement augmente,avec ses bénéfices , il est entrain de construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
He is a client of Hope aged 40 with 2 children between the ages of 3 and 10.When he stopped his secondary studies he started selling bags, schoolbags, and sandals for men women and children.
He has already received several loans from Hope, he has repaid them successfully and made big savings.

With this new loan, he will reinforce the stock of his merchandise, with batches of sandals for men women and children, bags and school bags.
These various loans have helped him very much in his business and brought a positive change to his life, his capital has grown considerably and with the profits he is building a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags, sandals and shoes

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is a married woman with two children. She is 34 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Susana owns and operates a home products business, selling baked goods in the local community to earn a living and she's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 2,300 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Susana has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to gain more profit and to finish paying for her children's study.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Martha Eliana

texts.es: La señora Marta a sus 42 años de edad tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración y confección de accesorios decorativos para el hogar como tendidos de cama, individuales de mesa. La señora Martha trabaja sola en su casa, dedicándose  a esta actividad desde hace 6 años luego de haberse capacitado en diferentes instituciones en temas como arte country y manualidades.  La señora Martha desea comprar materia prima para elaborar sus productos como lo son hilos, telas y accesorios en general que le permitan salir adelante y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. En un futuro la señora Martha desea tener su propio local comercial.
texts.en: Martha is 42 years old and has a 7-year-old son. Her business is making decorative products for the home such as bedclothes and table mats. Martha works alone at home and has been in this business for six years after she trained in different institutions in subjects such as arte country (brightly colored decorative items made from wood) and handicrafts. Martha would like to buy raw materials to make her products such as threads, fabrics and general accessories. This will allow her to make progress and provide her son with a better quality of life. In the future, Martha would like to have her own sales premises.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make her products such as threads, fabrics and accessories

loans.name: Marum

texts.en:
Mariam is 24 years old, married, and has three children. She is a tailor, which she has been doing for 11 years. She earns a monthly profit of 5,000 KES. 

Mariam is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD for 21,000 KES, which she will use to buy additional stock of cloth material and embroidery materials. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

Mariam will save the anticipated profit to help pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into a full boutique.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cloth and embroidery material.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 24-year-old Lebanese man who is married and living with his wife. Since 2005 he has had his own business as a painter and takes on house projects in order to better his way of life.

Today, he’s asking to borrow 800 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional painting supplies. This Kiva loan will improve his work and allow him to take on new and bigger projects, thus earning him a better income.

In the future, he plans to open his own painter’s shop and take on more and similar projects.

loans.use: to purchase additional painting supplies.

loans.name: Pum

texts.en: Pum is a garment factory worker, who resides in Takhmao town, which is a common area for local people to grow crops. Shown in the photo, Pum’s husband is working on his field.  His photo was taken instead of his wife's because she is always away from home working all day. Typically, this couple is able to generate a good income of approximately $10 per day to satisfy their basic necessities. They do not have any children yet, but they wish to have one someday. Pum would like to obtain a loan to build a fence surrounding her house to protect it from any losses and make it a safe place to live. In the future, Pum aims to expand her husband’s business and grow many crops and vegetables.

loans.use: to build a fence surrounding her house.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a repeat borrower aged 52 years old. She is a resident of Nkongoro, Ntungamo District. She is a married with six children.

Jane applied for a loan of UGX 2,500,000 to improve her cattle business. She has a challenge of low business turnover due to few purchases and low consumption of milk. She decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to buy milk cans so that she can expand her milk production business, improve her well-being and pay tuition for her children.

loans.use: to buy milking cans and milk storage cans.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 34 years old and married with four children. Two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emily is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emily has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Yam is a staple food of the Ghanaian society precisely the Dangme West District, Dodowa where Madam Patience O. lives. She supplies her community of about 20,000 people with yams. This has made the demand of yams from her very high. In the course of a visitation by staff of KSF to her shop, she said, eventhough she has received assistance from KSF, she still needs a loan of $1,100.00 from kiva to meet her customers\' and community\'s demand.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Erika Denice

texts.en:
Erika is from Tamaulipas, she is married and has one child, who is one year old. Her husband, Rudy, works in a printing shop and with his salary it’s not possible to satisfy all the needs of his family. It was for this reason that two years ago Erika was helping a neighbor make steamed tacos. The idea of getting ahead inspired Erika to get a cart to sell the tacos in front of a school. At first he bought the food from her neighbor, but now she wants to make it herself.

Erika needs a loan of $325 to repair the cart from which she sells her products and to make it look nicer. She will also use the money to buy ingredients she needs to make the steamed tacos. Become an important part of Erika’s dreams—you can help her grow into a successful woman, she is depending on you.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Erika es originaria de Tamaulipas, es casada y tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad. Su esposo Rudy trabaja en una imprenta, y con su salario no es posible satisfacer todas las necesidades de su familia, por este motivo desde hace dos años Erika trabajaba ayudándole a una vecina a la elaboración de tacos de vapor. La ilusión de superarse hicieron que Erika consiguiera un carrito para vender los tacos en la salida de una escuela, inicialmente ella le compraba los alimentos a su vecina, pero ahora quiere elaborarlos ella misma.

Ahora Erika necesita de un préstamo de $ 325 dólares para reparar el vehiculo en el que vende sus productos y darle una mejor imagen, así como para la compra de los ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración de los tacos a vapor. Conviértete en parte importante en los sueños de Erika, tú puedes ayudarle a crecer y ser una mujer exitosa, depende de ti.

loans.use: To repair her cart and to buy ingredients

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria has a small kiosk at the Pervomaisky market in Nikopol, Ukraine where she sells a variety of women’s clothing. She has been in business for two years. The additional income from her business has been a real help to her and her husband, Yuri. It has enabled them to have some work done to improve their home and they have been able to save some money to help their 15 year old daughter when she enters college. Victoria has developed a reputation as a kind and honest entrepreneur. She has benefited from her relationship with “Nadiya Ukraine”, and we look forward to continuing to assist her with her business. 

Victoria has requested a loan for $500 to purchase new inventory for her kiosk. One of her goals is to broaden the assortment of products she has for sale. This loan will give her additional funds to pursue her goals and grow her business even further.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Ababil

texts.en: Ababil is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. She is 48. She started her business in 1998. Ababil's business depends on the seasons and she has to buy fruits and vegetables from season to season. Her first $500 loan she received from Normicro Baku branch. For summer purchases she is wishing to borrow $600 from the same organization.

loans.use: To increase variety of seasonal goods

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary O. is a 31 year old woman with two (2) children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells garri & yam to the public and she has been in this business since 2002. She needs the loan amount of $175 for the purchase of garri and yam for sales. She has been a LAPO member for 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more garri & yam to sell

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina, who hails from the village of Vaimoso, is 44-years old and has 7 kids. She runs a fast food stall business, which she runs 3 day a week on Monday, Wednesday and Friday. She sells 50 plates a day at the Vaimoso Primary school, which nets her $52 after all expenses. Her last loan amount was for $725 and now she is reapplying for the same amount in order to expand her fast food stall and to renovate her home.  Her business helps her to support her 2 school-aged children by paying for school bills, and also with other obligations such as church donations and loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her fast food stall

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine E. is 33 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in Uromi, Edo State of Nigeria. Josephine earns money selling food and drinks. She has been in the business for 2 years and now would be thankful for a loan of US$875 to buy more provisions and a grinding machine.

loans.use: Purchase of more provisions and a grinding machine

loans.name: Mugema D(Ii) Group

texts.en: Rina is 28 years old and a single mother of three children. She has a small hotel. She intends to buy a generator and pay the children’s school fees with the extra business profits.

loans.use: To purchase more hotel equipment

loans.name: Namuyingi Ii B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Harriet N.. She is currently in the business of selling new shoes and is requesting a loan to expand and start a wholesale business. Harriet is 34 years old and is married. Her husband has a retail shop business. She has eight children, ranging from 2.5 to 16 years old. Her children go to school. Each week, Harriet makes approximately UGX 60000 in profit. With the extra profits she will earn with the help of a loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children Harriet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, to the amount of UGX 200000, in order to invest in her business. The loan was paid back on time.

Harriet is joined in her small group by Toplota N., Harriet M., Irene M., and Jesca M.. Toplota N. has a business selling coffee and wants to expand her business. Harriet M. is currently operating a catering business and wants a loan to boost her business. Irene M. operates a business selling used clothing and wants to increase her stock. Jesca M. is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.use: to expand her business and become a clothing wholesaler

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
S. Mavzuna is 27 years old. She is married with two children. 

Mavzuna is a market vendor, selling clothing for kids and  women's shawls. She has been in business for six years. Mavzuna is a friendly and polite woman. She is trying to diversify the range of goods she sells to satisfy the needs of her clients with various levels of income. 

 The business is stable and helps Mavzuna make a considerable contribution to the family budget. Mavzuna is planning to purchase new clothing for kids and head shawls for women. With this purpose she is requesting
$1000 Dollars for a term of 12 months. Mavzuna thanks everyone who's supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner as she did with her previous loans.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and shawls to diversify goods for sale.

loans.name: Groupment Dagan

texts.en:
Groupement Dagan is a business created by 5 women in Adéta, Togo, a medium-sized town located aproximately 150 kilometers from the capital. The group is composed of Philomene A., the manager, a 38-year-old married woman; Louise A., a 26-year-old married woman; her sister Mofemo A., a 28-year-old married woman; Abra T., a 37-year-old married woman; and Marie M., a 31-year-old woman who is not yet married.

This close-knit group of family and friends sell a variety of prepared food in the central market of Adéta in order to earn a living and provide for their respective families. With this loan, the women of Group Dagan hope to restock their supply of yams, grains, vegetables various animals for the preparation of dishes to sell in the market. Their food is very popular and they hope that this loan will help them to satisfy the demands of their customers, enlarge their clientele and improve the quality of all of their lives.

loans.use: To restock their supply of yams, grains, vegetables and various animals for the preparation of food

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is 40 years old and a widow with eight children.  She sells tomato paste, salt, onions etc.  She used to purchase the goods on credit and with her previous loan from SMT, she increased the stock and built her own capital.  45% of her current stock was purchased on credit and she could only make marginal profit as the goods were very expensive.  With eight children, Fatu needs to generate more income to meet the family expenses as she is the only breadwinner for the family. She also needs to build her own capital and is requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: She needs to increase stock and build her own capital

loans.name: Women In Need Group

texts.en: Salley C. is 37 years old and married with 6 children. Married to a police officer whose salary is insufficient to meet all the family's needs, Salley had to start a business to generate income for the family. She sells palm oil and produces tie-dye materials in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone. With her previous loan, Salley was able to increase her income by 25%. This enabled her to meet her children's school requirements and other family expenses. Like Salley, the other group members are also engaged in food selling. The members would like to expand their businesses and are therefore requesting a loan of Le. 4,000,000 (Le. 800,000 for each entrepreneur).

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for their businesses

loans.name: Gloria Concepción

texts.es:
Gloria, 26, has a high-school education. She's the single mother of 2 young children, both of whom depend on her, and they live in the Peruvian "region" of Puno. She makes a living selling bed sheets and candy. However, she only sells candy on Sundays because she doesn't earn much from it. Selling sheets, on the other hand, generates more income because she brings them from the city of Cuzco. Her businesses have grown from the first loans that she received from the 3 de mayo (May 3) community bank, something very pleasing for her.

With this S/.1000 (1000 Peruvian soles) loan, to be repaid in 4 months, Gloria will buy 30 sets of sheets that she will bring from Cuzco herself for sell locally.

Gloria's dream is is to have a wholesale grocery and study for a career that will help her grow her business and educate her 2 children.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Gloria Concepción, tiene 26 años de edad, concluyó su secundaria, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, que dependen de ella, viven en el distrito de Ilave en Jr. 28 de julio Nº 951 de la provincia El Collao, de la región de Puno. Ella se dedica al negocio de venta de sabanas y venta de golosinas, las golosinas sólo los comercializa los días domingos porque no le genera mucha ganancia, en cambio la comercialización de sábanas sí le genera más ingreso, porque los lleva a la ciudad de Cusco. Estos negocios los incrementó con los primeros préstamos que adquirió del Banco Comunal 3 de mayo y por esto se siente feliz.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual cancelará en 4 meses, comprará 30 Juegos de sabanas que llevará directamente a la ciudad de Cusco para ponerlas en venta.

Su mayor sueño es tener una tienda Mayorista de Abarrotes y estudiar una carrera técnica el cual le ayude en sus negocios y poder educar a sus 2 hijos.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel is married to her husband, Jose Luis Martinez Navarrente, who is a musician. They have five children, three of which are married and two are single. Maria began her business two years ago making and selling tortillas in her house to help her husband pay for their children's educational expenses. Currently, things are going well for her business as it has grown in the past two years.

Maria needs a $450 loan which she will repay in 6 months to purchase an iron to make tortillas. With your help Maria will continue improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

María Isabel es casada, su esposo se llama José Luis Martínez Navarrete es músico, tienen cinco hijos 3 casados y dos solteros, el negocio lo inicio hace dos años elaborando y vendiendo tortillas en su casa, esto con el propósito de ayudarle a su marido a pagar los estudios de sus hijos. Actualmente le va muy bien con su negocio ya que poco a poco lo ha hecho crecer.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $450 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una plancha para hacer tortillas. Con tu ayuda Isabel seguirá progresando con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase an iron

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Hermelinda, socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús”, vive en el Departamento D. San Martín, provincia D. El Dorado, distrito D. San José D. Sisa. Se dedica a la venta D. ladrillo y abarrotes. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio en el Jr. Santiago Pérez s/n cdra 04, caserío san isidro. Los clientes son las personas que viven alrededor D. su barrio y D. la localidad.


Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará leña  en gran cantidad, combustible para la elaboración D. los ladrillos, además comprará productos para surtir el negocio como aceite por litros, arroz, azúcar, lejía, detergente, leche D. diferentes marcas y tamaños, para así tener surtido el negocio y satisfacer las necesidades D. los clientes.


Tiene 35 años, 2 hijos, quienes están estudiando, junto con su esposo comparten la atención en el negocio. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer  trabajadora y responsable con las labores asumidas. Desea en el futuro ampliar el negocio, quiere vender al por mayor, llegar a tener su distribuidora D. estos productos y abastecer a toda la zona  donD. vive.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the Community Bank 'Corazon D. Jesus' (Heart of Jesus) and she lives in the department of San Martin, in the province of El Dorado, in the district of San Jose D. Sisa. She sells bricks and groceries. Her business is located in her own home in the Jr. Santiago Pérez s/n cdra 04m in the hamlet of San Isidro. Her clients live around her in her neighborhood and local area.

With the loan of $1000 which she will repay over a period of 4 months she will buy firewood in large quantities, fuel to make bricks as well as products to stock out her business like oil by the liter, rice, sugar, bleach, detergent, milk of different labels and sizes to stock out her store and satisfy her clients' needs.

She is 35 years old and has 2 kids who are studying. Together with her husband they share looking after the business. She has always stood out for being a hard working and responsible woman who has taken on labors. In the future she wants to enlarge her business and sell in bulk, have her own distributor of these products and to supply to the whole zone where she lives.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, fuel, oil, rice, sugar, bleach, detergent etc/Compra de leña, combustible, aceite, arroz, azúcar, lejía, detergente, etc.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Rufat

texts.en:
Rufat was born in 1979. He is married and has one child. He lives in Baku city. He has been in this business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy goods for improving his business.

Rufat's relative is pictured

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Pema

texts.en:
Pema U. F. has owned a small shop in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for four years. She works from 7:00am to 9:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $125 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more inventory for her shop.

Pema is 36 years old, married, and has five children, aged 5, 7, 12, 19, and 20.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the "Generosidad" (Generosity) Village Bank.  Vilma is 43 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. Vilma runs a general store from her home, located in the Yuracc Yuracc neighborhood. She works at the store every day from 8am to 7pm.  Vilma needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy oil, rice and milk.  Vilma dreams of owning her own home and that her children will graduate with professional degrees. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad. 
Vilma es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Vilma tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el barrio de Yuracc Yuracc en donde vende abarrotes, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. 
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de aceite, arroz, leche. 
Vilma sueña con tener una casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buy oil, rice and milk for her little store

loans.name: Saren's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Saren M. is the group leader for four members who all live in Tro Ngel village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a Khmer noodle seller and she also is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn her living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to hire laborers to work on the field. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to work in the field for the dry season. Her husband, Mr. Ton Saveth, is a policeman in the local district. Mrs. Saren M. is 47 and the mother of three children who are enrolled in the local school.

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to hire laborers to work in the field for the dry season

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 24-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Imad has been working as a car mechanic for a year. He does mechanical work and he also repairs diesel cars. Imad requests a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase spare parts for cars. This is the first time that Imad has requested a loan.
Imad is special in his work because he is fast and he does good work. His clients are his friends and others. He decided to start his business because he knew he could make it and he had the experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Imad will use the loan to purchase spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Paola Elizabeth

texts.es:
Paola es socia del Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua.
Paola es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Paola tiene una bodega en la casa de sus padres en donde también vive, vende abarrotes, bebidas y licores. Además Paola los días sábados y domingos vende cebiche.
Paola necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche gaseosa, cerveza.
Los sueños de Paola son ampliar su negocio, tener una bodega grande y surtida.
texts.en:
Paola is a member of the “Corrí Ayllu” Communal Bank, which means Golden Family in Quechua. Paola is married, is 23 years old, and has 1 child. Paola has a store in her parent’s home where she also lives. She sells groceries, beverages and alcoholic beverages. In addition on Saturdays and Sundays Paola sells ceviche. Paola needs a loan for 1000 soles to invest in buying milk, soda pop and beer. Paola dreams of expanding her business and having a large, well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk, soda pop and beer.

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru: Одилов Абдумалик  мужчина в возрасте 30 лет , женат имеет троих  детей. Абдумалик работает  в колхозе поливщиком полей. Также он занимается дехканством . Для увеличения своего бизнеса животноводства он хочет купить в кредит несколько голов баранов. Его жена  занимается производством бараньей пряди из которой сама вяжет носки, и  оптом сдаёт перекупщикам. Абдумалик на фото в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Abdumalik O. is a man of 30 years of age, married and has three children. Abdumalik works in a collective farm as a field aerator. He also does animal husbandry. To increase his business he wants to buy several heads of sheep on credit. His wife spins yarn from sheep's wool and then makes socks which she sells in wholesale to retailers. Abdumalik is pictured on the photo on the day of getting the loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising of cattle and sales

loans.name: Roselindo

texts.es:
Roselindo es socia del Banco Comunal Trigales.
Roselindo es soltero y tiene 35 años, Roselindo tiene un restaurante – Polleria llamado Rico Rico, que esta ubicado en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con el apoyo de 3 personas.
Roselindo necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas y una refrigeradora.
Los sueños de Roselindo son ampliar su negocio y tener otra sucursal.
texts.en:
Roselindo is a member of the communal bank "Trigales". Roselindo is single and is 35 years old. Roselindo has a restaurant called "Rico Pico" that is located in a space that he rents. The restaurant's specialty is chicken. He works every day at the restaurant and he counts on the help of three employees. Rosolindo needs a loan of $500 (1,500 Soles) that he will use to buy pots and pans and a refrigerator. Roselindo's dreams are to make is business grow and to open another "Rico Pico" restaurant.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots and pans and a refrigerator

loans.name: Ozodakhon

texts.en:
Ozodakhon T. lives in the town of Isfara in the Sugd region of Tajikistan. Her husband works far away from home, currently in Russia. Together they have two school-aged children. Ozodakhon has to spend a lot of money on their education because her husband doesn’t earn enough. She cares for two cows, and would now like to borrow $1200 USD to buy more calves. In this way she hopes to earn more and cover all her dear children's expenses.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
casado y tiene 3 hijos.

se dedica a la "albañileria"

cuando termino sus estudios, empezo como ayudante y tiempo despues, con lo que aprendio comenzo por su propia cuenta.

Es muy conocido por su vecindario y a tendio mucho trabajo, el detalle es que cuenta con muy poca herramienta y material, como palas, madera.

solicita el apoyo, para la compra de estos materiales para trabajar mas comodo, ya que, con lo que con lo que cuenta es prestado.

Apoyemos grandes personas como el, que necesitan de grandes personas que lo apoyen.
texts.en:
José is married and has 3 children. He is a brick layer. When he finished his studies, he started as a helper. With what he had learned, he was later able to start on his own. He is very well known in the neighborhood, and he has had a lot of work. The problem is that he has very few tools and materials like shovels and wood. He is asking for support to buy these materials and make his work easier. The tools he works with now are borrowed. We (Admic Nacional) support great people like José who need great people (like Kiva lenders) to support them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material

loans.name: Cham Nap

texts.en:
O. Cham Nap, 29, raises a few pigs and typically earns $3 per day. His wife, Sea Sophea, 27, sells desserts and eggs and has a daily income of $2.50. Together, they have one young child. 

Their family expenses are a bit high since the price of goods and services keeps going up relative to their small amount of income. With the current difficult economic downturn, they are trying their best to generate more income to maintain their moderate standard of living. 

They want to take out a loan of $1000 to buy pigs to raise. Basically, Cham Nap hopes he will be able to build a new house, improve his child’s education, and ensure his family sustainability.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 22 years old and she is single. She has been a clothes seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She belongs to M/hanuni  group loan (Group code 2031).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of  approximately  US$ 90. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.  


Mariam is requesting her second  loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Second Hand Clothing Group

texts.en:
This is Joseph M. B., John K., Pa Mohamed K. and Safie K.. They call their group Second Hand Clothing, named after their businesses. They are business people in Makeni, selling second-hand clothes. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a lot of meaningful impacts on the lives and businesses of these people. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again asking for a new loan of Le 1,200,000 for each to further strengthen their businesses.

Joseph (left) is the leader of the group. He is age 39 and married with three children. Joseph was born in a village called Loka Masana, in northern Sierra Leone. His wife is a businesswoman too, and their children are still attending school. Joseph has been a businessman for eleven years now, selling second-hand clothes. With this loan, he will be able to buy at least three bales of second-hand clothes. A bale of second-hand clothes is usually sold at Le 360,000 in Freetown.

loans.use: To buy more clothing

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roberto Antonio C. C., tiene la edad de 47 años habita en la borgoña , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tiene dos hijas las cuales trabajan y le apoyan con los gastos de la familia , los planes hacia su hogar es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Roberto desde hace 21 años se dedica a la agricultura , el mayor problema que se le presenta son las plagas , él inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes futuro es mejorar las condiciones del cultivo , ya que con las indicaciones de nuestro técnico agrónomo espera tener mejores resultados .Con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y aplicar al cultivo con esto espera obtener una buena cosecha y vender a buen precio al mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto Antonio C. C. is 47 years old and lives in the Burgundy area, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife, who supports him with household activities. They have two daughters, who work and help with the household expenses. They plan to improve the conditions of their lives. For 21 years, Mr. Roberto has worked in agriculture. The biggest problems that he has in this sector are the plagues. He began this activity with the support of his parents. His plans for the future are to improve the conditions of his crop, and with the instructions of an agricultural technician he hopes to have better results. With this loan, he is going to buy fertilizers and supplies and apply them to his crops. With this, he hopes to have a better harvest and sell his products at a good price at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia G. D. M. vive en el departamento D. La Libertad junto a su suegra y su dos hijos, ya que por la situación económica  el esposo se encuentra trabajando en Estados Unidos, Rosa  tiene una tienda en su casa desD. hace 6 años, la cual le permite generar ingresos para sus hijos , Rosa carece D. muchos productos como se pueD. ver en la fotografía en una tienda muy pequeña, pero Rosa quiere aprovechar estas vacaciones patronales ya que mucha gente viaja y transita por la calle donD. ella tiene ubicado su negocio es por eso que solicita este crédito para poder surtir su tienda y aprovechar sus ventas en el mes D. agosto.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia G. D. Mejia lives in the department of La Libertad together with her mother-in-law and her two children; because of the economic situation her husband is now working in the United States. Rosa has had a store in her house for 6 years, which helps her generate income for her children. Rosa lacks many products, as you can see in the photo of the small store, but Rosa wishes to take advantage of the holidays for the patron saints because many people travel and commute on the street where Rosa has her business. Rosa requests the loan in order to be able to stock her store and increase her sales in the month of August.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store with goods

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 45 year married with five children aged between 51/2 and 18 years. All her children go Rosemary is a 45 year married with five children aged between 51/2 and 18 years. All her children go to school. She resides and owns a two roomed house where she is staying with six people. Rosemary takes care of two additional family members aged 18 and 7.  There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area owning a restaurant in one of Kampala suburbs.  She uses public transport to and from shopping. Rosemary sells to an average of 10 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees rent feeding the family She has been in this business for the last four years Rosemary has been with MCDT for four years and servicing her ninth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more rice cooking oil wheat flour sugar and salt.  Rosemary is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a house in the available plot she bought from previous profits 
 

.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil wheat flour  sugar and salt

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mrs. Mary Jane N. is 42 years old, married with six children and a resident of Brgy, Tagda, in Hinigaran Negros Occidental. Mary Jane is a fish vendor, a suitable trade as she lives near the sea and has easy access to the local fisher folk's catch. Working in partnership with her husband, Cenon, she is determined to raise her six children well and provide all of them with a good future.

In 1998 she joined NWTF—Project Dungganon to have access to additional capital for her fish-vending business. She later used her loans and savings to build her own fishing boat, and the resulting profits from this move come to approximately PHP 10,000 per month, just enough to support the needs of her family. She now plans to use the PHP 19,000 loan from NWTF—Project Dungganon, her thirteenth consecutive loan from this MFI, as revolving working capital for her fish-vending business.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live lives that they can finally call honorable ones. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: For additional capital for fish-vending trade

loans.name: Felix Alberto

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, el caballero Felix T. se dedica a atender su propio negocio de alquiler de teléfono y a la vez a la venta de recargas electrónicas para celular, impresiones en negro y a colores y también alquila las computadoras con acceso a internet siendo este negocio un cyber.

La razón por la que el señor Felix solicitó el crédito es para la compra de papel bond para las impresiones, así como compra de discos compactos para la venta, tintas para la impresora y compra de memorias usb para su respectiva comercialización. Espera ser beneficiado con el crédito para continuar en su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de accesorios

loans.name: Neli Antonio's Group

texts.pt:
Neli António T., nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 56 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 04 filhas a primeira tem 37 anos de idade e não se recorda das idades dos últimos dois, estudou ate 3ª classe do antigo sistema de ensino, parou de estudar por falta de condições, sustenta apenas três netos que vivem com ela pois todas suas filhas estão no lar.

Neli nasceu e cresceu no bairro de Choupal em Maputo e mais tarde mudou-se para o bairro de Khongolote onde fixou a sua residência e vive com os netos. 

A sua fonte de rendimento é o negocio, possui uma banca no seu quintal onde vende produtos alimentares diversos, aprendeu a fazer o negocio desde criança com a mãe pois esta fazia o mesmo tipo de negocio. O seu rendimento diário varia de 100,00mt a 1.500,00mt com o qual sustenta a família e consegue poupar algum para melhorar a sua residência.

Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende comprar cimento e portas para concluir a sua obra.

Conheceu a Hluvuku de amigos, este e o primeiro empréstimo na instituição mas já trabalhou com outras instituições de crédito onde se beneficiou de empréstimos para investir no negocio.

Compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a outros empréstimos para mobilar a casa.
texts.en:
Neli António T. was born in the city of Maputo, is 56-years-old, is single, and is the mother of four daughters. The oldest is 37-years-old, and she doesn't remember the ages of the two youngest. She studied until third grade of the old school system but had to stop because of a lack of resources. She supports three grandchildren that live with her since all of her daughters live in her home. Neli was born and raised in the Choupal neighborhood in Maputo. Later on, she moved to the Khonglote neighborhood, where she established her home and lives with her grandchildren. Her source of income is her business. She has a business in her backyard where she sells various food items. She learned this business starting when she was young because her mother had the same type of business. Her daily income ranges from 100 meticais to 1,500 meticais, which she uses to support her family and to have some savings to improve her home. With her current loan of 10,000 meticais, she will buy cement and doors to finish her home. She found out about Hluvuku through friends. This is her first loan with the institution, but she has worked with other credit institutions who offered her loans to invest in her business. She promises to pay the loan back without any problems so she can receive other loans which she will use to furnish her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction material (cement, sand, doors, etc.)

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Mrs. Rufina P.'s dream is to give all of her children a proper education. A 60-year-old married woman, she owns a sari-sari (variety) store located at her house. She works hard for her children’s education and also to meet her family’s daily needs. A satisfied member of CEVI, she is currently applying for a loan of Php12,000 to buy goods for her store. This loan will surely help Rufina achieve her goal.

loans.use: Store Supplies

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es: El señor Jose se dedica a la venta y arreglo de bicicletas, en la cual ya lleva mas de 6 años en el oficio de la misma. El vive en casa de sus padres, tiene su taller por la Av. capitan Victor Ustariz Km. 8, el destino del credito es para poder comprar mas repuestos, y accesorios de bicicletas. El Sr. esta casado, tiene dos hijos pequeños, la esposa le colabora en el negocio de las bicicletas, adicamente trabaja  que esporadicamente trabaja como empleada domestica.
texts.en:
Jose sells and repairs bicycles. He has been doing this for over six years. He lives in his parents’ house. His shop is on Av. Capitan Victor Ustariz Km. 8. The loan is to be able to buy more spare parts and accessories for the bicycles. He is married and has two small children. His wife works with him in the bicycle business. Additionally, she works sporadically as a domestic employee.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts and accessories for bicycles

loans.name: Mr. Chantha Sin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twenty people and they all live in Chey Otdom village in Takeo province. Mr. Chantha S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He owns a small restaurant which sells items such as coffee, Chinese noodles with soup, and so on.
