These days she also runs it to help her young child get ahead, given that she is his sole means of support. She started seven years ago selling food from her house, and she subsequently has rented and outfitted a separate space for her enterprise.

She needs a loan of $400 USD, which she will repay over a period of six months, to invest into her business.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đào Thị X. 48 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1996, Vay vốn phát triển kinh tế gia đình chị đã lựa chọn mô hình chăn nuôi vịt đẻ chứng và thả cá. Hiện tai gia đình chị đang nuôi hơn 300 con vịt đẻ và các loại giống cá, Thu nhập từ vịt đẻ trứng bình quân mỗi ngày 250.000đ. Chồng chị và con trai lớn làm nghề thợ xây thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. 
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Đào Thị X. - 48 years old - joined the TYM Fund in 1996. Borrowing a loan to transform the family's financial situation, she chose the business of raising egg-laying ducks and farming fish. Currently, her family is tending to over 300 ducks and a variety of fish. The income from the egg-laying ducks is about 250,000 VND per day. Her husband and their eldest son both work in construction for an income of 3,000,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, her family wishes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in raising livestock. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising ducks and fish

loans.name: Sugdibek

texts.en: Sugdibek has his own business selling stationery. He isn’t married yet. He lives with his parents and this way he helps them to support the family. He goes to 2-3 different cities to purchase stationery for cheaper prices. He already owns a little store. He wants to take a loan to repair his little store and equip it in a modern style.

loans.use: Repairing and refurbishing the store he owns

loans.name: Grupo Miramesi Group

texts.es:
Hola nosotras somos el grupo Miramesi, esta es nuestra primera operacion en solicitud de creditos, nosotras formamos este grupo para poder salir adelante con nuestros negocios, yo Lidia G. soy la coordinadora del grupo tengo 33 años de edad y me dedico a la venta de lociones, cremas y otros productos de uso diario para damas, esta mercaderia es muy vendida ya que todas las mujeres usamos cremas, lociones etc, y en esta temporada tengo muchos pedidos, asi que necesito el credito para comprar un lote grande de producto y poder cubrir con todas las necesidades de mis clientes.
la Sra. Amalia R. ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, dicha pulperia es muy visitada por todos los que vivimos en esa zona ya que es la unica cercana en nuestra colonia,  la Sra. Elvira F. ella tiene 54 años de edad ella tambien se dedica a la venta de lociones y cremas, las cuales las vende de forma ambulante en nuestra colonia. cabe mensionar que con el esfuerzo que hemos realizado todas hemos logrado darle a nuestras familias el sustento tanto como alimenticio, salud y en procesos educativos, tenemos muchos años de conocernos.
texts.en:
Hello. We are the Miramesi group and this is is our first loan request. We formed this group in order to move forward with our businesses. I am Lidia G., the coordinator of the group. I am 33 years old and work selling lotions, creams and other daily skincare products for women. This merchandise sells very well as all women use creams and lotions. At this time of year I have many orders, and so I need credit in order to buy a large batch of product to cover the needs of my customers. Amalia R. works selling a range of popular products. Her grocery store is used by everyone who lives nearby as it is the only store in our neighbourhood. Elvira F. is 54 years old and she also works selling lotions and creams door-to-door in our neighbourhood. I finish by mentioning that with the hard work that each of us has put in we have been able to provide our families with sustenance, in terms of nutrition, health and education. We have known each other for many years.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of underwear for a small business.

loans.name: Kolika

texts.fr: Kolika L. est un mécanicien auto à Kpalimé, une ville situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agé de 45 ans, il est marié et père de 4 enfants. Il espère avec ce crédit donner plus de force à son activité en achetant des outils de travail lui permettant de mieux exécuter son activité. Par ricochet, il gagnera plus la confiance de sa clientèle ce qui lui permettra de tirer plus de profits pour la meilleure survie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kolika L. is an automechanic in Kpalimé, a town located north-west of Lomé, the capital of Togo. At age 45, he is married and the father of 4 children. He hopes, with this loan to strengthen his business, buying work tools which will enable him to be more effective at his work. This will also build confidence with his customers and allow him to earn greater profits, to better provide for his family.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools

loans.name: Marita Luz

texts.es:
Marita Es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Marita es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Marita junto a su esposo tienen un Restaurante – Chifa que esta ubicado cerca de un terminal terrestre, actividad que realiza por las tardes y noches, con la ayuda de 2 personales. Su esposo es mecánico y tiene un taller mecánico.   
Marita necesita préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos.
Los sueños de Marita son tener un local propio  y viajar al extranjero.
texts.en:
Marita is a member of the “Juanito” Communal Bank. Marita is married, 29 years old, and has 3 children. Along with her husband Marita has a Chinese restaurant located near a bus terminal, a business they run during the afternoons and evenings with the help of 2 employees. Her husband is a mechanic and has a repair shop. Marita needs a loan for 1000 soles to invest in buy parts. Marita dreams of having her own locale and traveling abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina sells cooked food and drinks. She hopes for the loan amount of N 120,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Jeanette Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Jeannette tiene una pulpería ubicada en el barrio Naciones unidas, la cual inicio desde hace tres años con dinero de la liquidación de su trabajo que laboraba en zona franca y con ayuda de su esposo, el cual trabaja en servicios de seguridad, doña Jeannette tiene 36 años, tiene dos hijos que estudian la secundaria uno de 15 y16 años. Uno de sus planes es poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos y que tengan una oportunidad en la vida diferente. Este es el tercer cicló en Afodenic de sus préstamo que son de muchos beneficios por que ha incrementado su inventario y en lo personal se siente respaldada por los créditos, con este préstamo va invertir en la compra de insumos diarios como pollo, carnes, grano básicos que es lo que el cliente consume mas, lo espera incrementar las ventas como captar mas cliente. A futuro es poder hacer más grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Jeanette has a grocery store in the Naciones Unidas neighborhood. She started it three years ago with the money she liquidated from her job in the French neighborhood and with the support of her husband, who works in security. Jeannette is 36 years old and has two children in secondary school, aged 15 and 16. One of her plans is to be able to give them a good education so they will have an opportunity for a different life. This is her third loan cycle with Afodenic. She has benefited greatly in her inventory and also personally, as she feels supported by the loans. She will invest this loan in the purchase of consumer goods such as chicken, meats, and basic grains, which are what her customers consume the most. She hopes to increase her sales as well as bring in more customers. In the future, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meats, chicken and other daily consumer products

loans.name: Ranodjon

texts.en:
Ranodjon P. is a widowed mother of two children. She sells kids' clothing in the central market of Dushanbe. She sells a wide variety of merchandise at reasonable prices. Ranodjon has been in this trade for nine years. She is trying to do everything she can to provide for her family and give her children a decent education. That is why she wants to continue expanding her business and grow her trade by increasing the number of her vending locations.

Ranodjon is requesting a loan of $650 to sustain her business and help ensure that it continues to provide enough income on which her family can live.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new goods to increase her stock.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Q. ha iniciado la labora de reconstrucción de su vivienda que por mucho tiempo había permanecido en mal estado y lo ha hecho con el propósito de mantener a su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos en edad escolar. 

Ella tiene la necesidad de adquirir a lo inmediato el dinero para la compra de los materiales de construcción y es por esta razón que espera confiadamente en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con dicho crédito y así saldrá adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Q. has begun the job of rebuilding her home. It has been in bad shape for a long time. She has done it for the purpose of supporting her family which is made up of two school-aged children.

She needs to get the money immediately to purchase the building materials. This is the reason she confidently puts her hopes in Ceprodel to benefit from this loan and therefore get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Mr. Hem P. is 54 years old and is a good father to his three children. All three of his children are single and enrolled in the local public school. He makes a daily income of $4.00 each day by selling firewood. He usually goes to a place full of wood pieces, although it is located far from his house, and collects and sells the wood. His wife, Mrs. Vaiy, sells a few grocery items from their home.

Hem P. is applying for a loan to purchase an ox, which he will use to transport the firewood, allowing him to sell it more efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase an ox

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 40 years old, married and has two children. He runs a shop where he sells electrical materials and services. He is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell, and wishes to extend his sincere thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more electrical materials to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is 32 years old. She is married and a mother with one child. Currently her child is in school at the community of Sefwi where they live. She operates a drinking spot where she sells all kinds of drinks such as soft, canned and bottle drinks etc. Ernestina has raised a wooden kiosk in which she sells the drinks.

She is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her child with a quality education for his future career. But she claims without adequate funds it can’t be possible to realize that dream. She has been running the drinking spot for three years.

She is humbly requesting your help (loan) to make her dream come true so that she would be more resourced to take care of her child and other family needs. With the loan, she wants to purchase increased stock of assorted drinks from the wholesalers to restock her shop. She belongs to the village bank called God time is the best.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks to upgrade her inventory.

loans.name: Ahètèmon

texts.fr:
O. Ahètèmon est née vers 1950 à Agbodjedo, un quartier de Cotonou, Bénin.  Ahètèmon est veuve et mère de quatre enfants dont trois sont majeurs.  À Cotonou, Ahètèmon est vendeuse de crevettes fumées.  Pour exercer son petit commerce, elle se rend chaque jour au grand marché international, DANTOKPA, où elle achète et revend ensuite sa marchandise. 

Vendeuse ambulante, Ahètèmon a dans ce marché des clientes fidèles à qui elle livre quotidiennement des  crevettes fumées. Pendant la saison des pluies au Bénin, la crue rendent la pêche difficile.  Les crustacées se faisant rares et deviennent chères. Ahètèmon veut néanmoins garder ses clientes.  Ahètèmon sollicite un crédit d’Alidé pour qu'elle peut acheter plus de crevettes.
texts.en:
O. Ahètèmon was born around 1950 in Agbodjedo, a district of Cotonou, Benin. She is a widow and the mother of four children, three of whom are of age. In Cotonou, Ahètèmon is a seller of smoked shrimp. To operate her small business, she goes each day to the grand international marketplace DANTOKPA, where she buys and then resells her merchandise. An itinerant seller, she has loyal customers at this marketplace to whom she delivers smoked shrimp on a daily basis. During the rainy season in Benin, the floods make fishing difficult. Shellfish are scarce and become pricey. Ahètèmon nevertheless wants to keep her customers. She is requesting a loan from Alidé, so that she can buy more shrimp.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy smoked shrimp

loans.name: Adrian De Jesus

texts.es: Adrian Jesús M.  S. tiene 35 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Adrian es un hombre muy luchador que le gusta su trabajo, a pesar de que algunas veces es muy agotador. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de tricitaxi. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que anteriormente se dedicaba a cuidar ganado. Pero con el dinero que lograba obtener compro una bicicleta, por lo que al principio fue un problema ya que no tenía la experiencia que necesitaba y que la obtuvo con el tiempo. El financiamiento que solicita es para brindarle  mejoras a su bicicleta y proporcionarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Su deseo es lograr que sus hijos sean unos profesionales ya que Adrian no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Adrian Jesús M. S. is 35 years old, is married, and is taking care of 2 children. He is a fighter and likes his work, even though, at times, it is very exhausting. He offers a tricitaxi (a bicycle-operated taxi) service. He has been pursuing this activity for more than 6 years. Before this, he raised livestock, but with the money from that, he succeeded in buying a bicycle. At first, he didn’t have the experience needed for this, but over time, he got it. This loan that he is requested will be used to make improvements to his bicycle and to provide a better service to his clients. His dream is to succeed and for his children become professionals, since Adrian didn’t have the opportunity to go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for his business

loans.name: Adijat

texts.en:
Adijat is a hair specialist and she also sells hair-cream and hair-extensions. She has been in this business for the past four years. She is 22 years old and married with a child. She resides at Lagos State, Nigeria.

Adijat has been with LAPO Microfinance for two years. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more hair-extensions and hair-cream to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair-extensions and hair-cream to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 49-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and four children. He has owned a pick-up and a grocery store for 13 years, and is successful because he is hard-working. His clients are family members, friends and neighbors. Ahmad set up his businesses because he wanted to improve his family’s income. When he first started out, he didn’t have a lot of cash.

Ahmad has requested a loan of $2,500 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for his store and do some maintenance work on his pick-up. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. In the future, Ahmad plans on expanding his businesses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store and do some maintenance work on his pick-up

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía es una mujer creativa y muy trabajadora, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre de dos hijas mayores de edad, quienes la apoyan, ella está divorciada, se dedica a la venta por catálogo de prendas de lencería, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace cinco años. Integra desde hace seis años el Banco Comunal “Siete Estrellas” donde se caracteriza por ser una socia puntual y colaboradora.
El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en la compra de prendas femeninas.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000 soles, comprará productos de lencería. La meta de Sofía es tener una boutique y también un taller de costura donde puedan realizar sus propios diseños y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sofia is a creative, hard-working woman. She is 46 years old and mother to two older daughters who help support her. She is divorced. She works in catalog sales of lingerie. She has worked in this for five years. Six years ago, she joined the communal bank “Siete Estrellas,” where she is known for being a punctual and active member.

The first loan that she received was for 300 Soles ($100 USD), which were invested in the purchase of feminine garments.

With this loan of 3,000 Soles ($1000 USD), she will buy lingerie products. Her goal is to have a boutique and also a sewing workshop from which she can produce her own designs and obtain better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lingerie

loans.name: Nhey

texts.en: Mrs. Nhey V. is a villager in Thol Louk village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2-hectar field to cultivate rice to earn for living. Aside from this she is a pig breeder. Since the second business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food for her business. Her husband, Mr. Ten Cheng, is a farmer and he also helps her on the businesses. Mrs. Nhey V. is 59 years old and the mother of two children two of whom are employed in a garment factory. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food for her business.

loans.name: Heddy

texts.en:
Heddy S. is from the village of New Village Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 32 years old. Heddy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Heddy runs a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products and dried goods products in the local community. Heddy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Heddy joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Heddy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Heddy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Heddy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional products to sell

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en: lqar N. is 40 years old. He is married and has two adorable daughters. Ilqar has always opted to make his living off his land and to work hard and grow with it. He decided to rear sheep and to dedicate himself to farming. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time, as he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background. He has been working independently for 9 years. Today, Ilqar wishes to increase the number of his sheep. For this reason, he would like to buy more sheep with the hope of increasing his income and improving the well-being of his home with the innumerable benefits that these special little animals provide for him. This is why he is requesting a loan of 1606 AZN. Extend your solidarity to Ilqar so that he can move forward to successfully and accomplish all of his goals.

loans.use: To purchase twenty sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Maria Belia

texts.en: Maria Belia is 38 years old.  She and her husband have a 10-year-old child.  Being a rice farmer, Maria believes that hard work is a must to succeed. Despite past failures, she is still eager to do her best to reap an income from her farm. She has sought the help of CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines. She applied for a loan of PHP 11,000, which she will use to purchase the fertilizers and other items needed at her farm.

loans.use: Fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Oeum

texts.en:
Oeum L., 46, has been married for some years; she and her husband have six children.  Two of their children are employed while the remaining four attend school. Oeum L. has been earning a living as a local grower since 2000. She grows vegetables on her own farmland, while her husband  decorates wood for buildings. 

Oeum L. wants to earn more income by raising ducks. Because Oeum L. doesn't have enough money, she would like to ask for a loan from Kiva through HKL to be used to buy ducks to breed for the purpose of producing eggs.

loans.use: To buy ducks to breed for producing eggs

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es: El señor José Dolores tiene 42 años de edad, su oficio es enderezado y pintura desde hace varios años, casado y con cuatro hijos todos estudiantes, el instalo su propio taller pero no tiene los equipos suficientes para dar un servicio de mejor calidad, la infraestructura no es la adecuada lo que mas quisiera es hacer un bajarete, pero tiene que trabajar ya que es su fuente de trabajo el cual espera a corto plazo poder tener un taller que preste todas las condiciones para atraer los clientes y seguir trabajando dignamente para su familia. con este financiamiento  desea construir un muro para esto comprara piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar a construir la obra todo esto con la necesidad de poder resguardar un poco mas a su familia ya que la delincuencia en el barrio asecha cada día.
texts.en:
José Dolores is 42 years old. He owns a panting and body work shop. He’s married and has two children in school. He installed his shop himself, but he doesn’t have enough equipment to provide a quality service. The infrastructure is not the best, and what he would like the most if to build a better roofing, but he needs to work, because this is his family’s only income. Still he hopes he would be able to improve his shop in the short term to attrack more clients and continue working to support his family. He wants to use this loan to build a wall, so he needs to buy stones, sand, cement and steel to start the works. He wants to use it as a fence to protect this family and crime is increasing every day in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stones, sand, cement and steel to build a wall

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a 57-year-old divorced mother with five children. Three of the children are in school while the others are working and living on their own. She operates a drinking spot where she sells all kinds of soft drinks such as canned malts, Coke, Pepsi, sachet water, etc. She is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide for her business and three children in school. She has been running the drinking spot for ten years now. She needs the loan assistance to buy assorted drinks to upgrade her stock. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks to upgrade her inventory

loans.name: Sarem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarem Y., 67, has one son who is an English teacher. She lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sarem has been selling groceries for 10 years. Her husband assists her in the business. Sarem hopes to expand her business to better respond to her customers' needs. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase additional grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for resale

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina es socia del Banco Comunal 30 D. Junio.
Dina es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Dina tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo e hijos. Además Dina viaja a las ferias D. la región en donD. venD. frutas y D. las ferias compra cereales.
Dina necesita un préstamo D. 1750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gaseosas, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños D. Dina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the 30 D. Junio community bank. She is 50 years old, married and has 5 children. Dina owns a restaurant in a rented building, a business that she operates with help from her husband and children. She also travels to markets in the region where she sells fruits and buys grains. Dina needs a 1750-soles loan that she will use to buy cold drinks, rice, and sugar. Her dreams are to see her children adopt professional careers and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for restaurant business.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 femmes du groupe Danaya sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles au quartier Noukoula de la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Baouréli, quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers essentiellement l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires et de l’habillement.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les 4 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe  Danaya sont à leur  5 prêt solidaire.
Elles comptent utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires pour constituer un important stock de concentrée de tomates, d’oignons, de sounbala, de cubes maggies, d’huiles alimentaires, du gombo, des variétés de feuilles séchées. 
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement à Bamako et sur place auprès des producteurs et grossistes. Elles effectuent leurs ventes à Noukoula et au marché de Konobougou, au comptant en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000FCFA qui servira à subvenir aux dépenses ayant trait à la nourriture, à la scolarité des enfants, à la santé et le reste, réinvesti dans les affaires.
texts.en:
All four women from the Danaya group are married. On average they are 45 years of age with three children, and all live in traditional households in the Noukoula neighborhood of Konobougou, in the Baouréli prefecture of the 4th administrative region of Mali. These women got to know each other through family ties and are retailers of various goods, for the most part culinary condiments and clothing. Having fully repaid their four previous loans, the women from the Benkadi group are now requesting a fifth group loan. They intend to use it to buy large quantities of food condiments, and create a sizable stock supply of tomato paste, onions, sounbala (spicy seasoning), Maggi cubes, vegetable oil, gombo, and various dried herbs. They mainly get their supplies from local producers and wholesalers and also in Bamako. They then sell their products in Noukoula and at the Konobougou market, for cash or on credit, to a customer base of both women and men. They hope to achieve average monthly earnings of 25,000 FCFA each, which will be used to contribute to family expenses regarding food, children’s education and healthcare, the remainder being reinvested in their business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food condiments

loans.name: Sulmira

texts.es:
La Sra. Sulmira, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 46 años, 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

 Su fuerza y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos y familia, por idea propia decidió iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes que poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles comprará ,conservas de pescado en cajas de diferentes marcas , arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y parte del dinero lo invertirá en comprar detergentes , jabón de tocador y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Su sueño es tener un Minimarket y su lema es todo lo que se propone  lo cumple, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad que siempre esperaba.
texts.en:
Sra. Sulmira is a member of the Communal Bank “Nuestra Señora de la Paz” (Our Lady of Peace), which is in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 46 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still dependents.

Due to her strength and desire to move her children and family forward, Sulmira came up with the idea to start her own business selling groceries. Over time her business increased as she gained more experience in this type of activity. She is becoming well known and admired among her customers.

With this loan of 2000 PEN, she will buy cases of canned fish of different brands, sacks of rice and sugar, packets of noodles, milk, detergents, bathroom soaps, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue providing good service to her customers. Her dream is to open a mini-market and her slogan would be “we have everything you need”. She thanks Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity she always wanted.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky T. hopes that the loan she has requested will enable her to grow her food selling business to make more profit and thus help her support her dream of rising up from all forms of poverty starting by increasing her income. Despite her poverty and the small profit of her business at the moment, Vicky believes that in time it will grow and she can give her three children (aged two to nine years old) a life that they will be most happy. She wants her children to attain the highest level of education possible to have more options to cope with life’s challenges.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and other things needed for her food preparation/sales business.

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en:
This loan is being requested by a group of 15 people who all live in Lech Pram village in Kandal province. Mr. Samnang K. is 48 years old and has been selected by the members as village bank president.  The loan recipients will use it for different purposes. 

Mr. Samnang K. and his wife, Mrs. Sroy Nut, are grocery sellers who earn a small income to support their family.  Mr. Samnang K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge his business. With this loan, he hopes to increase income and improve his family's standard of living. This couple has four children; three are seamstresses in the garment factory while the youngest is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es: Doña María T. tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de Frutas, lleva 8 años de vender  y en ello nos solicita un préstamo para poder aumentar su capital y poder cubrir su demanda, ella vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo  en el que se dedican en la misma actividad, su residencia es en el paraje Pujacar  del Cantón Xantún, Totonicapán. Y en ello poder ayudar a sus hijos para darles mejor educación y nivel de vida
texts.en:
María T. has a small business selling fruit. She has been selling for eight years. She is asking us for a loan to be able to increase her capital to be able to cover her demand. She lives with her three children and her husband, who works at the same activity. They live in the Paraje Pujacar in the Xantú canton in Totonicapán. She wants to be able to help her children by giving them a better education and a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana A. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Bibiana owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Bibiana has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 55,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2005, Bibiana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bibiana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. Bibiana is requesting a new loan, her 4th, of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia A. K. is 27 years old, widowed and has two children who are seven years old and two-and-a-half years old. Her business is located in Kamukunji, in a very business market in Nairobi. She has a business in which she has been selling wheelbarrows, metal boxes, chicken feeders and other items to the local people for the past six years. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers, hence customers are spoiled for choice and high prices of raw materials. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Teresia is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more wheelbarrows to expand her business. In future, she hopes to expand her business and serve more people. She describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To purchase wheelbarrows for resale

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas de 9 años comercializa frutas al por mayor, distribuyendo a los grandes comerciantes en los diversos puntos de venta de su localidad. Las ventas son muy buenas logrando quedarse solo con las cajas vacías, por tal motivo se siente muy contento y satisfecho con el trabajo que realiza. En tanto su esposo, la ayuda en el trabajo, transportando su mercadería en el camión que poseen. Este negocio es un sostén muy bueno para su familia por lo que ha decidió incrementar su capital de trabajo y vender en otros mercados aledaños a su ciudad. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, conoce  bastante la dinámica del trabajo en su grupo comunal y esta muy satisfecha de ser parte de ella, será muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del crédito que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con este crédito, comprará mas mercadería en frutas de temporada.
texts.en:
Norma, 47, lives with her husband and four children in her own home. For over nine years she has dealt in wholesale fruit, distributing her wares to the large sellers at the various points of sale where she lives. Sales are very good, leaving her alone with the empty boxes, which makes her feel very happy and satisfied with the work she does. Her husband helps her in the work, transporting her merchandise in the truck they own. This business is an excellent support for her family and she has decided to increase her working capital and sell to other markets surrounding her city. This is the seventh loan with MFP; she is well acquainted with the work dynamic in her communal bank and is highly satisfied to be part of it. She will be very responsible in making payments and would like to thank those persons who will originate the loan she is seeking, which will be quite helpful in the progress of her business. With this loan, she will buy more merchandise in the area of seasonal fruits.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more fruit

loans.name: Munezero Group

texts.fr:
Renovat ManiraK. est un commerçant âgé de 32 ans qui habite la Commune urbaine de Buyenzi en mairie de Bujumbura. Il fait la couture il ya de cela 12 ans. Il a fait ses études secondaires et a obtenu son Diplôme A3 en section paramédicale. Son épouse, U. Assiya, est aussi commerçante. Il arrive au 8e cycle dans le crédit communautaire avec Turame. 

Il a 3 enfants âgés de 8 ans, 6ans et 2ans qui étudient en 1ere  année sauf le cadet qui n’étudie pas encore.

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  acheter des matériaux de couture comme les tissus et autres accessoires afin d’augmenter les produits de couture qu’il vend aux clients. Il espère dans le futur, avoir son capital propre pour acheter des machines modernes de couture et ainsi être  à mesure de subvenir à ses besoins divers comme sa propre maison, assurer les frais de scolarité de son enfant et autres besoins essentiels. 

 Il est un des membres du groupe  communautaire« Munezero ».
texts.en:
Renovat ManiraK. is a 32 year old retailer who lives in Buyenzi, an urban community which is part of the Bujumbura mayorship. He has been sewing for 12 years. He attended secondary school and got his A3 diploma in the paramedical section. His wife, U. Assiya, is also a retailer. He is currently in the 8th cycle in the community loan with Turame. He has 3 children aged 8, 6 and 2 years old who are in their first year at school, except for the youngest one who does not attend school yet. He is requesting a Kiva loan to buy sewing supplies such as cloths and other accessories in order to increase the production of sewed items that he sells to his customers. In the future, he hopes to have his own capital to buy modern sewing machines and thus be able to provide for the various needs of his household, pay for his children’s school fees and meet other basic needs. He is a member of the “Munezero” community group

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies like cloths and other accessories in order to increase the production of sewed items that he sells to customers

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
Eleuterio nació en la ciudad del Cusco y actualmente  vive en la misma ciudad junto con su esposa y sus hijos a quienes brindar amor y respeto. 

Eleuterio tiene 37 años y se decidida a la venta de ropa, Actualmente, Eleuterio le pueden encontrar en su puesto de venta que está ubicado en la calle Trinitarias de la ciudad Cusco, los 7 días de las semana, desde las 9 mañana hasta bastante tarde. Hace 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le va excelente. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Eleuterio espera recibir $400 USD. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo camisas, pantalones, etc.  

Eleuterio pertenece al banco comunal  “El Amanecer”. Ya son varios ciclos que participa en el banco comunal y le han reafirmado la confianza para los préstamos.
texts.en:
Eleuterio was born in Cusco and currently lives there with his wife and children, whom the couple offers love and respect. Eleuterio is 37 years old and sells clothes for a living. You can find Eleuterio in his market stall located on Cusco's Trinitarias street seven days a week from 9 in the morning until very late. He has sold clothes for ten years, and he is doing very well. With his next loan, Eleuterio hopes to receive $400 USD. He would like to use the money to buy merchandise like shirts, pants, etc. Eleuterio belongs to the community bank "El Amanecer" ("The Dawn"). He has participated in the community bank for multiple loan cycles, and the group has reaffirmed his confidence in loans.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes to sell

loans.name: Chhengheng

texts.en:
Mr. Chhengheng I. and his wife, Mrs. Saro Ul, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for more than sixteen years and have three daughters. Chhengheng’s wife is shown in the photo.

Chhengheng has been a carpenter since 2005. Besides this business, he is a fisherman as well. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was sixteen years old, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Chhengheng is requesting a loan of US$350 to purchase a boat motor for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor for his fishing business

loans.name: Marisa Nely

texts.es: La señora vive en casa de sus suegros en la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada y tiene un niño pequeño que todavía no va al colegio, su esposo trabaja como chofer de minibús. Su actividad es la de venta de buzos deportivos sueltos y conjuntos de niños. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital de trabajo, para comprar mas mercadería y abastecerse para poder tener mas clientes y de esta manera su negocio crezca,  es la sexta vez que obtiene un crédito con la Institución y ya fue parte de Kiva en tres oportunidades.
texts.en:
She lives in her in-laws’ house in La Paz’s Las Lomas neighborhood. She’s married and has a young son who doesn’t go to school yet. Her husband is a minibus driver. She sells athletic sweatshirts and children’s dress sets. She is asking for funds to increase working capital to buy more merchandise and to increase stock in order to have more customers so her business can grow. This is the 6th time she’s gotten a loan with the Institution and she’s been part of Kiva on three occasions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jocelinda

texts.es: Jocelinda, de 25 años, es una mujer ambiciosa y luchadora, vive con sus padres y su hermana Lisbet de 22 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo. Cuenta que desde los 15 años prepara panes para venderlos en su localidad y ahora ya tiene su propia panadería, donde vende tortas y pasteles; pero con ello creció sus responsabilidad, ya que su hermana Lisbet deseaba estudiar enfermería en la universidad, es ahí que Jocelinda decidió incursionar a la agricultura ayudando a sus padres en la siembra de arveja, papa y hortalizas. Es así que el fin de semana va a supervisar los cultivos y negocia los precios en el mercado central, tanto de su ciudad como el de la capital. Lo que más le gusta a Jocelinda es ayudar a su familia, ahora quiere comprar mayor mercadería para su panadería, además desea adquirir su propio terreno, de esa manera poder cultivar mayor cantidad de hortalizas y abastecer la demanda que genera. Es el primer crédito con MFP y está segura que su banco comunal la ayudará a salir adelante. Con los mil soles, completará el crédito que ahorró, para cultivar 4 bolsas de semilla de arveja, abono e insumos para la nueva cosecha de este mes.
texts.en:
Jocelinda is 25 years old. She is an ambitious and hard working person. She lives with her parents and with her sister Lisbet who is 22 years old. They live in their own home located in Palcamayo. Since she was 15 years old she has been baking breads for sale in her neighborhood and today she has her own bakery from where she sells pies and cakes. Her responsibilities soon grew when her sister, Lisbet, wanted to study to be a nurse at the university. So Jocelinda decided to study agriculture to help her parents in the harvests of sweet peas, potatoes, and vegetables. On the weekends she goes to supervise the fields and she barters for the best prices in the central markets in her city and in the capital. Jocelinda's favorite thing to do is to help her family. She would like to purchase in wholesale a stock of merchandise for her bakery with the goal of one day having her own fields. She will be able to have larger harvests of vegetables and be able to meet the demand. With the one thousand soles she requests she will supplement her savings to be able sow 4 bags of pea seeds, purchase fertilizer and other materials for the new harvest this month.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase four bags of pea seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lyl

texts.en:
Lyl S. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lyl owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lyl has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lyl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan that Lyl has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Haja.  She is married and has two children, ages 12 and nine. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because she needs them to help her with her domestic work while she is selling.

In 2005, Haja established her food items and household utensil business.  She began her business to generate enough income to support her husband and provide a livelihood for them so they can educate their children.  Her business is open seven days a week and 12 hours a day. Haja earns about 4,380,000 SLL every month from this business.  She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy additional stock.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit by approximately 657,000 SLL.  

In the future, Haja plans to develop her business and to help her family live a comfortable life.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more household utensils for sale

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.ar: حمزه عمره 27 سنة  متزوج ولديه ولدان طموح يعمل في مجال تجارة السيارات منذ اكثر من 10 سنوات تاريخه الاقتراضي في المجموعة جيد جدا ملتزم  يحب عائلته ويريد لها التطور يهدف من خلال طلب  قرض من المجموعة  توسيع مصلحته وشراء سيارات جديدة  للمصلحة وهو محبوب جدا من محيطه واكثر زبائنه هم  اقاربه وجيرانه واصدقائه لأنه ملتزم بالعمل يواجه صعوبة في السيولة وقد اتيحت له فرصة الى جعل المصلحة خاصة له.

loans.use: purchase a new vehicle for the busniess

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya, and has been doing dairy farming for 4 years.  He has a family of 3.

He has applied for a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He says the loan and purchase of a dairy cow will make his dairy business more profitable.  He adds that the milk will also be consumed by the family as well as sold to pay for the education of the children.  He wants to venture into the wholesale dairy business.

He says his challenge remains animal diseases.  He appreciates the partnership with Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ai

texts.en: Ai C. is a 29-year-old woman who has been living in Phnom Penh City of Cambodia. To earn of living, Ai C. is employed in a garment factory since 2008. She has a formal salary every month in order to support her family’s expenses. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a building worker. This couple has give birth to three children, all of whom are single and still living under their roof.  Ai C. is concerned that she faces difficulties in traveling to her workplace. She and her husband always travel to work by hiring a taxi or walking because they don't have their own vehicle. To solve the problem, Ai C. has requested a loan of $300 to be used to buy a secondhand motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita E., from the village of Maputi, Naawan, Iligan City, is 44 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Charita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. Engaged in her business for over a year, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Charita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI that was used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory, she is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase more products to sell, including beverages and biscuits. This will be Charita's third loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vicente Martín

texts.es:
Vicente Martín R. L. tiene 30 años de edad, Es casado vive con su esposa y junto a sus hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Vicente Martín se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño seria  mejorar la calidad de vida.

Le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Vicente Martín R. L. is 30 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has 4 children.

The TRES DE NOVIEMBRE community bank has 28 members and is located 90 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Vicente Marín is a farmer who grows rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  He buys his products in Mata de Cacao and makes his sales in the Matilde Esther shopping center and in Bucay.

He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his rice, banana, corn, cacao, orange and cassava crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to improve his quality of life.  He enjoys going out for walks with his family.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: The Amna Muhammad Altaf Group

texts.en:
Amna is married and the mother of three sons and two daughters. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family in an area named Kot nihal singh in Okara, a small city in Pakistan that is known for its agriculture industry. Amna sews clothes for her neighbors and works as a housewife to provide for her family and share the family’s financial burden with her husband. All of her children are attending school, except for the youngest who is still too young. Amna is literate and she teaches students in her home to earn extra income.

Amna’s husband is M. A.. He is involved in a dairy business and has a buffalo at home that provides milk to sell. He has a number of customers in the neighborhood and earns a good monthly income. Amna is applying for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to purchase another buffalo to increase the family’s ability to sell milk and serve more clients. Amna is hopeful that, with this loan investment, her husband will be able to increase his business profit.

Amna is a regular Asasah loan recipient and this will be her third loan. She has a good repayment record and has never missed a loan group meeting.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Lisbeth Maria

texts.es: Lisbeth tiene 37 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijas que se encuentran en edad escolar  ella se dedica al comercio aproximadamente dos años actualmente tiene una bodega ubicada en su domicilio adicionalmente el padre de sus hijas le pasa una pensión mensual,el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para sacar su0 licencia de conducir, se le otorga el financiamiento por contar con buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is 37 years old.  She is a single mother who lives in her own home together with her four school-age daughters.  Lisbeth has been in the sales business for approximately two years.  She currently has a grocery store located in her home and her daughters' father provides her with a monthly allowance.

Lisbeth will use her loan money to get her drivers license.  She is being given this loan because she has good references and both the desire and ability to repay the loan.

loans.use: Drivers license

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en:
Pablito P. is from the village of Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 49 years old. Pablito is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Pablito owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Pablito has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Pablito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pablito has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Pablito is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Pablito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Apec Al Ouma Gueume Sa Bopp 2 Group

texts.fr: Gueume sa Bopp  2 est un sous groupe complémentaire  de la cellule APEC  Al Ouma Gueume Sa Bopp de la localité de Yoff. C’est un groupement mixte de 21 personnes qui habitent  presque dans le même  quartier. Ils sont représentés par madame Sokhna D.  qui est l’adjointe a la présidente. Madame D. s’active depuis plus de 30 ans dans le commerce de tissus, de chaussures, d’huile de palme et d’autres produits divers. Elle s’active aussi dans la petite restauration. Elle  a choisi son activité par passion mais  aussi par soucis de se procurer des revenus  qui peuvent servir pour la satisfaction de besoins personnels. Elle sollicite un crédit de 2 250 000 frs pour le groupe. Ce montant est prévu pour l’achat de produits destines a renforcer et a diversifier  leur stock. Leur principal objectif est d’accroitre leur revenu et  d’améliorer  les conditions de vie socio-économiques de leurs familles respectives.
texts.en:
Gueme sa Bopp 2 is a group belonging to the branch APEC Al Ouma Gueueme Sa Bopp in the village of Yoff. This is a mixed group of 21 individuals living near each other. They are represented by Mrs. Sokhna D., who is the Vice-President. Mrs. D. has been working for over 30 years selling fabrics, shoes, palm oil and miscellaneous items. She also prepares food for sale. She has chosen this work because she was attracted to it but also in the desire to earn an income allowing her to provide for her personal needs. She is seeking a loan of 2,250,000 West African Francs for her group. This loan is destined for purchasing various goods to increase the members’ stock. The main objective of the group members is to increase their income and to improve the socioeconomic conditions of their respective families. 

About this loan:
Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. 

Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas),  Al Ouma has evolved its mission to work with adults as well as children.   They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.

Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members.  Members typically put in $2 USD per week.  Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients.

loans.use: Bolstering business capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new tires & paint his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Tashpulat

texts.ru: Казиев Ташпулат проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование-среднее. Уже год как занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа мелко-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Tashpulat K. lives in J.Rumy.  His is 50 years old, married, and has two children.  He has a high school education.  He has been working in animal husbandry for a year.  He is raising his flock so he might later sell them. He is taking out a loan to buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Monica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Monica tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa de su suegra con su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande,una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Monica vive en la parte céntrica de este distrito y cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida como salchipapas, salchipollos y gaseosas. Vende su comida y bebidas por las noches durante las horas de cenar. Tiene 2 años desarrollando su negocio. Monica es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con clientela ya establecida.  Cuenta con una refrigeradora, mesas, sillas y un carrito sanguchero, una unidad móvil no motorizada que viene equipada con todas las herramientas para preparar su comida. Monica solicita un crédito para comprar un nuevo refrigerador para mejor guardar sus productos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Monica  es conocida para Edpyme Alternativa, siendo éste su segundo crédito con la institución. Monico manejó bien su primer préstamo y tiene un buen historial creditico.
texts.en:
Monica is 27 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in her mother-in-law's home, with her husband and children, in Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area which is located in Piura province, in the region of the same name, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.  Monica lives in the central part of this district and has access to the basic services of water and electricity.

Monica's business is making and selling food such as salchipapas (a fast food made from thinly-sliced, pan-fried sausage or hot dog, french fries and condiments), salchipollos (a similar fast food but made with chicken) and sodas.  She sells her food and drinks in the evenings at dinner time.  Monica has been in her business for two years.  She is very well known in her area and has an established customer base.  She has a refrigerator, tables, chairs and a sandwich cart (a non-motorized vehicle which comes equipped with all the tools necessary for preparing her meals).

Monica is requesting this loan to buy a new refrigerator so that she can keep her products fresh.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Monica is already known to Edpyme Alternativa as this is her second loan with the institution.  She managed her first loan well and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator to keep the meals that she prepares and sells fresh

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a thirty-four-year-old divorced  man with four children and  he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the wholesale business for four years. He started with a "boda boda" (motorcycle transport) business and saved to start a shop. His hardship is loss of goods during transportation from Kampala and his vision is bigger business and a permanent residential house, plus educating the children. Joseph intends to use the credit facility to buy sodas and books for resale.

loans.use: To buy sodas and books for sale.

loans.name: Samson Mwangi

texts.en:
Samson has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 10 years. He is 37 years old and single.

Samson was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and cultivate the land for planting season. In the future, Samson hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to cultivate the land for planting season

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema sells fish. She is 32 years old and married with four children. One of them goes to school. Neema requested a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Nou is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. She sells fresh fish in the Baray market and makes around $2 in profits each day. 

She has a life partner in her husband who works on their farm. When he has time to spare from his farming business, he goes fishing in the local lake.

Nou is asking for a loan of $800 to rent a machine to plow her existing farmland, and to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds.

Nou has four children: two are employed as sewing workers in a factory, and two are married and live in their own houses.

loans.use: to rent a machine to plow her farmland, and to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds.

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Necitas is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Necitas has a retail shop that sells biscuits, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

Necitas is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Necitas hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nieves works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Nieves is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. 

Nieves has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home and send her child to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Jane has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which she has had for two years. To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jane hopes to generate greater profits and buy herself new clothes. In the future, Jane hopes to own a vehicle.

Jane is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital. Jane's group is comprised of seven hardworking women.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Graciela Maria

texts.es:
Graciela de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia, contando con los servicios de agua y luz,  está ubicada en el distrito de Pimentel que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se dedica a la pesca y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Graciela es la venta de productos de primera necesidad (venta de arroz, leche, aceite, azúcar, etc.), en su domicilio desde hace unos 3 años, al encontrarse su negocio en su casa puede atender a cualquier hora, lo que le permite diferenciarse de otras tiendas y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar.

El crédito solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1500 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y poder ampliar su negocio con otros productos una vez que sus ventas aumenten.  El sueño de Graciela es tener más adelante una tienda más grande que le genere mayores ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y lo logrará con su trabajo y empeño.
texts.en:
Graciela, 34, lives with her husband and three children in her own house which has running water and electricity.  It is located in Pimentel which belongs to the province of Chiclayo.  This area is known for its fishing and tourism.

Graciela sells basic need groceries (rice, milk, oil, sugar, etc.) out of her house, where she has been in business for three years.  Since the store is in her home she can attend to customers at any hour of the day, which gives her a competitive edge over other stores.  This allows her to increase her income and cover household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy more merchandise and expand her business with other products to increase sales.  Graciela's goal for the future is to have a large store that will generate more income so she can give her family a better lifestyle, through her hard work and efforts.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to expand her store.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 26 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorelie has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

Lorelie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.  Lorelie has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Lorelie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Flora; tiene 65 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 6 hijos todos ellos independientes; La socia se dedica al comercio  minorista, la socia  desea invertir el crédito en la compra de ganados y animales menores, como cuyes, aves de corral, la socia se dedica a la venta de carne, compra y venta de ganados, ovejas, compra y venta de animales menores como cuyes, aves de corral;  la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una vaca,  cuyes y aves de corral pollos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "FUENTE DE VIDA” (Fountain of Life). It is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Flora, ia 65 years old. She is married and has 6 children, all of them self-reliant. The member is engaged in the retail trade. She wants to invest the loan in buying poultry and small animals such as guinea pigs and poultry. The member sells meat, buys and sells cattle and sheep as well as small animals such as guinea pigs and poultry. The member is asking for the loan in order to buy a cow, guinea pigs and poultry.

The member is grateful for the support given her and likewise agrees to make the repayments of her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy a cow, guinea pigs and poultry

loans.name: Reynaldo Jose

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo, es un pequeños agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , los planes hacia su familia es brindarle una mejor condición de vida , don Reynaldo desde hace varios años de dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta so n las plagas que invaden el cultivo , ya que está plantación  presenta malezas , la planta no tiene un buen color y sus hijos de piña no crecen los suficiente para ser sembrados , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva ya que sin estos programas de ayuda para personas humilde y es muy escasos recursos no fuese posible darle mantenimiento a diversos tipo de cultivos .
texts.en:
Reynaldo, is a small-scale farmer  in the Ticuantepe area.  His plan is to provide his family with a better standard of living.  

Reynaldo has grown pineapples for several years. The biggest issue that arises is pests that invade his crop. Since his plantation has weeds, the plant doesn't have a good color, and the side shoots don't grow enough to be planted.  

He appreciates the support that Afodenic offers through Kiva funding, as without these assistance programs for poor people, and given his scarce resources, it wouldn't be possible for him to maintain the different types of crops he has.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en:
Wilhelmina is single with no children. She is 68 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Wilhelmina is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase fertilizer for the rice . 
Wilhelmina has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Wilhelmina hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for rice

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
Don Silvio lleva años desempeñandose como guarda de seguridad, tambien su esposa administra una pequeña pulperia y palmea trotillas en su casa y ah si cubrir todos los gastos.
Con el credito anterior logro comenzar un cuarto el cual no termino, y que continuara  y que espera terminar. Ya que con este credito comenzara su muro de su vivienda, ya que se han dado muchos robos en el barrio, y quiere dar mejor seguridad a su familia como  reguardar  su propiedad.
Sus cuatro hijos siguen estudiando, y que espera poder seguir apoyando para que logren mejores condiciones de oportunidad en la vida.
texts.en:
Silvio has been working as a security guard for years. His wife runs a small general store and makes tortillas to sell to help cover all their expenses.
Silvio used his previous loan to start building a bedroom for his house. It is not finished yet, but he plans to keep building and finish it. With this loan, he will start building a wall around his home, as there have been a lot of robberies in his neighborhood and he wants to keep his family safe and protect his property.
His four children are still in school, and he hopes to continue being able to support them to give them better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to build a wall to protect his property.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more peppers and bitter ball (a vegetable) for her business.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Oeun is 54 years old with 7 children. She is a farmer and she also catches fish for additional income. She has been a farmer for 29 years. This is her second loan with VisionFund. She requested a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to plant rice paddy on it. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income for family expenses and some savings and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to plant rice paddy on her farmland and buy fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is a 52-year-old single woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the hog-raising business for 5 years. Aurea works hard to improve her business. She extends support in sending her nephews and nieces to school.

Aurea has requested a loan to purchase feeds and piglets. She hopes to have a stable business and improved living conditions. She also hopes for her nephews and nieces to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and piglets

loans.name: Nidia Elena

texts.es: Doña Nidia Elena trabaja en la alcaldía, desempeña el cargo de obrera de servicios generales. Ella está interesada en realizar este crédito con el fin de  realizarle mejoras a su vivienda y poder comprar zinc, clavos, cemento, arena y bloques. Ella tiene que encontrar las formas de pagar las cuentas de su hogar y pagar la cuota del crédito. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación sabe que puede lograrlo, pues sus aspiraciones son de seguir proporcionándole mejoras a su hogar.
texts.en: Nidia Elena works in city hall, office of general services, and she holds the office of general services worker.
